quote: Do for this life as if you live forever, do for the afterlife as if you die tomorrow.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Do not be too hard, lest you be broken; do not be too soft, lest you be squeezed.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: He who busies himself with things other than improvement of his own self becomes perplexed in darkness and entangled in ruin. His evil spirits immerse him deep in vices and make his bad actions seem handsome.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: If poverty were a man, I would have slain him.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: People's hearts are like wild animals. They attach their selves to those that love and train them.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Let me alone, and go in search of someone else.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: The holder of authority is like the rider on a lion - he is envied for his position, but he well knows his position.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Do not share the knowledge with which you have been blessed with everyone in general, as you do with some people in particular; and know that there are some men in whom Allah, may He be glorified, has placed hidden secrets, which they are forbidden to reveal.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: To make one good action succeed another, is the perfection of goodness.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: I was not created to be occupied by eating delicious foods like tied up cattle.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: A man's measure is his will.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: No one has ever suffered from his people as I have.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Abstinence from sins is better than seeking help afterwards.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: A poor man is like a foreigner in his own country.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
author: George Orwell

quote: A deep sense of love and belonging is an irreducible need of all people. We are biologically, cognitively, physically, and spiritually wired to love, to be loved, and to belong. When those needs are not met, we don't function as we were meant to. We break. We fall apart. We numb. We ache. We hurt others. We get sick.
author: Brene Brown

quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: There are some people who hate my guts. But that goes with the territory.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in mind at the same time and still retain the ability to function.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

quote: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: I'm religious about salted butter. I don't understand how it happened that everyone thought we should all have sweet butter. I blame the French.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: Hope begins in the dark, the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing, the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Confidence comes from discipline and training.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: Where words fail, music speaks.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The world is so unpredictable. Things happen suddenly, unexpectedly. We want to feel we are in control of our own existence. In some ways we are, in some ways we're not. We are ruled by the forces of chance and coincidence.
author: Paul Auster

quote: A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: I'm not a fan of small talk but if you want to get into the big questions of life - your deepest regret, your greatest joy - then we're going to have a great chat.
author: Anh Do

quote: The top of one mountain is always the bottom of another.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Be not afraid of discomfort. If you can't put yourself in a situation where you are uncomfortable, then you will never grow. You will never change. You'll never learn.
author: Jason Reynolds

quote: Our greatest human adventure is the evolution of consciousness. We are in this life to enlarge the soul, liberate the spirit, and light up the brain.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: True love - that is, deep, abiding love that is impervious to emotional whims or fancy - is a choice. It's a constant commitment to a person regardless of the present circumstances.
author: Mark Manson

quote: I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Authenticity means erasing the gap between what you firmly believe inside and what you reveal to the outside world.
author: Adam Grant

quote: A woman simply is, but a man must become.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: Life goes on if you're one of the lucky ones.
author: Judy Blume

quote: And now, once again, I bid my hideous progeny go forth and prosper. I have an affection for it, for it was the offspring of happy days, when death and grief were but words, which found no true echo in my heart.
author: Mary Shelley

quote: History is not everything, but it is a starting point. History is a clock that people use to tell their political and cultural time of day. It is a compass they use to find themselves on the map of human geography. It tells them where they are but, more importantly, what they must be.
author: John Henrik Clarke

quote: I go to nature to be soothed and healed, and to have my senses put in order.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Loving once and only once is possible - anything is possible.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: We have this habit of romanticizing the lives of writers. I remember when I was a kid, I was like, 'I want to be Kurt Vonnegut.'
author: John Green

quote: Punctuality is the virtue of the bored.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Love has no age, no limit; and no death.
author: John Galsworthy

quote: Hell, madam, is to love no longer.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Humor is an antidote to all ills.
author: Patch Adams

quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

quote: Once is happenstance. Twice is coincidence. Three times is enemy action.
author: Ian Fleming

quote: It's not easy. I got lots of rejections when I first started out. If you want to write, you have to believe in yourself and not give up. You have to do your best to practice and get better.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: Reading should not be presented to children as a chore, a duty. It should be offered as a gift.
author: Kate DiCamillo

quote: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
author: James Thurber

quote: To be really great in little things, to be truly noble and heroic in the insipid details of everyday life, is a virtue so rare as to be worthy of canonization.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: The only thing that permits human beings to collaborate with one another in a truly open-ended way is their willingness to have their beliefs modified by new facts. Only openness to evidence and argument will secure a common world for us.
author: Sam Harris

quote: Peer pressure is just that: pressure.
author: Jerry Spinelli

quote: I always have a quotation for everything - it saves original thinking.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before - it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The hospitality of the wigwam is only limited by the institution of war.
author: Charles Eastman

quote: Focus on the journey, not the destination. Joy is found not in finishing an activity but in doing it.
author: Greg Anderson

quote: I'm a lawyer; I win arguments for a living.
author: Bob Goff

quote: Successful people maintain a positive focus in life no matter what is going on around them. They stay focused on their past successes rather than their past failures, and on the next action steps they need to take to get them closer to the fulfillment of their goals rather than all the other distractions that life presents to them.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: I don't smile as much as I should, even though I smile inside a lot.
author: James Patterson

quote: I value self-discipline, but creating systems that make it next to impossible to misbehave is more reliable than self-control.
author: Tim Ferriss

quote: People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense.
author: Ken Kesey

quote: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
author: Tertullian

quote: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: The sky is the limit. You never have the same experience twice.
author: Frank McCourt

quote: Whenever I feel blue, I start breathing again.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: In your life, where are you not making mistakes? Sometimes if there's no mess, there's no change happening.
author: Brendon Burchard

quote: Let's put it this way: if you are a novelist, I think you start out with a 20 word idea, and you work at it and you wind up with a 200,000 word novel. We, picture-book people, or at least I, start out with 200,000 words and I reduce it to 20.
author: Eric Carle

quote: After I've sent my revised draft to my agent and editor, they suggest more improvement sand again, this revision phase can take anywhere from a few hours to a few months.
author: Margaret Haddix

quote: Perspective is everything when you are experiencing the challenges of life.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

quote: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you.
author: Lewis B. Smedes

quote: Success is more difficult to handle than failure.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: While we would love to have no criticism, probably if we had no critique, we wouldn't be doing anything meaningful.
author: Erwin McManus

quote: A responsible choice is a choice that creates consequences that you are willing to assume responsibility for.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: Diabetes is a great example whereby, giving the patient the tools, you can manage yourself very well.
author: Clayton M. Christensen

quote: When you blame others, you give up your power to change.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: You are free to reject God. Make sure that you're really rejecting God, not some caricature of God that the church has shown you. But I, one, respect a God who not only allows us to reject Him but includes the arguments we can use against Him in the Bible. I respect that.
author: Philip Yancey

quote: Men want a battle to fight, an adventure to live, and a beauty to rescue. That is what is written in their hearts. That is what little boys play at. That is what men's movies are about. You just see it. It is undeniable.
author: John Eldredge

quote: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
author: Dan Millman

quote: The more important a call to action is to our soul's evolution, the more Resistance we will feel about answering it. But to yield to Resistance deforms our spirit. It stunts us and makes us less than we are and were born to be.
author: Steven Pressfield

quote: I went on a diet and went from 248 pounds to 211.
author: Jim Cornette

quote: I have too much to live for to allow a bunch of cowards to take my joy. I refuse to give them my joy.
author: Anthony Ray Hinton

quote: The thing about reading is that if you are hooked, you're not going to stop just because one series is over; you're going to go and find something else.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: Choose to focus your time, energy and conversation around people who inspire you, support you and help you to grow you into your happiest, strongest, wisest self.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: I love Canada. It's a wonderful political act of faith that exists atop a breathtakingly beautiful land.
author: Yann Martel

quote: It is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: My father always wanted to be the corpse at every funeral, the bride at every wedding and the baby at every christening.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: The American Dream has run out of gas. The car has stopped. It no longer supplies the world with its images, its dreams, its fantasies. No more. It's over. It supplies the world with its nightmares now: the Kennedy assassination, Watergate, Vietnam.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: If no pain, then no love. If no darkness, no light. If no risk, then no reward. It's all or nothing. In this damn world, it's all or nothing.
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

quote: The only thing that makes battle psychologically tolerable is the brotherhood among soldiers. You need each other to get by.
author: Sebastian Junger

quote: The sun, the earth, love, friends, our very breath are parts of the banquet.
author: Rebecca Harding Davis

quote: I believe that any type of education can be great, but an education about ourselves can create something wonderful. I am a comedian, but people have called me a motivational speaker. I don't really consider myself that at all.
author: Andy Andrews

quote: Try new things, step out of your comfort zone, take risks, do things in ways you've never done them before, ask for help, surround yourself with self-actualized people, become obsessed with the fact that you have one go-round on this planet as the you that is you, and realize how precious and important it is not to squander that.
author: Jen Sincero

quote: Life ought to be a struggle of desire toward adventures whose nobility will fertilize the soul.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Honesty is the fastest way to prevent a mistake from turning into a failure.
author: James Altucher

quote: Be unpredictable, be real, be interesting. Tell a good story.
author: James Dashner

quote: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn.
author: Hal Borland

quote: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
author: Shiv Khera

quote: I could not have written a novel if I hadn't been a journalist first, because it taught me that there's no muse that's going to come down and bestow upon you the mood to write. You just have to do it. I'm definitely not precious.
author: Gillian Flynn

quote: One of the best ways to make yourself happy in the present is to recall happy times from the past. Photos are a great memory-prompt, and because we tend to take photos of happy occasions, they weight our memories to the good.
author: Gretchen Rubin

quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Paul Tournier

quote: Each day, we have the opportunity to learn something new, apologize for our mistakes, and become better.
author: Lewis Howes

quote: The greatest single cause of atheism in the world today is Christians who acknowledge Jesus with their lips and walk out the door and deny Him by their lifestyle. That is what an unbelieving world simply finds unbelievable.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: If you see harassment happening, speak up. Being harassed is terrible; having bystanders pretend they don't notice is infinitely worse.
author: Celeste Ng

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: You learn a lot about someone when you share a meal together.
author: Anthony Bourdain

quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
author: Stephen King

quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow. It empties today of its strength.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: One can find so many pains when the rain is falling.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: I learned that very often the most intolerant and narrow-minded people are the ones who congratulate themselves on their tolerance and open-mindedness.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: People like to say that the conflict is between good and evil. The real conflict is between truth and lies.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: Strength and growth come only through continuous effort and struggle.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Never deprive someone of hope; it might be all they have.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: I do not at all understand the mystery of grace - only that it meets us where we are but does not leave us where it found us.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Winners make a habit of manufacturing their own positive expectations in advance of the event.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're doing something.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Power is always dangerous. Power attracts the worst and corrupts the best.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Directions are instructions given to explain how. Direction is a vision offered to explain why.
author: Simon Sinek

quote: Constant repetition carries conviction.
author: Robert Collier

quote: It is very easy to love alone.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Having a superpower has nothing to do with the ability to fly or jump, or superhuman strength. The truest superpowers are the ones we all possess: willpower, integrity, and most importantly, courage.
author: Jason Reynolds

quote: Insanity is hereditary; you get it from your children.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

quote: To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Bragging about yourself violates norms of modesty and politeness - and if you were really competent, your work would speak for itself.
author: Adam Grant

quote: If civilization had been left in female hands we would still be living in grass huts.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: You are today where your thoughts have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you.
author: James Allen

quote: The older I get, the more I'm conscious of ways very small things can make a change in the world. Tiny little things, but the world is made up of tiny matters, isn't it?
author: Sandra Cisneros

quote: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
author: William Feather

quote: A schedule defends from chaos and whim. It is a net for catching days. It is a scaffolding on which a worker can stand and labor with both hands at sections of time.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: I always wondered if there was a purpose to the universe, if there was a plan, if there was some sort of organizing factor, hopefully that I played a role in.
author: John Green

quote: It has been said that time heals all wounds. I don't agree. The wounds remain. Time - the mind, protecting its sanity - covers them with some scar tissue and the pain lessens, but it is never gone.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: The willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life is the source from which self-respect springs.
author: Joan Didion

quote: The first sign of corruption in a society that is still alive is that the end justifies the means.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: I'm looking for a world where love will no longer be extraordinary.
author: Patch Adams

quote: Democracy is being allowed to vote for the candidate you dislike least.
author: Robert Byrne

quote: My little dog - a heartbeat at my feet.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: I think the more you understand myths, the more you understand the roots of our culture and the more things will resonate. Do you have to know them? No, but certainly it is nice to recognise how deeply these things are embedded in our literature, our art.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: If you read, the world is your oyster. It truly is. Reading makes everything possible.
author: Kate DiCamillo

quote: Progress was all right. Only it went on too long.
author: James Thurber

quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: I'm interested in memory because it's a filter through which we see our lives, and because it's foggy and obscure, the opportunities for self-deception are there. In the end, as a writer, I'm more interested in what people tell themselves happened rather than what actually happened.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: Almost all our suffering is the product of our thoughts. We spend nearly every moment of our lives lost in thought, and hostage to the character of those thoughts. You can break this spell, but it takes training just like it takes training to defend yourself against a physical assault.
author: Sam Harris

quote: There are bits and pieces of me probably in every one of my 35 or so books.
author: Jerry Spinelli

quote: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
author: Charles Eastman

quote: 'Movement is life;' and it is well to be able to forget the past, and kill the present by continual change.
author: Jules Verne

quote: Fascism is capitalism plus murder.
author: Upton Sinclair

quote: God is in the sadness and the laughter, in the bitter and the sweet.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

quote: Life is hard, and a lot of people come home tired from work. If they're gonna spend half an hour reading, they want some entertainment and a sense of achievement. So that's what I give them. That's all I'm trying to do. Is that really so wrong?
author: James Patterson

quote: A bullet can kill the enemy, but a bullet can also produce an enemy, depending on whom that bullet strikes.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Love grows more tremendously full, swift, poignant, as the years multiply.
author: Zane Grey

quote: The first reaction to truth is hatred.
author: Tertullian

quote: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: Creativity is always a leap of faith. You're faced with a blank page, blank easel, or an empty stage.
author: Julia Cameron

quote: Music is moonlight in the gloomy night of life.
author: Jean Paul

quote: The trick, when you're flirting, is figuring how to keep a balance between being engaging enough to retain someone's attention and not seeming overly available. So you tease a person a little.
author: Neil Strauss

quote: Most kids are smarter than most grown-ups. Kids see the world in black and white... They look through all the garbage and see a world run by fools and dullards and lazy people. And there's nothing they can do about it because they have no power.
author: Dav Pilkey

quote: When we believe in our thoughts, when we tell ourselves a story, we suffer. 'My husband doesn't respect me.' 'I should be thinner.' Those are stories. When there's no story, there's no suffering.
author: Byron Katie

quote: I have an interesting perspective on depending on others. I think it gives people a chance to serve. And I'm not so much big on independence, as I am on interdependence. I'm not talking about co-dependency, I'm talking about giving people the opportunity to practicing love with its sleeves rolled up.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

quote: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: The fact of being an underdog changes people in ways that we often fail to appreciate. It opens doors and creates opportunities and enlightens and permits things that might otherwise have seemed unthinkable.
author: Malcolm Gladwell

quote: God has given us an imagination, and our imagination is really the principle tool from which all creativity and artistry comes from.
author: Erwin McManus

quote: Unworthiness is the inmost frightening thought that you do not belong, no matter how much you want to belong, that you are an outsider and will always be an outsider. It is the idea that you are flawed and cannot be fixed. It is wanting to be loved and feeling unlovable, or wanting to love and feeling that you are not capable of loving.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: Management is the opportunity to help people become better people. Practiced that way, it's a magnificent profession.
author: Clayton M. Christensen

quote: We can only learn to love by loving.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: When suffering happens, it forces us to confront life in a different way than we normally do.
author: Philip Yancey

quote: Validation comes to us in two ways: through trials we overcome, and through the words of older men.
author: John Eldredge

quote: Faith means living with uncertainty - feeling your way through life, letting your heart guide you like a lantern in the dark.
author: Dan Millman

quote: Long-term, we must begin to build our internal strengths. It isn't just skills like computer technology. It's the old-fashioned basics of self-reliance, self-motivation, self-reinforcement, self-discipline, self-command.
author: Steven Pressfield

quote: People that lie to me generally get banished or vanished to the planet Pluto in my mind.
author: Jim Cornette

quote: Bitterness kills the soul.
author: Anthony Ray Hinton

quote: I do like to read in bed, but because I have two kids I'm often forced to read in the bathroom.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: You're not looking for perfection in your partner. Perfection is all about the ego. With soulmate love, you know that true love is what happens when disappointment sets in - and you're willing to deal maturely with these disappointments.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: The battle of life is, in most cases, fought uphill; and to win it without a struggle were perhaps to win it without honor. If there were no difficulties there would be no success; if there were nothing to struggle for, there would be nothing to be achieved.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Home is the nicest word there is.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: Of all afflictions, the worst is self-contempt.
author: Berthold Auerbach

quote: Attitude determines the altitude of life.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: And then writing, it was like I just found it, you know? Like you just found your favorite flavor of ice cream, all of a sudden there it is. 'This is what I should have been doing for the last thirty years. What was I thinking?' So I was, then I was in and then I had to just keep going with it.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: You can be shattered, and then you can put yourself back together piece by piece. But what can happen over time is this: You wake up one day and realize that you have put yourself back together completely differently. That you are whole, finally, and strong - but you are now a different shape, a different size.
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

quote: You must not under any pretense allow your mind to dwell on any thought that is not positive, constructive, optimistic, kind.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Whatever we are waiting for - peace of mind, contentment, grace, the inner awareness of simple abundance - it will surely come to us, but only when we are ready to receive it with an open and grateful heart.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: Curiously, a principle affects your life whether you are aware of it or not. For instance, the principle of gravity was working long before the apple ever fell on Newton's head. But once it did, and he understood it, then we as a society were free to harness this principle to create, among other things, airline flight.
author: Andy Andrews

quote: Gratitude is one of the strongest and most transformative states of being. It shifts your perspective from lack to abundance and allows you to focus on the good in your life, which in turn pulls more goodness into your reality.
author: Jen Sincero

quote: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat or a prostitute.
author: Rebecca West

quote: All is worthwhile if the soul is not small.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Nobody ever did, or ever will, escape the consequences of his choices.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: My father lost an eye to a snapped cable while trying to rescue trapped miners, though he kept on working for fifteen years afterward.
author: Homer Hickam

quote: The more you practice tolerating discomfort, the more confidence you'll gain in your ability to accept new challenges.
author: Amy Morin

quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.
author: Karen Blixen

quote: I had been laid off from 'Entertainment Weekly 'right before I started writing 'Gone Girl.'
author: Gillian Flynn

quote: If God existed, and if He cared for humankind, He would never have given us religion.
author: Martin Amis

quote: Trump's biggest failure as a political leader is that he sees the worst in people, and he encourages the worst in people.
author: J. D. Vance

quote: My trust in God flows out of the experience of his loving me, day in and day out, whether the day is stormy or fair, whether I'm sick or in good health, whether I'm in a state of grace or disgrace. He comes to me where I live and loves me as I am.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: It's easy to feel helpless - like you can't fight the tide. But remember: small actions can have a huge impact, and one person like you can inspire others to action.
author: Celeste Ng

quote: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: The Italians and Spanish, the Chinese and Vietnamese see food as part of a larger, more essential and pleasurable part of daily life. Not as an experience to be collected or bragged about - or as a ritual like filling up a car - but as something else that gives pleasure, like sex or music, or a good nap in the afternoon.
author: Anthony Bourdain

quote: People think that I must be a very strange person. This is not correct. I have the heart of a small boy. It is in a glass jar on my desk.
author: Stephen King

quote: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Memories are the key not to the past, but to the future.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: Many a trip continues long after movement in time and space have ceased.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: What can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: Don't Take Anything Personally. Nothing others do is because of you. What others say and do is a projection of their own reality, their own dream. When you are immune to the opinions and actions of others, you won't be the victim of needless suffering.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: Life is abundant, and life is beautiful. And it's a good place that we're all in, you know, on this earth, if we take care of it.
author: Alice Walker

quote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all, in which case you have failed by default.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Contrariwise, if it was so, it might be; and if it were so, it would be; but as it isn't, it ain't. That's logic.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Sometimes good stories are created while documenting dreams.
author: Ruskin Bond

quote: The best way to predict the future is to study the past, or prognosticate.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Whoever loveth me, loveth my hound.
author: Thomas More

quote: Life is always going to be stranger than fiction, because fiction has to be convincing, and life doesn't.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: One's destination is never a place but rather a new way of looking at things.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Everything can change at any moment, suddenly and forever.
author: Paul Auster

quote: We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office.
author: Aesop

quote: Someone once told me... 'Anh believe in your dreams!' I always have and always will, and I think that if you follow your dreams in life, you really can live an amazing life.
author: Anh Do

quote: As we let our light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence actually liberates others.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Did you ever stop to think, and forget to start again?
author: A. A. Milne

quote: I know the feeling of confusion and betrayal. I know the feeling of fearing for my life.
author: Jason Reynolds

quote: Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: People want to start their own business or become financially independent. But you don't end up a successful entrepreneur unless you find a way to love the risk, the uncertainty, the repeated failures, and working insane hours on something you have no idea whether will be successful or not.
author: Mark Manson

quote: I do not know You, God, because I am in the way. Please help me to push myself aside.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: The culture of a workplace - an organization's values, norms and practices - has a huge impact on our happiness and success.
author: Adam Grant

quote: There is no female Mozart because there is no female Jack the Ripper.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: My dreams were all my own; I accounted for them to nobody; they were my refuge when annoyed - my dearest pleasure when free.
author: Mary Shelley

quote: The more you speak more languages, the more you understand about yourself.
author: Sandra Cisneros

quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
author: William Feather

quote: The surest sign of age is loneliness.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: Teenagers have more intense reading experiences because they've had fewer of them. It's like the first time you fall in love. You have a connection to that first person you fell in love with because it was so intense and unprecedented.
author: John Green

quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: It kills me when people talk about California hedonism. Anybody who talks about California hedonism has never spent a Christmas in Sacramento.
author: Joan Didion

quote: Little things seem nothing, but they give peace, like those meadow flowers which individually seem odorless but all together perfume the air.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: The role of a clown and a physician are the same - it's to elevate the possible and to relieve suffering.
author: Patch Adams

quote: You can have the power to destroy, but it doesn't give you the power to reform, or improve, or build.
author: George R. R. Martin

quote: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Life is hard, but we make it much harder.
author: Ryan Holiday

quote: From the beginnings of literature, poets and writers have based their narratives on crossing borders, on wandering, on exile, on encounters beyond the familiar. The stranger is an archetype in epic poetry, in novels. The tension between alienation and assimilation has always been a basic theme.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: I discovered that my imagination came alive when I moved away from the immediate world around me.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: Every single moment is a coincidence.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: The problem is that religion tends to give people bad reasons to be good.
author: Sam Harris

quote: I went to Gettysburg College, where the famous Civil War battle was fought. I majored in English. I would've liked to major in writing, but they didn't offer a major in that.
author: Jerry Spinelli

quote: The great advantage about telling the truth is that nobody ever believes it.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Let us be about setting high standards for life, love, creativity, and wisdom. If our expectations in these areas are low, we are not likely to experience wellness. Setting high standards makes every day and every decade worth looking forward to.
author: Greg Anderson

quote: In the twilight, it was a vision of power.
author: Upton Sinclair

quote: By taking the time to stop and appreciate who you are and what you've achieved - and perhaps learned through a few mistakes, stumbles and losses - you actually can enhance everything about you. Self-acknowledgment and appreciation are what give you the insights and awareness to move forward toward higher goals and accomplishments.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: Ultimately, a great thriller is a roller coaster ride. I like to think that's a promise I have never failed to keep, and one that I'd say has served my books well.
author: James Patterson

quote: Online I see people committing 'social media suicide' all the time by one of two ways. Firstly by responding to all criticism, meaning you're never going to find time to complete important milestones of your own, and by responding to things that don't warrant a response. This lends more credibility by driving traffic.
author: Tim Ferriss

quote: You can't really be strong until you see a funny side to things.
author: Ken Kesey

quote: I will see this game of life out to its bitter end.
author: Zane Grey

quote: I always felt that the great high privilege, relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Age does not matter if the matter does not age.
author: Jean Paul

quote: At the end of our lives we all ask, 'Did I live? Did I love? Did I matter?'
author: Brendon Burchard

quote: Because it's so easy to medicate our need for self-worth by pandering to win followers, 'likes' and view counts, social media have become the metier of choice for many people who might otherwise channel that energy into books, music or art - or even into their own Web ventures.
author: Neil Strauss

quote: I created 'Captain Underpants' when I was in the second grade. I was constantly getting in trouble for being the class clown, so my teacher sent me out into the hallway to punish me. It was there in the hall that I began drawing 'Captain Underpants'. Soon I was making my own comic books about him.
author: Dav Pilkey

quote: When I was in my early forties, I slept with a loaded gun under my bed. I'd become severely depressed in my thirties, and for almost a decade I spiraled down into paranoia, rage, self-loathing, and thoughts of suicide.
author: Byron Katie

quote: The problem with revenge is that it never evens the score. It ties both the injured and the injurer to an escalator of pain. Both are stuck on the escalator as long as parity is demanded, and the escalator never stops.
author: Lewis B. Smedes

quote: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it's one damn thing over and over.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: A lot of what is most beautiful about the world arises from struggle.
author: Malcolm Gladwell

quote: Solitude is not the same as loneliness. Solitude is a solitary boat floating in a sea of possible companions.
author: Robert Fulghum

quote: If it's a cocktail party, I generally make five or six different things, and I try to choose recipes that feel like a meal: a chicken thing, a fish or shrimp thing, maybe two vegetable things, and I think it's fun to end the cocktail party with a sweet thing.
author: Ina Garten

quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: I collect a lot of cursed objects. That's probably why I have a lot of problems.
author: Zak Bagans

quote: Christian faith is... basically about love and being loved and reconciliation. These things are so important, they're foundational and they can transform individuals, families.
author: Philip Yancey

quote: You get guys around a campfire, and they start telling their stories. That's the fellowship that they want to be in.
author: John Eldredge

quote: There is real power in seeing yourself as a hero. Because then you believe that you can do anything.
author: Jenny Han

quote: The difference between an amateur and a professional is in their habits. An amateur has amateur habits. A professional has professional habits. We can never free ourselves from habit. But we can replace bad habits with good ones.
author: Steven Pressfield

quote: What many people don't know about 'Peter Pan' is that it's a very violent book and Hook is one of the most finely observed villains ever.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: I want you to know there is a God. He sits high, but he looks low. He will destroy, but yet he will defend - and he defended me.
author: Anthony Ray Hinton

quote: Succeeding makes us feel good. But beating someone else makes us feel really good. Comparing ourselves to others and coming out on top creates a sense of entitlement. And when we feel entitled, we cheat more because, of course, the rules don't apply to awesome people like us.
author: Daniel H. Pink

quote: Reality is how we interpret it. Imagination and volition play a part in that interpretation. Which means that all reality is to some extent a fiction.
author: Yann Martel

quote: The duty of helping one's self in the highest sense involves the helping of one's neighbors.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: The little dissatisfaction which every artist feels at the completion of a work forms the germ of a new work.
author: Berthold Auerbach

quote: In a completely sane world, madness is the only freedom.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: Life is a conversation. Make it a good one.
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

quote: The negative effects of combat were nightmares, and I'd get jumpy around certain noises and stuff, but you'd have that after a car accident or a bad divorce. Life's filled with trauma. You don't need to go to war to find it; it's going to find you. We all deal with it, and the effects go away after awhile. At least they did for me.
author: Sebastian Junger

quote: If you're serious about changing your life, you'll find a way. If you're not, you'll find an excuse.
author: Jen Sincero

quote: War may be an armed angel with a mission, but she has the personal habits of the slums.
author: Rebecca Harding Davis

quote: When I was 19 years old, both of my parents died in the same year; my mom of cancer and my dad in a car accident. Through the next two or three years and a series of bad decisions - all my own, I might add - I ended up literally homeless, before that was even a word. I even slept occasionally under a pier on the Gulf Coast.
author: Andy Andrews

quote: I hope children will be happy with the books I've written, and go on to be readers all of their lives.
author: Beverly Cleary

quote: He is every other inch a gentleman.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Every time you get angry, you poison your own system.
author: Alfred A. Montapert

quote: The great solution to all human problems is individual inner transformation.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: To be a great nation and a great people, you have to do great things.
author: Homer Hickam

quote: Being taken for granted is an unpleasant but sincere form of praise. Ironically, the more reliable you are, and the less you complain, the more likely you are to be taken for granted.
author: Gretchen Rubin

quote: When I discover who I am, I'll be free.
author: Ralph Ellison

quote: Difficult times have helped me to understand better than before, how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way, and that so many things that one goes worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Karen Blixen

quote: Acceptance of one's life has nothing to do with resignation; it does not mean running away from the struggle. On the contrary, it means accepting it as it comes, with all the handicaps of heredity, of suffering, of psychological complexes and injustices.
author: Paul Tournier

quote: At a pivotal time in my life, Barack Obama gave me hope that a boy who grew up like me could still achieve the most important of my dreams. For that, I'll miss him and the example he set.
author: J. D. Vance

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Bad food is made without pride, by cooks who have no pride, and no love. Bad food is made by chefs who are indifferent, or who are trying to be everything to everybody, who are trying to please everyone... Bad food is fake food... food that shows fear and lack of confidence in people's ability to discern or to make decisions about their lives.
author: Anthony Bourdain

quote: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always come around to where you started again.
author: Stephen King

quote: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: To the dumb question, 'Why me?' the cosmos barely bothers to return the reply, 'Why not?'
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: Always Do Your Best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: Pride makes us artificial and humility makes us real.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: 'Thank you' is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.
author: Alice Walker

quote: I believe that the greatest gift you can give your family and the world is a healthy you.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: One of the secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: My first, 'Room on the Roof,' was the longest book I've written.
author: Ruskin Bond

quote: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Every man's life is a fairy tale written by God's fingers.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Those among them that have not received our religion do not fright any from it, and use none ill that goes over to it, so that all the while I was there one man was only punished on this occasion.
author: Thomas More

quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: For us in Russia, communism is a dead dog, while, for many people in the West, it is still a living lion.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: We are healed from suffering only by experiencing it to the full.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Great leaders are willing to sacrifice the numbers to save the people. Poor leaders sacrifice the people to save the numbers.
author: Simon Sinek

quote: In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent advantage. In every defeat is a lesson showing you how to win the victory next time.
author: Robert Collier

quote: A writer should write with his eyes and a painter paint with his ears.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: The truth is, my life was made infinitely more difficult because I didn't read any books. But I didn't read any books. That's my story. That's my truth.
author: Jason Reynolds

quote: Equality is not in regarding different things similarly, equality is in regarding different things differently.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: It's a good thing that when God created the rainbow he didn't consult a decorator or he would still be picking colors.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: You can always do something about the problems life gives you.
author: Mark Manson

quote: An object in possession seldom retains the same charm that it had in pursuit.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: The remedy for life's broken pieces is not classes, workshops or books. Don't try to heal the broken pieces. Just forgive.
author: Iyanla Vanzant

quote: Everybody wants to share life and be in love and be loved.
author: Judy Blume

quote: Woman is the dominant sex. Men have to do all sorts of stuff to prove that they are worthy of woman's attention.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: Dream lofty dreams, and as you dream, so you shall become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall one day be; your ideal is the prophecy of what you shall at last unveil.
author: James Allen

quote: A good teacher, like a good entertainer first must hold his audience's attention, then he can teach his lesson.
author: John Henrik Clarke

quote: I usually say Latina, Mexican-American or American Mexican, and in certain contexts, Chicana, depending on whether my audience understands the term or not.
author: Sandra Cisneros

quote: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
author: William Feather

quote: The dedicated life is worth living. You must give with your whole heart.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: I have come to the conclusion that the most important element in human life is faith.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Self-respect is a question of recognizing that anything worth having has a price.
author: Joan Didion

quote: Idealism increases in direct proportion to one's distance from the problem.
author: John Galsworthy

quote: If your mother did not know how to love herself, or your father did not know how to love himself, then it would be impossible for them to teach you to love yourself. They were doing the best they could with what they had been taught as children.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: Our technological powers increase, but the side effects and potential hazards also escalate.
author: Alvin Toffler

quote: Fiction is lies; we're writing about people who never existed and events that never happened when we write fiction, whether its science fiction or fantasy or western mystery stories or so-called literary stories. All those things are essentially untrue. But it has to have a truth at the core of it.
author: George R. R. Martin

quote: True originality consists not in a new manner but in a new vision.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: I think, like any artist or any writer, I just want to have that pure freedom of expression and of thought - the freedom to explore and move in unexpected ways.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

quote: He who keeps his cool best wins.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: Abundance is a process of letting go; that which is empty can receive.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Blame is just a lazy person's way of making sense of chaos.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: My concern with religion is that it allows us by the millions to believe what only lunatics or idiots could believe on their own. That's not to say that all religious people are lunatics or idiots. It's anything but that.
author: Sam Harris

quote: The separation of church and state was meant to protect church from state; a state that declares religion off limits in public life is a state that declares itself supreme over all religious values.
author: Ben Shapiro

quote: Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: I think of myself... as a troubadour, a village storyteller, the guy in the shadows of the campfire.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: No one who is at all acquainted with the Indian in his home can deny that we are a polite people.
author: Charles Eastman

quote: I'm trying to surround myself during my life with the eight people I'd surround my bed with on my death.
author: Bob Goff

quote: I think in metaphysical terms, I would call that increasing the speed of the vibration of life.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

quote: Nothing is more beautiful than the love that has weathered the storms of life. The love of the young for the young, that is the beginning of life. But the love of the old for the old, that is the beginning of things longer.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: If you optimize for money too early, you will be minimizing for learning, almost without exception.
author: Tim Ferriss

quote: I know what it is to feel unloved, to want revenge, to make mistakes, to suffer disappointment, yet also to find the courage to go forward in life.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: He is a man, who is to be a man, the fruit is always present in the seed.
author: Tertullian

quote: My father and mother should have stayed in New York, where they met and married and where I was born.
author: Frank McCourt

quote: The road to the City of Emeralds is paved with yellow brick.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: Never ask a woman if you may kiss her. Instead, learn to read body language.
author: Neil Strauss

quote: My books are just pure escapism for kids.
author: Dav Pilkey

quote: I haven't had a single thought for 26 years. I have only understanding. It's somewhat complicated to understand that. I've hardly ever spoken about it. You're in a state of total peace of mind. A kind of nirvana.
author: Byron Katie

quote: The soul can split the sky in two and let the face of God shine through.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: The older I get, the more I understand that the only way to say valuable things is to lose your fear of being correct.
author: Malcolm Gladwell

quote: It will be a great day when our schools have all the money they need, and our air force has to have a bake-sale to buy a bomber.
author: Robert Fulghum

quote: No one can occupy your generosity except you. Who can occupy your patience when impatience roars through you? Who except you can choose not to act with judgment when all of your thoughts are judgmental? Your life is yours to live, no matter how you choose to live it. When you do not think about how you intend to live it, it lives you.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: You may hate gravity, but gravity doesn't care.
author: Clayton M. Christensen

quote: Most people would rather be certain they're miserable, than risk being happy.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: I taunt and provoke, but you have to understand that I do that for a reason. I want to elicit a response. Remember that my mission is to capture on film and digital recording devices evidence of the paranormal. Many times, I can't do that by being nice.
author: Zak Bagans

quote: Most of us live in a fog. It's like life is a movie we arrived to 20 minutes late. You know something important seems to be going on. But we can't figure out the story. We don't know what part we're supposed to play or what the plot is.
author: John Eldredge

quote: Every choice leads you somewhere, but it might not be where you truly want to be if the decision is based on someone else. It could lead to regrets and what-ifs, but that doesn't mean you wouldn't still have valuable experiences.
author: Jenny Han

quote: Trevor Murdoch is mad, bad and dangerous. He's the only man I know that can strap a bucket of fried chicken on his back and ride a motor scooter across Ethiopia.
author: Jim Cornette

quote: A beard doesn't grow only on gurus; it grows on all men.
author: Jaggi Vasudev

quote: I am perhaps unusual in that I came to 'Doctor Who' through the numerous novelisations and not through the television show.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: Death row was the only place where I never witnessed racism. We all went to bed with a death sentence on our heads and woke up that way. We had to become each other's support system.
author: Anthony Ray Hinton

quote: The grass is always greener on the other side - until you get there and see it's AstroTurf. Symbols are never reality. Someone might have amassed material success and fame, but that doesn't mean they're happy. So, don't go judging a person's life by the cover.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: Writing fiction has developed in me an abiding respect for the unknown in a human lifetime and a sense of where to look for the threads, how to follow, how to connect, find in the thick of the tangle what clear line persists.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: Everything in the Universe, throughout all its kingdoms, is conscious: i.e., endowed with a consciousness of its own kind and on its own plane of perception.
author: Helena Blavatsky

quote: Her blue eyes were still beautiful, but they did not know what was before them, and Mary herself could never look through them again to tell Laura what she was thinking without saying a word.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: I grew up in a community where it was not the exception to be a good girl. It was sort of expected. And all of my friends were good girls too, and my boyfriends were good boys. Everybody was pretty nice. And that affects how I write my characters. There aren't very many bad guys in my novels.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: A Parliament is nothing less than a big meeting of more or less idle people.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: The key to growth is acknowledging your fear of the unknown and jumping in anyway.
author: Jen Sincero

quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Always remember that striving and struggle precede success, even in the dictionary.
author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quote: Toxic people defy logic. Some are blissfully unaware of the negative impact that they have on those around them, and others seem to derive satisfaction from creating chaos and pushing other people's buttons.
author: Travis Bradberry

quote: Games are all about taking risks.
author: James Altucher

quote: Success consists in being successful, not in having potential for success. Any wide piece of ground is the potential site of a palace, but there's no palace till it's built.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Down the road a bit, I would like to write a couple of stand-alone adult novels, especially in the horror genre. I've got lots of things up my sleeve.
author: James Dashner

quote: Start your day in a upward direction, and the rest of the day will follow the uphill path.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: You can't be suspicious of a tree, or accuse a bird or a squirrel of subversion or challenge the ideology of a violet.
author: Hal Borland

quote: Tactics are manipulative.
author: Shiv Khera

quote: If I know a song of Africa, of the giraffe and the African new moon lying on her back, of the plows in the fields and the sweaty faces of the coffee pickers, does Africa know a song of me?
author: Karen Blixen

quote: The days are long, but the years are short.
author: Gretchen Rubin

quote: Recounting of a life story, a mind thinking aloud leads one inevitably to the consideration of problems which are no longer psychological but spiritual.
author: Paul Tournier

quote: People listen to what their political leaders are telling them, and my view is both that Trump is tapping into some racially ugly attitudes, but also that he is leading people to racially ugly attitudes.
author: J. D. Vance

quote: Sin and forgiveness and falling and getting back up and losing the pearl of great price in the couch cushions but then finding it again, and again, and again? Those are the stumbling steps to becoming Real, the only script that's really worth following in this world or the one that's coming.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: I think I'm good at metaphors and descriptions. Plot doesn't come naturally to me, so I work really hard at it.
author: Celeste Ng

quote: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Almost everybody is born a genius and buried an idiot.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

quote: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Let God's promises shine on your problems.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are God. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are God.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: Don't Make Assumptions. Find the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: Great achievement is usually born of great sacrifice, and is never the result of selfishness.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Live so that when your children think of fairness, caring, and integrity, they think of you.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: What greater thing is there for two human souls than to feel that they are joined - to strengthen each other - to be at one with each other in silent unspeakable memories.
author: George Eliot

quote: It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Beware of men who cry. It's true that men who cry are sensitive to and in touch with feelings, but the only feelings they tend to be sensitive to and in touch with are their own.
author: Nora Ephron

quote: Your problem is how you are going to spend this one odd and precious life you have been issued. Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over people and circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Financial freedom is available to those who learn about it and work for it.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: A library is a place that is a repository of information and gives every citizen equal access to it. That includes health information. And mental health information. It's a community space. It's a place of safety, a haven from the world.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: I was a Vietnamese kid with a mullet hair cut. I had all Westie mates, and, geez, a Vietnamese guy with a mullet doesn't work; no wonder I couldn't get a girlfriend for so many years.
author: Anh Do

quote: Your chances of success in any undertaking can always be measured by your belief in yourself.
author: Robert Collier

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: A man is as alive as he can communicate.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: You must learn from the mistakes of others. You can't possibly live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Take the attitude of a student, never be too big to ask questions, never know too much to learn something new.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: If you want to be a generous giver, you have to watch out for selfish takers.
author: Adam Grant

quote: Anti-religious sneers are a hallmark of perpetual adolescents.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: A man has to learn that he cannot command things, but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others, but that he can mold and master his own will: and things serve him who serves Truth; people seek guidance of him who is master of himself.
author: James Allen

quote: A people's relationship to their heritage is the same as the relationship of a child to its mother.
author: John Henrik Clarke

quote: If you're naturally kind, you attract a lot of people you don't like.
author: William Feather

quote: Crystals grew inside rock like arithmetic flowers. They lengthened and spread, added plane to plane in an awed and perfect obedience to an absolute geometry that even stones - maybe only the stones - understood.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: When you go to a great concert, you feel this arc, almost like the music of a well-chosen set takes you on this trip through emotions and through various forms of intellectual engagement.
author: John Green

quote: We schoolmasters must temper discretion with deceit.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: We imagine things - that we wouldn't be able to survive, but in fact, we do survive. We have no choice, so we do it.
author: Joan Didion

quote: Hope is a risk that must be run.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: At the age of 18, I made up my mind to never have another bad day in my life. I dove into a endless sea of gratitude from which I've never emerged.
author: Patch Adams

quote: There are two kinds of people, those who finish what they start and so on.
author: Robert Byrne

quote: Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes', otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.
author: Ian Fleming

quote: All of my characters tend to be montages of different people I've met: little bits and pieces of their personalities put together.
author: Rick Riordan

quote: How do I feel when I look back at prior work? Hmmm. I think, 'I tried to do the best I could do. It's not perfect. It will never be perfect.' And then I think, 'I want to try again.'
author: Kate DiCamillo

quote: It is better to know some of the questions than all of the answers.
author: James Thurber

quote: The past, the present and the future are really one: they are today.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Nothing very very good and nothing very very bad ever lasts for very very long.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: It's not so much religion per se, it's false certainty that worries me, and religion just has more than its fair share of false certainty or dogmatism. I'm really concerned when I see people pretending to know things they clearly cannot know.
author: Sam Harris

quote: I became a children's author by accident.
author: Jerry Spinelli

quote: Time and trouble will tame an advanced young woman, but an advanced old woman is uncontrollable by any earthly force.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Knowledge is like money: to be of value it must circulate, and in circulating it can increase in quantity and, hopefully, in value.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Some memories are realities, and are better than anything that can ever happen to one again.
author: Willa Cather

quote: There were no temples or shrines among us save those of nature.
author: Charles Eastman

quote: Wellness is not a 'medical fix' but a way of living - a lifestyle sensitive and responsive to all the dimensions of body, mind, and spirit, an approach to life we each design to achieve our highest potential for well-being now and forever.
author: Greg Anderson

quote: We'll become in our lives whoever the people we love the most say we are.
author: Bob Goff

quote: The longer you hang in there, the greater the chance that something will happen in your favor. No matter how hard it seems, the longer you persist, the more likely your success.
author: Jack Canfield

quote: People like to talk more than they like to act. They like to sit there and complain and vent. Somehow they think that changes things, when it doesn't.
author: James Patterson

quote: The fundamentalists have taken the fun out of the mental.
author: Ken Kesey

quote: You can judge the quality of their faith from the way they behave. Discipline is an index to doctrine.
author: Tertullian

quote: Happy is the person who knows what to remember of the past, what to enjoy in the present, and what to plan for in the future.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Scatter my ashes on the Shannon.
author: Frank McCourt

quote: Hearts will never be practical until they can be made unbreakable.
author: L. Frank Baum

quote: Your intention for a book is never the same as the reception.
author: Neil Strauss

quote: I started trying to write when I was in second or third grade.
author: Margaret Haddix

quote: My weakness, that is, my quadriplegia, is my greatest asset because it forces me into the arms of Christ every single morning when I get up.
author: Joni Eareckson Tada

quote: Restorative justice is not a replacement of retributive justice, but a complement. It seeks the rehabilitation of the wrongdoer and the repair of the victim's injury.
author: Lewis B. Smedes

quote: We all want Canaan without going through the wilderness.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: I think we've overstated that God is the God who wants us to obey. Obedience is not the end game. Obedience is only our calling so that we can step into our freedom.
author: Erwin McManus

quote: The characteristics of an authentically empowered personality are humbleness, clarity, forgiveness and love.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: The reason why it is so difficult for existing firms to capitalize on disruptive innovations is that their processes and their business model that make them good at the existing business actually make them bad at competing for the disruption.
author: Clayton M. Christensen

quote: The opposite of bravery is not cowardice but conformity.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: Before you begin a paranormal investigation, the most important criteria you need to gather is the back history of the location.
author: Zak Bagans

quote: Falling in love with God is the most important thing a person can do.
author: John Eldredge

quote: Everything you'll ever need to know is within you; the secrets of the universe are imprinted on the cells of your body.
author: Dan Millman

quote: Most of us have two lives: the life we live, and the unlived life within us. Between the two stands Resistance.
author: Steven Pressfield

quote: If we fail to appreciate the soul that Easternism gives us, then what we have is a disconnected, Greco-Roman, Western, egocentric, compartmentalized, reductionist, fragmented, linear thought process that counts on cleverness.
author: Joel Salatin

quote: Even if the flower is no more, still, the fragrance can be.
author: Jaggi Vasudev

quote: I often meet frustrated young writers who say they've only got so far and just can't finish a book. Even if you don't happen to use what you've worked on that day, it has taught you something and you'll be amazed when you might come back to it and use it again.
author: Eoin Colfer

quote: In Hinduism, Shiva is a deity who represents transformation. Through destruction and restoration, Shiva reminds us that endings are beginnings, and that our world is constantly undergoing a cycle of birth, death and rebirth.
author: Karen Salmansohn

quote: The moral of a fable is eternal. The moral of a story is temporary to a story.
author: Yann Martel

quote: Everything that is, was, and will be, eternally IS, even the countless forms, which are finite and perishable only in their objective, not in their ideal Form.
author: Helena Blavatsky

quote: You can't make a souffle rise twice.
author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

quote: Confidentiality is a virtue of the loyal, as loyalty is the virtue of faithfulness.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: It's sad when you can't make everyone happy, though. It's impossible but, at the same time, you still hope. You think, 'Maybe I can do it,' but you know you can't. But gosh, if I had to rely on giving people what they wanted, I would have had to write 40 billion different books and even then, I wouldn't get it right.
author: Stephenie Meyer

quote: There is only one rule for being a good talker - learn to listen.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Rock bottom is a crisis... and everyone wants to avoid crisis. But what 'crisis' means literally is 'to sift' - like a child who goes to the beach, lifts up the sand, and watches all the sand fall away, hoping that there's treasure left over. That's what crisis does.
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

quote: You must not allow yourself to dwell for a single moment on any kind of negative thought.
author: Emmet Fox

quote: Humans are creatures of habit. If you quit when things get tough, it gets that much easier to quit the next time. On the other hand, if you force yourself to push through it, the grit begins to grow in you.
author: Travis Bradberry

quote: Every day, you reinvent yourself. You're always in motion. But you decide every day: forward or backward.
author: James Altucher

quote: I was a great reader of fairy tales. I tried to read the entire fairy tale section of the library.
author: Beverly Cleary

quote: At first, it's unfamiliar, then it strikes root.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: I don't think anything's more rewarding than hearing that you've helped someone gain a love of reading.
author: James Dashner

quote: Never fear to deliberately walk through dark places, for that is how you reach the light on the other side.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: There are good leaders who actively guide and bad leaders who actively misguide. Hence, leadership is about persuasion, presentation and people skills.
author: Shiv Khera

quote: Love, with very young people, is a heartless business. We drink at that age from thirst, or to get drunk; it is only later in life that we occupy ourselves with the individuality of our wine.
author: Karen Blixen

quote: Negative emotions like loneliness, envy, and guilt have an important role to play in a happy life; they're big, flashing signs that something needs to change.
author: Gretchen Rubin

quote: It's almost always easier to sell to an existing customer base than to find a new one.
author: Lewis Howes

quote: At the heart of personality is the need to feel a sense of being lovable without having to qualify for that acceptance.
author: Paul Tournier

quote: God loves you unconditionally, as you are and not as you should be, because nobody is as they should be.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: Gore isn't required for a good story, but adversity is.
author: Celeste Ng

quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Censorship is the tool of those who have the need to hide actualities from themselves and from others. Their fear is only their inability to face what is real, and I can't vent any anger against them; I only feel this appalling sadness. Somewhere in their upbringing, they were shielded against the total facts of our existence.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
author: George Orwell

quote: The eyes of others our prisons; their thoughts our cages.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The first step on the way to victory is to recognize the enemy.
author: Corrie Ten Boom

quote: The pen is mightier than the sword if the sword is very short, and the pen is very sharp.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Life is essentially a cheat and its conditions are those of defeat; the redeeming things are not happiness and pleasure but the deeper satisfactions that come out of struggle.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Peace demands the most heroic labor and the most difficult sacrifice. It demands greater heroism than war. It demands greater fidelity to the truth and a much more perfect purity of conscience.
author: Thomas Merton
