quote: The difference between the almost right word and the right word is really a large matter - 'tis the difference between the lightning-bug and the lightning.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Work consists of whatever a body is obliged to do. Play consists of whatever a body is not obliged to do.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The more things are forbidden, the more popular they become.
author: Mark Twain

quote: What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is led in his head, and is known to none but himself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Martyrdom covers a multitude of sins.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Against the assault of laughter, nothing can stand.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Soap and education are not as sudden as a massacre, but they are more deadly in the long run.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Drag your thoughts away from your troubles... by the ears, by the heels, or any other way you can manage it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: We are all alike, on the inside.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Noise proves nothing. Often a hen who has merely laid an egg cackles as if she laid an asteroid.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Few of us can stand prosperity. Another man's, I mean.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Nothing so needs reforming as other people's habits.
author: Mark Twain

quote: What, sir, would the people of the earth be without woman? They would be scarce, sir, almighty scarce.
author: Mark Twain

quote: All right, then, I'll go to hell.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When I was younger I could remember anything, whether it happened or not.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To refuse awards is another way of accepting them with more noise than is normal.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The rule is perfect: in all matters of opinion our adversaries are insane.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Repartee is something we think of twenty-four hours too late.
author: Mark Twain

quote: He is now rising from affluence to poverty.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man is the only animal that blushes - or needs to.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I never let schooling interfere with my education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Optimist: day dreamer more elegantly spelled.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Sometimes too much to drink is barely enough.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man. The biography of the man himself cannot be written.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Let us make a special effort to stop communicating with each other, so we can have some conversation.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is my belief that nearly any invented quotation, played with confidence, stands a good chance to deceive.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It is just like man's vanity and impertinence to call an animal dumb because it is dumb to his dull perceptions.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Words are only painted fire; a look is the fire itself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It was wonderful to find America, but it would have been more wonderful to miss it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Why shouldn't truth be stranger than fiction? Fiction, after all, has to make sense.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I make it a rule never to smoke while I'm sleeping.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Prophesy is a good line of business, but it is full of risks.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities. Truth isn't.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't say the old lady screamed. Bring her on and let her scream.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The educated Southerner has no use for an 'r', except at the beginning of a word.
author: Mark Twain

quote: As an example to others, and not that I care for moderation myself, it has always been my rule never to smoke when asleep, and never to refrain from smoking when awake.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert

quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: Never complain and never explain.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.
author: Philip Sidney

quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Don't think, just do.
author: Horace

quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
author: Julie Andrews

quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
author: Michael Korda

quote: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
author: John Dewey

quote: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
author: Ted Turner

quote: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
author: Peter Marshall

quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
author: Mark Caine

quote: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
author: Bobby Knight

quote: Even if you fall on your face, you're still moving forward.
author: Victor Kiam

quote: Either move or be moved.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.
author: Benjamin Jowett

quote: The more things you do, the more you can do.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: They can conquer who believe they can.
author: Virgil

quote: When one must, one can.
author: Charlotte Whitton

quote: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
author: Dean Koontz

quote: Always desire to learn something useful.
author: Sophocles

quote: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
author: Sasha Cohen

quote: There is always room at the top.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Wherever you are - be all there.
author: Jim Elliot

quote: Step by step and the thing is done.
author: Charles Atlas

quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
author: Jack London

quote: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: You have to make it happen.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.
author: Mia Hamm

quote: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: The more we do, the more we can do.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
author: Jimmy Dean

quote: One finds limits by pushing them.
author: Herbert A. Simon

quote: Never give in and never give up.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
author: Eliza Dushku

quote: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: If you've got a talent, protect it.
author: Jim Carrey

quote: Know or listen to those who know.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Don't fight the problem, decide it.
author: George C. Marshall

quote: You never know what motivates you.
author: Cicely Tyson

quote: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
author: Judy Collins

quote: Many are called but few get up.
author: Oliver Herford

quote: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.
author: James Rollins

quote: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Do whatever you do intensely.
author: Robert Henri

quote: I come to win.
author: Leo Durocher

quote: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Confucius

quote: If you think you can do it, you can.
author: John Burroughs

quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quote: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It's always too early to quit.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: A will finds a way.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Who seeks shall find.
author: Sophocles

quote: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Nobody is guaranteed tomorrow, but why not have goals that are cool and motivational?
author: Morten Andersen

quote: Motivational talks are something I have been asked to do and i fancy taking a crack at it.
author: George Groves

quote: People always accuse me of being motivational in a way, like it was a bad thing, but that's just how I was raised. My mom raised me in a positive environment, with lots of love in my heart, and that reflects in my music.
author: Lenny Kravitz

quote: My dad is too cute. Every morning, he sends me one motivational quote. I have a folder full of all his quotes.
author: Alia Bhatt

quote: The people that are feeding you the information on things that I like - love life, believe in yourself, be motivational, give your time to things and meditate - they're all older people who are well into their 50s and have had careers, and for me, at this point, I'm the young ambassador for this whole lifestyle of making your mentality a reality.
author: Mod Sun

quote: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.
author: Marianne Vos

quote: Choosing a system is no longer enough, coaches have to be psychologists and motivational leaders too.
author: Giorgio Chiellini

quote: I'm on the playstation, or else I go out and play football. I enjoy movies and sitcoms. I love reading motivational books too.
author: Shreyas Iyer

quote: I like to put on hardcore when I have to clean my apartment, which I hate to do, but it's motivational. I like old heavy metal when I'm outside working on my car. Music has definite functions for me.
author: Peter Steele

quote: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
author: Woody Hayes

quote: I went to a motivational training course once, a course of self-discovery, and I found out after a week that my fear - it was not a fear of not being accepted - was a very violent fear of failure.
author: Emanuel Steward

quote: Our subliminal mental processes operate outside awareness because they arise in these portions of our mind that are inaccessible to our conscious self; their inaccessibility is due to the architecture of the brain rather than because they have been subject to Freudian motivational forces like repression.
author: Leonard Mlodinow

quote: People always need to hear good motivational speeches.
author: Rudy Ruettiger

quote: I listen to a lot of TED talks and motivational speakers.
author: Jordan Burroughs

quote: I'm thrilled to continue my partnership with U by Kotex for Generation Know while helping to empower girls. I've always been a motivational resource for my younger sisters and hope I can positively impact and inspire other young girls too.
author: Khloe Kardashian

quote: Giving back, doing motivational speeches and stuff like that, that's always made me feel good. If you repeatedly go out there, and you are the change that you want to see, then that's what you are.
author: Keke Palmer

quote: The occasional motivational speech gig tends to pay better than the books and television.
author: Bettany Hughes

quote: It's definitely a motivational factor, becoming a three-organization world champion.
author: Benson Henderson

quote: I'm a motivational speaker, so I'm going to look at something in as much of a positive way as possible.
author: Harris Faulkner

quote: Oh, I would love to be a motivational speaker. I have pulled myself out of a million potholes, and I can see the potholes ahead of me. That doesn't mean that I could always do that so perfectly for my own life. I totally fall in potholes.
author: Drew Barrymore

quote: You cannot compare Pep to any Brazilian coach. If you put all Brazilian coaches together, you would get Pep. One has motivational skills, another is tactically strong. But Pep has it all.
author: Douglas Costa

quote: Church is definitely still present in my life. Every Sunday I'm tuned in and then throughout the week I read scriptures, I read motivational messages.
author: Robert Covington

quote: I want to build a legacy at the WWE, but I definitely want to continue to grow the Bella Empire. I want it to go beyond the ring. I would love to be a motivational speaker.
author: Nikki Bella

quote: I can't put this down. I'm reading it in Spanish but I am still having English lessons. It is a motivational book about basketball legend Michael Jordan. His determination was inspiring. It helps me focus and drives me on.
author: Bojan Krkic

quote: Throughout my career, the pounding in my heart, the fright, has been ever-present, but I never turned back. Fear can be a highly motivational part of the journey.
author: Nina Tassler

quote: I have never moved away from my mainstay - trying to address all the environmental issues that come to me. I consult with law firms in the U.S., Australia, the U.K., Italy, Greece, and India to begin to address environmental disasters. I do motivational speaking.
author: Erin Brockovich

quote: One of the hidden benefits of me being a student manager at Kentucky was me having the responsibility of driving Rick Pitino to his motivational speaking engagements.
author: Frank Vogel

quote: You hope to bring your 'A Game' to any game, and of course you do in a final. You hope to bring experience, fitness, communication skills, motivational skills.
author: Edwin van der Sar

quote: I'm going to write a book, continue acting, continue motivational speaking and just share with people who I am and what I've learned in my second chance of life and pass it on to people in their first chance of life.
author: J. R. Martinez

quote: I was perceived to be a first- to third-rounder. I kind of had a tough junior year and fell to the fifth round. At that time, it was motivational.
author: Ryan Howard

quote: I'm a wrestler with nine toes. I'm a wrestler who has been through a lot of battles. I get to do a lot of motivational speaking, and people are blown away and say, 'You never quit. You keep coming back.'
author: Rulon Gardner

quote: Before I play matches I'm always switching myself on. That's why I have that walk-on music - Two Steps From Hell - they produce really good motivational gladiator-style music. As soon as that music comes on I'm switched on and I'm ready for a brawl!
author: Neil Robertson

quote: Ever since I was a kid, I knew I could play in the NFL because I had a knack for the game. But I can't play this game forever. When I'm finished, maybe I'll become a motivational speaker, maybe a preacher. But children need to know that life may be hard, but you can always overcome.
author: Ed Reed

quote: The Gunnar Challenge offers new workouts every day, a meal plan and daily 'verbal vitamins,' which are a motivational video or workout tip. The thing that really makes the program work is the forum, where Challengers can communicate with each other and with me.
author: Gunnar Peterson

quote: We need to accept that the commandments of God aren't just a long list of good ideas. They aren't 'life hacks' from an Internet blog or motivational quotes from a Pinterest board.
author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

quote: The Duke family, those are my brothers, and it's something I'll always take with me. Coach K, he gives me a lot of motivational things and checks in on me and my family. He knows where my heart is.
author: Brandon Ingram

quote: By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing; to be able to dare!
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
author: James Baldwin

quote: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: I think women are foolish to pretend they are equal to men; they are far superior and always have been.
author: William Golding

quote: I am a kind of paranoid in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: If the path be beautiful, let us not ask where it leads.
author: Anatole France

quote: A thief believes everybody steals.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: People find meaning and redemption in the most unusual human connections.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Andre Gide

quote: It is not enough to succeed. Others must fail.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Another world is not only possible, she is on her way. On a quiet day, I can hear her breathing.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.
author: Gerard De Nerval

quote: A good man can be stupid and still be good. But a bad man must have brains.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Surprise is the greatest gift which life can grant us.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Look at the sky; remind yourself of the cosmos. Seek vastness at every opportunity in order to see the smallness of yourself.
author: Matt Haig

quote: When I grow up I want to be a little boy.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Finance is a gun. Politics is knowing when to pull the trigger.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

quote: The Cemetery of Forgotten Books is like the greatest, most fantastic library you could ever imagine. It's a labyrinth of books with tunnels, bridges, arches, secret sections - and it's hidden inside an old palace in the old city of Barcelona.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: An autobiography can distort; facts can be realigned. But fiction never lies: it reveals the writer totally.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: I delight in what I fear.
author: Shirley Jackson

quote: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Journalism without a moral position is impossible. Every journalist is a moralist. It's absolutely unavoidable.
author: Marguerite Duras

quote: When I have worries, fears or a love affair, I have the luck of being able to transform it into a poem.
author: Mario Benedetti

quote: We sit in the mud... and reach for the stars.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: The good old days are now.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: Heretics are the only bitter remedy against the entropy of human thought.
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin

quote: In youth we learn; in age we understand.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Two armies that fight each other is like one large army that commits suicide.
author: Henri Barbusse

quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
author: George A. Moore

quote: Ripley is married. And he's not lost. He has his feet on the ground.
author: Patricia Highsmith

quote: When I got out of undergrad, I had a degree in theater and telecommunications. My first job, I was a news reporter for the local stories for NPR. Then I was a country-western DJ. I did data entry for a yearbook company. In my mid-20s I went back to grad school at NYU, and I specialized in playwriting.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: I love planting. I love digging holes, putting plants in, tapping them in. And I love weeding, but I don't like tidying up the garden afterwards.
author: Jamaica Kincaid

quote: I think it's one of the scars in our culture that we have too high an opinion of ourselves. We align ourselves with the angels instead of the higher primates.
author: Angela Carter

quote: Jealousy is the fear of comparison.
author: Max Frisch

quote: I think young writers should get other degrees first, social sciences, arts degrees or even business degrees. What you learn is research skills, a necessity because a lot of writing is about trying to find information.
author: Irvine Welsh

quote: An age is called Dark not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it.
author: James A. Michener

quote: There is no real beauty without some slight imperfection.
author: James Salter

quote: In every conceivable manner, the family is link to our past, bridge to our future.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Novels are not about expressing yourself, they're about something beautiful, funny, clever and organic. Self-expression? Go and ring a bell in a yard if you want to express yourself.
author: Zadie Smith

quote: Literature overtakes history, for literature gives you more than one life. It expands experience and opens new opportunities to readers.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: Life is tragic and absurd, and none of it has any purpose at all.
author: T. C. Boyle

quote: Californians invented the concept of life-style. This alone warrants their doom.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: In my own view, Hamas's frustration derives from a lack of legitimization by Israel and by much of the world. It is this frustration that leads them to such destructive desperation. That's why we need to grant them status as a legitimate enemy - before we talk about an agreement or, alternatively, about a frontal war.
author: A. B. Yehoshua

quote: If you see the magic in a fairy tale, you can face the future.
author: Danielle Steel

quote: When you grow up on an island, what matters is how you stand to the sea.
author: Roddy Doyle

quote: I was aware, in those early days of motherhood, that my behaviour was strange to the people who knew me well. It was as though I had been brainwashed, taken over by a cult religion. And yet this cult, motherhood, was not a place where I could actually live. Like any cult, it demanded a complete surrender of identity to belong to it.
author: Rachel Cusk

quote: Oddly enough, my favorite genre is not fiction. I'm attracted by primary sources that are relevant to historical questions of interest to me, by famous old books on philosophy or theology that I want to see with my own eyes, by essays on contemporary science, by the literatures of antiquity.
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own.
author: Nelson Algren

quote: 'Look at Me' started with Rockford, Illinois and New York and the question of how much image culture was changing our inner lives. That's an abstract idea; you don't think that's going to be a rocking work of fiction, but it seemed to fuse in a way that was interesting.
author: Jennifer Egan

quote: The beauty of dystopia is that it lets us vicariously experience future worlds - but we still have the power to change our own.
author: Ally Condie

quote: My years as a therapist working with abuse and neglect families taught me at least one important lesson for my own life. Never judge until you can see through the eyes of that person you are judging, and then... never judge.
author: Chris Crutcher

quote: Each person does see the world in a different way. There is not a single, unifying, objective truth. We're all limited by our perspective.
author: Siri Hustvedt

quote: Anything in literature, including memory, is second-hand.
author: Herta Muller

quote: The only true love is love at first sight; second sight dispels it.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: The storytelling gift is innate: one has it or one doesn't. But style is at least partly a learned thing: one refines it by looking and listening and reading and practice - by work.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: I wrote each book in thirty-five days flat - just to get the darned thing finished.
author: Alistair Maclean

quote: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.
author: Alan Paton

quote: When I was 10 years old, I threw a bottle with a note in it in the ocean in Massachusetts, and Harrison Salisbury found it and contacted me. We began a correspondence that lasted for years, and I eventually met him when I was 18.
author: Amor Towles

quote: What I need to write well is a combination of heat, light and solitude.
author: A. S. Byatt

quote: As an undergraduate, I took a theology course titled Religion as Writing. If writing can be considered a form of faith, then inevitably doubt has to accompany it.
author: Dinaw Mengestu

quote: Reading is a conversation. All books talk. But a good book listens as well.
author: Mark Haddon

quote: Try to leave the Earth a better place than when you arrived.
author: Sidney Sheldon

quote: Love is cheap. You can buy it anywhere. Lives are cheap. It's money that's dear. You have to work days and sit up nights thinking how to make money.
author: John Dos Passos

quote: Baseball is meant to be a contemplative game. They play music to draw young people to the game. If young people can't come to the game without music, then they should stay home.
author: W. P. Kinsella

quote: As a children's author, reviewers are generally very nice to you. I only ever wrote one adult book and received such a kicking for it that I was in trauma for the next six months.
author: Anthony Horowitz

quote: Part of adulthood is searching for the people who understand you.
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: I love Franschhoek, and straight off the plane, I went to the incomparable Quartier Francais, on the main street, for breakfast. This small hotel and restaurant is regularly near the top of every poll for best hotel and restaurant in Africa.
author: Justin Cartwright

quote: No brilliance is needed in the law. Nothing but common sense, and relatively clean finger nails.
author: John Mortimer

quote: Income tax returns are the most imaginative fiction being written today.
author: Herman Wouk

quote: I have made so many mistakes as a mother. But the one thing that I know I do is I make sure my children know how much I love them and they are absolutely secure in that.
author: Ayelet Waldman

quote: Death is such a strange thing. One minute you're here and then just gone. You'd think there would be an anteroom, a place where you could be visited before you go.
author: John Banville

quote: Climate change joined immigration, job creation, food safety, pilot training, veterans' care, campaign finance, transportation security, labor law, mine safety, wildfire management, and scores of executive and judicial appointments on the list of matters that the world's greatest deliberative body is incapable of addressing.
author: George Packer

quote: The true currency of life is time, not money, and we've all got a limited stock of that.
author: Robert Harris

quote: I used my NEA fellowship to write my novel, 'In Country,' which was published by Harper & Row in 1985.
author: Bobbie Ann Mason

quote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Still round the corner there may wait, A new road or a secret gate.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: The answers you get from literature depend on the questions you pose.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.
author: Harper Lee

quote: He who rides the sea of the Nile must have sails woven of patience.
author: William Golding

quote: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Honest people don't hide their deeds.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: We all die. The goal isn't to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: When people hear good music, it makes them homesick for something they never had, and never will have.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: The eyes those silent tongues of love.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: What matters in life is not what happens to you but what you remember and how you remember it.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

quote: The king died and then the queen died is a story. The king died, and then queen died of grief is a plot.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Winter is not a season, it's an occupation.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: Nothing happens in a vacuum in life: every action has a series of consequences, and sometimes it takes a long time to fully understand the consequences of our actions.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
author: George MacDonald

quote: I'm not a conspiracy theorist - I'm a conspiracy analyst.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: If you shut up truth, and bury it underground, it will but grow.
author: Emile Zola

quote: Vast sections of the world's population are inspired by the same desires and live for common interests that bind them together far more than they separate them.
author: Mikhail Sholokhov

quote: There is always one moment in childhood when the door opens and lets the future in.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Literature is the art of discovering something extraordinary about ordinary people, and saying with ordinary words something extraordinary.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another's fear.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: A lawyer with his briefcase can steal more than a hundred men with guns.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: God did not intend religion to be an exercise club.
author: Naguib Mahfouz

quote: Mention the gothic, and many readers will probably picture gloomy castles and an assortment of sinister Victoriana. However, the truth is that the gothic genre has continued to flourish and evolve since the days of Bram Stoker, producing some of its most interesting and accomplished examples in the 20th century - in literature, film and beyond.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: It seems very safe to me to be surrounded by green growing things and water.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: To find joy in work is to discover the fountain of youth.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: The world is always in movement.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: Creativity itself doesn't care at all about results - the only thing it craves is the process. Learn to love the process and let whatever happens next happen, without fussing too much about it. Work like a monk, or a mule, or some other representative metaphor for diligence. Love the work. Destiny will do what it wants with you, regardless.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: You have to be very fond of men. Very, very fond. You have to be very fond of them to love them. Otherwise they're simply unbearable.
author: Marguerite Duras

quote: Our perfect companions never have fewer than four feet.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quote: I rolled myself up into a tight ball of resistance and it was thus that I went through my school years.
author: Sigrid Undset

quote: Culture is mix. Culture means a mix of things from other sources. And my town, Istanbul, was this kind of mix. Istanbul, in fact, and my work, is a testimony to the fact that East and West combine cultural gracefully, or sometimes in an anarchic way, came together, and that is what we should search for.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: I survived many a youth hostel bunk room reading Tolstoy by flashlight.
author: Maria Semple

quote: Explosions are not comfortable.
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin

quote: Naked is the best disguise.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread.
author: Richard Wright

quote: Women want love to be a novel, men a short story.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: I see too deep and too much.
author: Henri Barbusse

quote: Some things are so unexpected that no one is prepared for them.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: A beautiful woman must expect to be more accountable for her steps, than one less attractive.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Your own mind is a sacred enclosure into which nothing harmful can enter except by your permission.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: Fate is not an eagle, it creeps like a rat.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: When man wanted to make a machine that would walk he created the wheel, which does not resemble a leg.
author: Guillaume Apollinaire

quote: Life isn't fair. It's just fairer than death, that's all.
author: William Goldman

quote: Nothing is a matter of life and death except life and death.
author: Angela Carter

quote: Time does not change us. It just unfolds us.
author: Max Frisch

quote: There comes a time when you realize that everything is a dream, and only those things preserved in writing have any possibility of being real.
author: James Salter

quote: If you look up every last detail on your subject, you'll never finish.
author: Andy Weir

quote: The great thing about getting older is that you become more mellow. Things aren't as black and white, and you become much more tolerant. You can see the good in things much more easily rather than getting enraged as you used to do when you were young.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: Happiness can only be found if you can free yourself of all other distractions.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Maine is a joy in the summer. But the soul of Maine is more apparent in the winter.
author: Paul Theroux

quote: Nobody can do for little children what grandparents do. Grandparents sort of sprinkle stardust over the lives of little children.
author: Alex Haley

quote: A Jew without Jews, without Judaism, without Zionism, without Jewishness, without a temple or an army or even a pistol, a Jew clearly without a home, just the object itself, like a glass or an apple.
author: Philip Roth

quote: It's always good to remember where you come from and celebrate it. To remember where you come from is part of where you're going.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Loneliness is and always has been the central and inevitable experience of every man.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: The novel is a seduction; a reader has to be seduced.
author: T. C. Boyle

quote: People who are powerless make an open theater of violence.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: Let us not forget: The Palestinians in Gaza are our permanent neighbors, and we are theirs.
author: A. B. Yehoshua

quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: When I was a kid, if you didn't speak Irish, you really wanted to. And you played Gaelic games and you didn't pay any attention to what was happening in the outside world, because really, Ireland was the center of the universe. And I don't think that's the case anymore. Although, admittedly, it is the center of the universe.
author: Roddy Doyle

quote: I wrote every day between the ages of 12 and 20 when I stopped because I went to Barcelona, where life was too exciting to write.
author: Colm Toibin

quote: Modern morality is all about perception.
author: Rachel Cusk

quote: Stupidity is the deliberate cultivation of ignorance.
author: William Gaddis

quote: I'm a great admirer of secularism. At its best, I think it's one of the best things that we have. I don't believe in insinuating religion into conversation. I don't believe in excluding it from conversation. I enjoy the fact that people's innermost thoughts are their own.
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: Comparison is painful. Don't be cowed by other people's pretty pictures. When you feel unimpressive, or irrelevant, that has nothing to do with what you're actually capable of.
author: Jennifer Egan

quote: When we read dystopia, we root for these people to break free because we are these people; hoping and fighting against things that are bigger than ourselves.
author: Ally Condie

quote: Nothing about life is sacred until we make it so.
author: Chris Crutcher

quote: Sometimes you can do all the right things and not succeed. And that's a hard lesson of reality.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: Time is money says the proverb, but turn it around and you get a precious truth. Money is time.
author: George Gissing

quote: I have suffered from migraines since childhood and have long been curious about my own aching head, my dizziness, my divine lifting feelings, my sparklers and black holes, and my single visual hallucination of a little pink man and a pink ox on the floor of my bedroom.
author: Siri Hustvedt

quote: I'm not a born writer, and I don't enjoy writing.
author: Alistair Maclean

quote: God forgives us... who am I not to forgive?
author: Alan Paton

quote: 'Sag Harbor' was a very different book for me. It changed the way I thought about books that I wanted to do.
author: Colson Whitehead

quote: I live in America. I have the right to write whatever I want. And it's equaled by another right just as powerful: the right not to read it. Freedom of speech includes the freedom to offend people.
author: Brad Thor

quote: My only regret about being gay is that I repressed it for so long. I surrendered my youth to the people I feared when I could have been out there loving someone. Don't make that mistake yourself. Life's too damn short.
author: Armistead Maupin

quote: The Bourbon King was first ambassador of reason and human happiness.
author: Heinrich Mann

quote: But there are some wounds that can never be healed.
author: Helen Garner

quote: A desert is a place without expectation.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: People don't choose their careers; they are engulfed by them.
author: John Dos Passos

quote: Love is dangerous; it's not something to be trifled with. As good as it feels on the way in, it feels that much worse on the way out.
author: Patrick deWitt

quote: Shame doesn't exist as an emotion without the projected or perceived sense of judgment coming from somewhere else.
author: Leslie Jamison

quote: Florence is perhaps best known for being the seat of Renaissance art, and rightly so: A greatest-hits collection of artists passed through its streets - Michelangelo, Leonardo, Botticelli, and Brunelleschi among them.
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: I voluntarily inflicted a certain level of insanity on myself.
author: Jonathan Franzen

quote: Survival is triumph enough.
author: Harry Crews

quote: I never actually plan sequels. They demand to be done.
author: Ellen Hopkins

quote: Dostoevsky is such a bad writer it is hard to take him seriously as a novelist, though he is a wonderful philosopher.
author: John Banville

quote: Grief doesn't have a plot. It isn't smooth. There is no beginning and middle and end.
author: Ann Hood

quote: I work toward the liberation of women, but I'm not feminist. I'm just a woman.
author: Buchi Emecheta

quote: Where would the memoir be without bipolar writers? I mean, that's what - that whole oversharing thing is really a very clear symptom of bipolar disorder. And I'm not saying that every, you know, I'm not accusing every memoirist of being bipolar. But I think in a way it's kind of a gift.
author: Ayelet Waldman

quote: If one tries to think about history, it seems to me - it's like looking at a range of mountains. And the first time you see them, they look one way. But then time changes, the pattern of light shifts. Maybe you've moved slightly, your perspective has changed. The mountains are the same, but they look very different.
author: Robert Harris

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: Gardening is not a rational act.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
author: Harper Lee

quote: I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.
author: Jack London

quote: Before the Second World War, I believed in the perfectability of social man; that a correct structure of society produced goodwill; and that, therefore, you could remove all social ills by a reorganisation of society. It is possible that I believe something of the same again; but after the war, I did not because I was unable to.
author: William Golding

quote: How long should a man's legs be? Long enough to touch the ground.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: I have dreamed in my life, dreams that have stayed with me ever after, and changed my ideas; they have gone through and through me, like wine through water, and altered the color of my mind.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Look back, and smile on perils past.
author: Walter Scott

quote: From even the greatest of horrors, irony is seldom absent.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: The unreal is more powerful than the real, because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it, because it's only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles, wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home.
author: James Joyce

quote: As you enter positions of trust and power, dream a little before you think.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: 'Sex' is as important as eating or drinking and we ought to allow the one appetite to be satisfied with as little restraint or false modesty as the other.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: No, not rich. I am a poor man with money, which is not the same thing.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: There is no such thing as perfect security, only varying levels of insecurity.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: The breaking of a wave cannot explain the whole sea.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: People will buy anything that is 'one to a customer.'
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: Everyone is an ocean inside. Every individual walking the street. Everyone is a universe of thoughts, and insights, and feelings. But every person is crippled in his or her own way by our inability to truly present ourselves to the world.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for something you are not.
author: Andre Gide

quote: If we were to lose the ability to be emotional, if we were to lose the ability to be angry, to be outraged, we would be robots. And I refuse that.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: Life is made up of marble and mud.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The artist vocation is to send light into the human heart.
author: George Sand

quote: It has been rightly said that nothing is unimportant, nothing powerless in the universe; a single atom can dissolve everything, and save everything! What terror! There lies the eternal distinction between good and evil.
author: Gerard De Nerval

quote: Only mothers can think of the future - because they give birth to it in their children.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Man is born to live and not to prepare to live.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: The problem with the Internet is that it gives you everything - reliable material and crazy material. So the problem becomes, how do you discriminate?
author: Umberto Eco

quote: The only wealth in this world is children, more than all the money, power on earth.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: I am, as I am; whether hideous, or handsome, depends upon who is made judge.
author: Herman Melville

quote: The Cemetery of Forgotten Books is a metaphor, not just for books but for ideas, for language, for knowledge, for beauty, for all the things that make us human, for collecting memory.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: Stop a minute, right where you are. Relax your shoulders, shake your head and spine like a dog shaking off cold water. Tell that imperious voice in your head to be still.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: Love alone could waken love.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: My life is short. I can't listen to banality.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: Marriage is not simply a romantic union between two people; it's also a political and economic contract of the highest order.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Our knowledge is a little island in a great ocean of nonknowledge.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: When a woman drinks it's as if an animal were drinking, or a child. Alcoholism is scandalous in a woman, and a female alcoholic is rare, a serious matter. It's a slur on the divine in our nature.
author: Marguerite Duras

quote: To desire and expect nothing for oneself and to have profound sympathy for others is genuine holiness.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: I write a world where everyone is partly right.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: Helicopters don't fly, they vibrate so badly the ground rejects them.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: Memnoch the Devil happen to be my favorite of all The Vampire Chronicles.
author: Anne Rice

quote: What you risk reveals what you value.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Writers should be read, but neither seen nor heard.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: It is not a woman I want - it is all women.
author: Henri Barbusse

quote: The truth is that I am in love with Dublin. I think it is the most beautiful town that I have ever seen, mountains at the back and the sea in front, and long roads winding through decaying suburbs and beautiful woods.
author: George A. Moore

quote: Land is the only thing in the world that amounts to anything, for 'Tis the only thing in this world that lasts, 'Tis the only thing worth working for, worth fighting for - worth dying for.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: There can be no knowledge without emotion. We may be aware of a truth, yet until we have felt its force, it is not ours. To the cognition of the brain must be added the experience of the soul.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: In 'The Hunger Games,' in most people's idea, in terms of rebellion or a civil-war situation, that would meet the criteria for a necessary war. These people are oppressed, their children are being taken off and put in gladiator games. They're impoverished, they're starving, they're brutalized.
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: Illusions are art, for the feeling person, and it is by art that we live, if we do.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Nobody knows anything.
author: William Goldman

quote: What is marriage but prostitution to one man instead of many?
author: Angela Carter

quote: It's part of me, Scotland. I'm still immersed in it even though I am not there.
author: Irvine Welsh

quote: Scientists dream about doing great things. Engineers do them.
author: James A. Michener

quote: I like aristocracy. I like the beauty of aristocracy. I like the hierarchical feeling.
author: James Salter

quote: Nothing in life is so hard that you can't make it easier by the way you take it.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: Young people have a right to optimism, and rightly so; human beings have grown and developed and accomplished wonderful feats in the world. But what mires me in pessimism is the fact that so much of life is pain and sorrow and willful ignorance and violence, and pushing back against that tide takes so much effort, so much steady fight. It's tiring.
author: Jesmyn Ward

quote: I've been very lucky and I have a happy old age with good family and friends still around.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: You get your inspiration - suggestions - wherever you have to, even from your mother.
author: Vikram Seth

quote: You can't state difference and also state equality. We have to state sameness to understand equality.
author: Zadie Smith

quote: We all need money, but there are degrees of desperation.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Courage is never to let your actions be influenced by your fears.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: I'm not a great deep political thinker.
author: David Mitchell

quote: Always imitate the behavior of the winners when you lose.
author: George Meredith

quote: The future belongs to crowds.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: I see people in terms of dialogue and I believe that people are their talk.
author: Roddy Doyle

quote: A truly great book should be read in youth, again in maturity and once more in old age, as a fine building should be seen by morning light, at noon and by moonlight.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: I wrote 'Yellow Submarine' for the Beatles. I wrote the screenplay for 'The Games,' about the Olympic Games. I wrote 'Love Story,' both the novel and the screenplay. I wrote 'RPM' for Stanley Kramer. Plus, I wrote two scholarly books and a 400-page translation from the Latin, and I dated June Wilkinson!
author: Erich Segal

quote: The true self seeks release, not constraint. It doesn't want to be corseted in a sonnet or made to learn a system of musical notations. It wants liberation, which is why very often it fastens on the novel, for the novel seems spacious, undefined, free.
author: Rachel Cusk

quote: Justice? You get justice in the next world, in this world you have the law.
author: William Gaddis

quote: What isn't for everybody shouldn't be for anybody: the world's opera houses are the reasons we have cardboard cities.
author: Howard Jacobson

quote: Being an old maid is like death by drowning, a really delightful sensation after you cease to struggle.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: The temple of art is built in words.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: For me, the watershed was Hurricane Katrina. If that didn't get people out on the streets, then what will?
author: Claire Messud

quote: The whole structure of African government, as far back as we know, was based on tyranny. One guy ran the show. Chiefs like Chaka and Mzilikazi committed terrible atrocities. That is the tradition from which modern African rulers spring. It won't change easily overnight.
author: Wilbur Smith

quote: Selfishness is the only real atheism; aspiration, unselfishness, the only real religion.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: Recollection is not something that I can summon up, it simply comes and I am the servant of it.
author: Edna O'Brien

quote: The work is with me when I wake up in the morning; it is with me while I eat my breakfast in bed and run through the newspaper, while I shave and bathe and dress.
author: C. S. Forester

quote: Words are but the vague shadows of the volumes we mean. Little audible links, they are, chaining together great inaudible feelings and purposes.
author: Theodore Dreiser

quote: It is impossible to persuade a man who does not disagree, but smiles.
author: Muriel Spark

quote: I really believe that a writer is someone who has trained their mind to misbehave.
author: Brad Thor

quote: If Moses had gone to Harvard Law School and spent three years working on the Hill, he would have written the Ten Commandments with three exceptions and a saving clause.
author: Charles Morgan

quote: Obviously, in marketing, the best tool is to show the autobiography in fiction. It's inevitable how that happens, but it's generic. Say I've written a story where my sister dies. 'Well, did your sister die?' No, she did not. But people use those straws to grasp at the difference between reality and fiction.
author: Dinaw Mengestu

quote: Every life is narrow. Our only escape is not to run away, but to learn to love the people we are and the world in which we find ourselves.
author: Mark Haddon

quote: As in all matters involving love, which has so many different meanings, you find that the feeling that we label 'love' is not a simple feeling, it's a very complex one. Under the heading 'love' can come all sorts of rage and desperation.
author: Helen Garner

quote: Women's value has been under-recognized for far too long.
author: Sidney Sheldon

quote: I have no interest in non-fiction. I don't read it and don't watch it and don't write it, other than a little journalistic column.
author: W. P. Kinsella

quote: If you ever forget you're a Jew, a Gentile will remind you.
author: Bernard Malamud

quote: I hate editing. I love to write, but I hate to reread my stuff. To revise.
author: Barry Hannah

quote: I love John Updike immoderately. I am profoundly shocked that he has gone because he was, for me, the greatest American writer of the second half of the 20th century. He was also a gracious, charming, and witty man.
author: Justin Cartwright

quote: If you make money your god, it will plague you like the devil.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Writing about magic is harder than writing about spies because you're dealing with something that doesn't really exist.
author: Anthony Horowitz

quote: For memory, we use our imagination. We take a few strands of real time and carry them with us, then like an oyster we create a pearl around them.
author: John Banville

quote: When we deal with death, the pupils will always be fixed and dilated, which indicates that there is no longer brain activity or response.
author: Ann Hood

quote: The only imaginative fiction being written today is income tax returns.
author: Herman Wouk

quote: White male privilege remains alive in America, but the phrase would seem odd, if not infuriating, to a sixty-year-old man working as a Walmart greeter in southern Ohio.
author: George Packer

quote: However long, it's definitely the presence of other people that brings out the weirdness - that collision of your own way of being with the everyday lives of others, the abrupt awareness - always a surprise no matter how often it's happened - that their lives are very different from your own.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: It is certain, in any case, that ignorance, allied with power, is the most ferocious enemy justice can have.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Reading and writing, like everything else, improve with practice. And, of course, if there are no young readers and writers, there will shortly be no older ones. Literacy will be dead, and democracy - which many believe goes hand in hand with it - will be dead as well.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burden of it to anyone else.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Darn the wheel of the world! Why must it continually turn over? Where is the reverse gear?
author: Jack London

quote: Man produces evil as a bee produces honey.
author: William Golding

quote: I'm aware that many of my friends will be saddened and shocked, or shock-saddened, over some of the chapters in 'The Catcher in the Rye.' Some of my best friends are children. In fact, all my best friends are children. It's almost unbearable for me to realize that my book will be kept on a shelf, out of their reach.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: To all, to each, a fair good-night, and pleasing dreams, and slumbers light.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Ocean is more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the dreams of Time.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: Find out what you're afraid of and go live there.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: The man who can keep a secret may be wise, but he is not half as wise as the man with no secrets to keep.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: I've already told you: the only way to a woman's heart is along the path of torment. I know none other as sure.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
author: Richard Bach

quote: I don't care what anybody says about me as long as it isn't true.
author: Truman Capote

quote: What is the good of your stars and trees, your sunrise and the wind, if they do not enter into our daily lives?
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Caress the detail, the divine detail.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: There is this myth, that America is a melting pot, but what happens in assimilation is that we end up deliberately choosing the American things - hot dogs and apple pie - and ignoring the Chinese offerings.
author: Amy Tan

quote: All human beings are also dream beings. Dreaming ties all mankind together.
author: Jack Kerouac

quote: Attitudes are more important than facts.
author: George MacDonald

quote: Style is knowing who you are, what you want to say, and not giving a damn.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upward on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
author: Emile Zola

quote: When everything is easy one quickly gets stupid.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Celebrity is a mask that eats into the face.
author: John Updike

quote: Never quit a job as a matter of principle. You'll always regret it.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Friendship and money: oil and water.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men.
author: Herman Melville

quote: According to Islamic principles, when a man is accused of heresy, he is given the choice between repentance and punishment.
author: Naguib Mahfouz

quote: Nostalgia isn't what it used to be.
author: Peter De Vries

quote: If there is one place on the face of earth where all the dreams of living men have found a home from the very earliest days when man began the dream of existence, it is India.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: My childhood was surrounded by books and writing. From a very early age I was fascinated by storytelling, by the printed word, by language, by ideas. So I would seek them out.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation?
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: It was a good place for getting lost in, a city no one ever knew, a city explored from the neutral heart outward, until after many years, it defined itself into a jumble of clearings separated by stretches of the unknown, through which the narrowest of paths had been cut.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: We must believe in free will, we have no choice.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: I see journalists as the manual workers, the laborers of the word. Journalism can only be literature when it is passionate.
author: Marguerite Duras

quote: But he that dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: An intellectual's weapon is writing, but sometimes people react as if it were a firearm. A writer can do a lot to change the situation, but as far as I know, no dictatorship has fallen because of a sonnet.
author: Mario Benedetti

quote: The worst cynicism: a belief in luck.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: A museum should not just be a place for fancy paintings but should be a place where we can communicate our lives through our everyday objects.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of hunger for life that gnaws in us all.
author: Richard Wright

quote: The poor man wishes to conceal his poverty, and the rich man his wealth: the former fears lest he be despised, the latter lest he be plundered.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Nothing in the Middle East is ever forgotten or forgiven.
author: Michael Korda

quote: Remorse: beholding heaven and feeling hell.
author: George A. Moore

quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: Autumn arrives in early morning, but spring at the close of a winter day.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: When I moved out here to California, I became obsessed with geology. It's impossible not to be interested in the earth if you live in a place like this. I started to read a lot of geology, much to the horror of my friends.
author: Jamaica Kincaid

quote: Aeneas carried his aged father on his back from the ruins of Troy and so do we all, whether we like it or not, perhaps even if we have never known them.
author: Angela Carter

quote: Hugo Boss is my kind of label.
author: Irvine Welsh

quote: Character consists of what you do on the third and fourth tries.
author: James A. Michener

quote: It is lovely, when I forget all birthdays, including my own, to find that somebody remembers me.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: As a memorial, I'd like a statue. Not of me, but a little modern statue, in marble or bronze, maybe of a bird, in a park where children could play and people going by could see it. On it, I'd just like it to say: 'Maeve Binchy, storyteller' and people could look at the name and remember that they'd seen it somewhere else.
author: Maeve Binchy

quote: If you don't risk anything, you risk even more.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I think art, especially literature, has the particular power to immerse the viewer or reader into another world. This is especially powerful in literature, when a reader lives the experience of the characters. So if the characters are human and real enough, then readers will feel empathy for them.
author: Jesmyn Ward

quote: 'Ghost City' began as a idea. I felt that I hadn't read or heard a great deal about the sort of life that I thought I had, and I just thought that it would be interesting to sit down and see if I could put it down onto paper.
author: Ronald Frame

quote: I don't think any good book is based on factual experience. Bad books are about things the writer already knew before he wrote them.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: Death the last voyage, the longest, and the best.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: The most persistent sound which reverberates through man's history is the beating of war drums.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: It's hard to say how certain stories just punch us in the heart and the brain at the same time at the end. I suppose that's what we're all looking for. But each story has its own valence, its own way of saying goodbye to you.
author: T. C. Boyle

quote: I slept for four years. I didn't study much of anything. I majored in something called communication arts.
author: Don DeLillo

quote: People have entire relationships via text message now, but I am not partial to texting. I need context, nuance and the warmth and tone that can only come from a human voice.
author: Danielle Steel

quote: I had to make sure I kept an eye on the real world.
author: Roddy Doyle

quote: Sometimes I amaze even myself.
author: Erich Segal

quote: The woman who has her being in marriage and motherhood has become part of antithetical reality, revoking property from the woman who remains in a condition of intangible femininity.
author: Rachel Cusk

quote: Nothing is definite, nothing is finished, nothing is determined.
author: Howard Jacobson

quote: I see the player piano as the grandfather of the computer, the ancestor of the entire nightmare we live in, the birth of the binary world where there is no option other than yes or no and where there is no refuge.
author: William Gaddis

quote: There is no royal road to anything, one thing at a time, all things in succession. That which grows fast, withers as rapidly. That which grows slowly, endures.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: I was born and raised in southern Utah.
author: Ally Condie

quote: Obstruction can be caused by so many factors - perfectionism, distraction, faltering confidence, external demands and pressures. At some point, of course, you've got to push through it all if you're to write, and if you don't, or can't, you're sunk.
author: Claire Messud

quote: That is one of the bitter curses of poverty; it leaves no right to be generous.
author: George Gissing

quote: Literature throws us many great heroes. Real life invariably outdoes them.
author: Wilbur Smith

quote: The Past: Our cradle, not our prison; there is danger as well as appeal in its glamour. The past is for inspiration, not imitation, for continuation, not repetition.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: I'd rather write one good book than ten mediocre ones.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: Nothing is proved, all is permitted.
author: Theodore Dreiser

quote: To give up the task of reforming society is to give up one's responsibility as a free man.
author: Alan Paton

quote: What can a first impression tell us about anyone? Why, no more than a chord can tell us about Beethoven, or a brushstroke about Botticelli.
author: Amor Towles

quote: There is no justice in social justice, and there is no equality in social equality.
author: Brad Thor

quote: I told my parents I was going to be a doctor and then a lawyer, but I never believed it and never tried.
author: Dinaw Mengestu

quote: Fiction that responds to recent world events is a hostage to fortune, because all momentous events look very different a year, two years, three years later.
author: Mark Haddon

quote: My heroes are those who risk their lives every day to protect our world and make it a better place - police, firefighters and members of our armed forces.
author: Sidney Sheldon

quote: If there is a special Hell for writers it would be in the forced contemplation of their own works.
author: John Dos Passos

quote: Time is change; we measure its passing by how much things alter.
author: Nadine Gordimer

quote: The crack of the bat, the sound of baseballs thumping into gloves, the infield chatter are like birdsong to the baseball starved.
author: W. P. Kinsella

quote: Teaching, real teaching, is - or ought to be - a messy business.
author: Harry Crews

quote: I think for a lot of people, friendship is a relationship that gets devalued once they move on to what people consider to be more important relationships: once you find a partner or when you have kids.
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: My greatest fear is disappointing the reader, so each book has to be better than the one before.
author: Anthony Horowitz

quote: The Sheldonian Theatre in Oxford is an astonishing building, designed by Christopher Wren. Its painted ceiling has just been restored so that the darkish miasma that was Robert Streeter's original allegory of truth and light striking the university is now bright with playful cherubs and lustrous clouds.
author: Justin Cartwright

quote: The invisibility of work and workers in the digital age is as consequential as the rise of the assembly line and, later, the service economy.
author: George Packer

quote: I pity the young woman who will attempt to insinuate herself between my mama's boy and me. I sympathize with the monumental nature of her task. It will take a crowbar, two bulldozers and half a dozen Molotov cocktails to pry my Oedipus and me loose from one another.
author: Ayelet Waldman

quote: No one expects the doormat to stand upright, shake itself off, and amble down the street to seek its own happiness.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: If you go back, 'The Great Gatsby' would be a portrait of the rich and fortune made by business.
author: Robert Harris

quote: Christmas is far and away my favorite holiday. I love everything about it, from the event that inspired it, hoping for a white one, to wrapping presents. But mostly I love having family and friends gathered, and sharing traditions.
author: Ellen Hopkins

quote: There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: If I waited for perfection... I would never write a word.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The book to read is not the one which thinks for you, but the one which makes you think. No book in the world equals the Bible for that.
author: Harper Lee

quote: My yesterdays walk with me. They keep step, they are gray faces that peer over my shoulder.
author: William Golding

quote: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: If a farmer fills his barn with grain, he gets mice. If he leaves it empty, he gets actors.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The process of delving into the black abyss is to me the keenest form of fascination.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: People don't want their lives fixed. Nobody wants their problems solved. Their dramas. Their distractions. Their stories resolved. Their messed cleaned up. Because what would they have left? Just the big scary unknown.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: A man will do more for his stubbornness than for his religion or his country.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: I try to avoid looking forward or backward, and try to keep looking upward.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Don't believe what your eyes are telling you. All they show is limitation. Look with your understanding, find out what you already know, and you'll see the way to fly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Love, having no geography, knows no boundaries.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Spoon feeding in the long run teaches us nothing but the shape of the spoon.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: He who has seen one cathedral ten times has seen something; he who has seen ten cathedrals once has seen but little; and he who has spent half an hour in each of a hundred cathedrals has seen nothing at all.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: I was intelligent enough to make up my own mind. I not only had freedom of choice, I had freedom of expression.
author: Amy Tan

quote: Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Conceit spoils the finest genius. There is not much danger that real talent or goodness will be overlooked long; even if it is, the consciousness of possessing and using it well should satisfy one, and the great charm of all power is modesty.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: There are two men inside the artist, the poet and the craftsman. One is born a poet. One becomes a craftsman.
author: Emile Zola

quote: When work is a pleasure, life is a joy! When work is a duty, life is slavery.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: What for centuries raised man above the beast is not the cudgel but the irresistible power of unarmed truth.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: He was a self-made man who owed his lack of success to nobody.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: In an age of never-ending health fads, it's comforting to learn that one of the healthiest activities you can do has existed for millennia. It's called reading. Yes, books are not just entertaining or educational: they can also improve your mental health.
author: Matt Haig

quote: A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities.
author: Herman Melville

quote: We are not primarily put on this earth to see through one another, but to see one another through.
author: Peter De Vries

quote: I know at last what distinguishes man from animals; financial worries.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: I take a simple view of life. It is keep your eyes open and get on with it.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: I very much dislike writing about myself or my work, and when pressed for autobiographical material can only give a bare chronological outline which contains no pertinent facts.
author: Shirley Jackson

quote: Inspiration usually comes during work, rather than before it.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Adoration isn't love.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: I do not write for the reader to come, but for him who is here, short of reading the text on my shoulder.
author: Mario Benedetti

quote: I agree with no one's opinion. I have some of my own.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: The writer's secret is not inspiration - for it is never clear where it comes from - it is his stubbornness, his patience.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: There's something uniquely exhilarating about puzzling together the truth at the hands of an unreliable narrator.
author: Maria Semple

quote: 'Dexter' is a very well-oiled machine; it's just a great show and great to be part of.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: What delights us in visible beauty is the invisible.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: An ounce of hypocrisy is worth a pound of ambition.
author: Michael Korda

quote: A man of letters never objects to a slum. He sharpens his pen there.
author: George A. Moore

quote: Humor is the affectionate communication of insight.
