author: Leo Rosten

quote: Calamity is the test of integrity.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: I only know it takes weeks to recover, as if one had been in a car accident.
author: Patricia Highsmith

quote: Nothing can happen nowhere. The locale of the happening always colours the happening, and often, to a degree, shapes it.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: One doesn't have to pursue unhappiness. It comes to you. You come into the world screaming. You cry when you're born because your lungs expand. You breathe. I think that's really kind of significant. You come into the world crying, and it's a sign that you're alive.
author: Jamaica Kincaid

quote: I'm not a very good writer, but I'm an excellent rewriter.
author: James A. Michener

quote: A tragic irony of life is that we so often achieve success or financial independence after the chief reason for which we sought it has passed away.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: If the reader is rooting for the protagonist, they'll forgive you just about everything else.
author: Andy Weir

quote: Women are the only exploited group in history to have been idealized into powerlessness.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I'm from a small town on the bottom edge of Mississippi, very near New Orleans and the Louisiana border. My family has lived there for generations.
author: Jesmyn Ward

quote: In my writing, as much as I could, I tried to find the good, and praise it.
author: Alex Haley

quote: We cannot be all the writers all the time. We can only be who we are.
author: Zadie Smith

quote: The United States has written the white history of the United States. It now needs to write the black, Latino, Indian, Asian and Caribbean history of the United States.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: I enjoy journalism; anybody does. You see the results immediately; you've got an immediate audience instead of having to wait for your audience as you do if you're writing a book, and you get a bit of money coming in, and you can see more clearly how you're paying the bills. But it's not a good position for the serious novelist to be in.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: One belongs to New York instantly. One belongs to it as much in five minutes as in five years.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: I hope to stay light on my feet, to work in many modes, to seek inspiration always, and avoid the fatal. But, as we all know, it is the price of life to burn out, both metaphorically and literally.
author: T. C. Boyle

quote: Ah, what a dusty answer gets the soul when hot for certainties in this our life!
author: George Meredith

quote: Their very conservatism is secondhand, and they don't know what they are conserving.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Ulysses could have done with a good editor. You know people are always putting Ulysses in the top 10 books ever written but I doubt that any of those people were really moved by it.
author: Roddy Doyle

quote: I first went to Barcelona in 1975 after university, and I stayed for three years. I learnt Catalan because that's what everyone speaks in the mountains. They speak English to foreigners, but what people say to each other is much more important than what they say to you.
author: Colm Toibin

quote: I'm waiting for the day when my children cease to find my domestic propriety reassuring and actually find it annoying.
author: Rachel Cusk

quote: The American middle class's faith in personal comfort as an end in itself is, in essence, a denial of life. And it has been imposed upon American writers and playwrights strongly enough to cut them off from their deeper sources.
author: Nelson Algren

quote: As for 'Great Expectations', it is up there for me with the world's greatest novels, not least as it vindicates plot as no other novel I can think of does, since what there is to find out is not coincidence or happenstance but the profoundest moral truth.
author: Howard Jacobson

quote: Big doesn't necessarily mean better. Sunflowers aren't better than violets.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: The soul, like the body, lives by what it feeds on.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: I don't think I'll ever lose the feeling that I had when I read 'To Kill a Mockingbird' - Harper Lee was going back into her childhood. I grew up in a real small town - Lee's was in the South, mine the Northwest - but small towns have a lot in common. There was such a revelation in knowing that a story could be told like that.
author: Chris Crutcher

quote: I've eaten lion, leopard, crocodile, python. I don't recommend lion. It tastes exactly like when a tomcat comes into your house and sprays. Snake and crocodile are great - a cross between lobster and chicken.
author: Wilbur Smith

quote: Everything changes but change.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: It was only against my mother's will that I attended the preparatory high school in the city. She wanted me to become a seamstress in the village. She knew that if I moved to the city, I would become corrupted. And I was. I started to read books.
author: Herta Muller

quote: I am convinced that during bouts of insomnia, I have sometimes slept without knowing it.
author: Siri Hustvedt

quote: There is only one way in which one can endure man's inhumanity to man and that is to try, in one's own life, to exemplify man's humanity to man.
author: Alan Paton

quote: It is impossible to repent of love. The sin of love does not exist.
author: Muriel Spark

quote: That's the best thing that's ever happened to me, bar none, is having grandchildren and living by them and being part of their lives.
author: Helen Garner

quote: Display advertising and the movies, though they may dull the wits, certainly stimulate the eyes.
author: John Dos Passos

quote: I don't necessarily want to make people stomp and clap. I simply want to engage people.
author: Patrick deWitt

quote: 12-step recovery is very focused on abstinence, and that's bled into the broader understanding of treatment. It would be most useful to have multiple senses of what treatment could look like.
author: Leslie Jamison

quote: There comes a point when you're writing a novel when you're in it so deep that the life of the novel becomes more real to you than life itself. You have to write your way out of it; once you're there, it's too late to abandon.
author: Hanya Yanagihara

quote: For most of my life, I didn't pay attention to birds.
author: Jonathan Franzen

quote: He did not know what love was. And he did not know what good it was. But he knew he carried it around with him, a scabrous spot of rot, of contagion, for which there was no cure.
author: Harry Crews

quote: I vividly remember being 14. That was the age when I started to get happy: I started being a writer and stopped being a loser.
author: Anthony Horowitz

quote: I think I'm less the writer than I'm the written.
author: John Banville

quote: My cousins and I used to play Beatle wives. We all wanted to be married to Paul, but John was O.K. too. None of us wanted Ringo. Or even worse, George.
author: Ann Hood

quote: I believe it is important to speak to your readers in person... to enable people to have a whole picture of me; I have to both write and speak. I view my role as writer and also as oral communicator.
author: Buchi Emecheta

quote: Most don't live inside their heads as a writer does, having conversations with her own ideas.
author: Lynn Coady

quote: You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Culture makes people understand each other better. And if they understand each other better in their soul, it is easier to overcome the economic and political barriers. But first they have to understand that their neighbour is, in the end, just like them, with the same problems, the same questions.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: I love America more than any other country in this world, and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Laws are spider webs through which the big flies pass and the little ones get caught.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Art is not a handicraft, it is the transmission of feeling the artist has experienced.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived.
author: Harper Lee

quote: I would rather be ashes than dust! I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.
author: Jack London

quote: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: O! many a shaft, at random sent, Finds mark the archer little meant! And many a word, at random spoken, May soothe or wound a heart that's broken!
author: Walter Scott

quote: The most merciful thing in the world... is the inability of the human mind to correlate all its contents.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: What we don't understand we can make mean anything.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: Social order at the expense of liberty is hardly a bargain.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

quote: That isn't writing at all, it's typing.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Nonsense and beauty have close connections.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Even when things are at their worst, there's a little voice in your head saying, 'Good story!'
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: I don't believe in God, but I'm afraid of Him.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: I think like a genius, I write like a distinguished author, and I speak like a child.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: I remember reading 'The Grapes of Wrath' in high school in 1983. My family had immigrated to the U.S. three years before, and I had spent the better part of the first two years learning English. John Steinbeck's book was the first book I read in English where I had an 'Aha!' moment, namely in the famed turtle chapter.
author: Khaled Hosseini

quote: I write because I know that one day I will die, and thus I should experience as many deliberate observations, careful thoughts, wild ideas, and deep emotions as I can before that day occurs.
author: Amy Tan

quote: With renunciation life begins.
author: Amelia Barr

quote: I think the kind of landscape that you grew up in, it lives with you. I don't think it's true of people who've grown up in cities so much; you may love a building, but I don't think that you can love it in the way that you love a tree or a river or the colour of the earth; it's a different kind of love.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: Moonlight is sculpture.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: We cannot tear out a single page of our life, but we can throw the whole book in the fire.
author: George Sand

quote: Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen; the more select, the more enjoyable.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: When the soul drifts uncertainly between life and the dream, between the mind's disorder and the return to cool reflection, it is in religious thought that we should seek consolation.
author: Gerard De Nerval

quote: Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Always remember that your calmness under fire is your best defense in any argument or discussion.
author: Robert Greene

quote: Weak minds sink under prosperity as well as adversity; but strong and deep ones have two high tides.
author: David Hare

quote: Work is much more fun than fun.
author: Noel Coward

quote: I am determined to live without illusions. I want to look at reality straight. Without hiding.
author: Hanif Kureishi

quote: Cheating is not the American way. It is small, while we are large. It is cheap, while we are richly endowed. It is destructive, while we are creative. It is doomed to fail, while our gifts and responsibilities call us to achieve. It sabotages trust and weakens the bonds of spirit and humanity, without which we perish.
author: Terrence McNally

quote: The human mind is a dramatic structure in itself and our society is absolutely saturated with drama.
author: Edward Bond

quote: Anyone can be heroic from time to time, but a gentleman is something you have to be all the time.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Sisterhood is important because we are all we have to stand on. We have to stand near and by each other, pray for one another, and share the joys and the difficulties that women face in the world today. If we don't talk about it among ourselves, then we are made silent by the patriarchy, and that serves us no purpose.
author: Ntozake Shange

quote: I have no interest in trying to manipulate people's emotions or opinions.
author: Sarah Kane

quote: You can't legislate into existence an act of forgiveness and a true confession; those are mysteries of the human heart, and they occur between one individual and another individual, not a panel of judges sitting asking questions, trying to test your truth.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: There is good and there is bad in every human heart, and it is the struggle of life to conquer the bad with the good.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: I now realize that I am a gay man before anything else. Other gays may think they're a Jew first, or black, or a banker, but I'm gay.
author: Larry Kramer

quote: A puppet, for example, is just a piece of wood, a couple of rivets, but put them together, and if you know how to do it, and the audience's imagination joins in with this, then a miracle will come out of that machine. That is what we and the audience do in the theatre - we create miracles in that space.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: Theater, at the end of the day, is about ideas. It's about very large ideas. And if the play is beautifully written or smartly written and has incredible characters you follow on the journey, you take home these larger ideas. Whether it's 'Angels in America' or 'Lucky Guy' or 'Normal Heart,' you follow this moment-to-moment journey as an audience.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: To seduce a woman famous for strict morals, religious fervor and the happiness of her marriage: what could possibly be more prestigious?
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: To jealousy, nothing is more frightful than laughter.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: He only half dies who leaves an image of himself in his sons.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: I'm queer - and queer, to me, is not being stuck in a binary and being kind of fluid.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: A Kerry footballer with an inferiority complex is one who thinks he's just as good as everybody else.
author: John B. Keane

quote: Between our birth and death we may touch understanding, As a moth brushes a window with its wing.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: A neurotic is a man who builds a castle in the air. A psychotic is the man who lives in it. A psychiatrist is the man who collects the rent.
author: Jerome Lawrence

quote: I'm not interested in entertainment.
author: Howard Barker

quote: 'A Streetcar Named Desire' is the play I've probably read the most times in my life, and I love the weirdness of all the scene outs but especially the end of the second scene, when Williams brings a tamale vendor on stage to simply say, 'Red hot!'
author: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

quote: History's lesson is to make the most of reform opportunities when they arise because they do not arise often and they do not last long.
author: Christopher Bond

quote: The great thing about a short story is that it doesn't have to trawl through someone's whole life; it can come in glancingly from the side.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: From a young age, I was rubbing elbows with a very different kind of person and social class, and I felt a lot of tension and conflict in my identity because of that.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: I tended to be the nerdy kid - stood at the back, watching other people having fun - I wasn't always necessarily a big part of the fun myself.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: Psychoanalysts and elephants, they never forget.
author: Arthur Laurents

quote: And I admit it: there's a rather dirty thrill when 700 people laugh at a joke you've written.
author: Laura Wade

quote: Life shouldn't be printed on dollar bills.
author: Clifford Odets

quote: Who cares about great marks left behind? We have one life... just one. Our life. We have nothing else.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: To be honest, it's more fun being the underdog.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: Reading was such a formative part of my childhood (along with 'Loony Tunes'), that it is difficult to pin point the most influential book. But, under an interrogation light I would probably have to say 'Jane Eyre' by Charlotte Bronte.
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: Plays have a celebratory nature that no other form has. Theater always meant celebration, a birthday, a reward for good grades. I felt at home in a theater. I loved being part of an audience. All the rules - the audience has to see the play on a certain date at a certain time in a certain place in a certain seat.
author: John Guare

quote: I get excited by landscape.
author: Adrienne Kennedy

quote: He really is terribly heavy going. Like running up hill in roller skates.
author: Alan Ayckbourn

quote: The next thing I wrote was in a writing class at night school. It was about a poor woman who worked at a dime store and who was all alone for Christmas in Laurel, Mississippi.
author: Beth Henley

quote: Each moment is perfect and heaven-sent, in that each moment holds the seeds for growth.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: Laughter can bring a new perspective.
author: Christopher Durang

quote: I grew up in Wakefield, Mass., and there were only a couple of Jewish families in the town.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: Verse comedy is interesting to me because of the challenge of writing in rhymed couplets, which is not a form that's usually amenable to English, yet to me it gives great possibility for comedy.
author: David Ives

quote: I do think the past changes at a slower rate. It sits a little more still for its portrait.
author: Richard Greenberg

quote: If I loved all the world as I do you, I shouldn't write books to it: I should only write letters to it, and that would be only a clumsy stage on the way to entire telepathy.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: The young person isn't certain that love can be real; the middle-aged man is only discovering that it is; and the older person seems so sure of it. I was interested in the way that many of us go through the whole of our lives staying with someone just out of complacency, because leaving isn't easy.
author: Conor McPherson

quote: The only thing to know is how to use your neurosis.
author: Arthur Adamov

quote: Faith is believing in things when common sense tells you not to.
author: George Seaton

quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find, and continue to find, grounds for marriage.
author: Robert Anderson

quote: I've never read 'Pride and Prejudice and Zombies,' although I certainly know what that is. And what I love about that concept is as much as it's a zombie story, it's also 'Pride and Prejudice.'
author: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa

quote: The more you head into the maelstrom, the more vulnerable you are, of course. But it's what you owe to whatever gift you have.
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: If no one ever took risks, Michaelangelo would have painted the Sistine floor.
author: Neil Simon

quote: I believe very deeply in the human spirit, and I have a sense of awe about it. I look around and ask, 'What makes the difference? What is it?' I've known people the world has thrown everything at - to discourage them, to kill them, to break their spirit. And yet something about them retains a dignity. They face life and they don't ask quarters.
author: Horton Foote

quote: When he asked me, with obvious self-satisfaction, what I thought of the scenario, I hardly knew how to answer. I asked if he had seen the play and was hardly surprised when he said no.
author: Elmer Rice

quote: I am one of the 11.5% of New Yorkers who remain traumatized by the events of September 11.
author: Lanford Wilson

quote: All the mistakes I ever made were when I wanted to say 'No' and said 'Yes'.
author: Moss Hart

quote: All marriages are happy. It's the living together afterward that causes all the trouble.
author: Raymond Hull

quote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: No one but a fool is always right.
author: David Hare

quote: It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
author: Noel Coward

quote: We die only once, and for such a long time.
author: Moliere

quote: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: I may climb perhaps to no great heights, but I will climb alone.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: My father was a civil servant, so having a regular job, being respectable is a big deal for me. Respectable in the sense that I support my family. That's what I mean by respectability.
author: Hanif Kureishi

quote: Eagles commonly fly alone. They are crows, daws, and starlings that flock together.
author: John Webster

quote: We are still living in the aftershock of Hiroshima, people are still the scars of history.
author: Edward Bond

quote: I present myself to you in a form suitable to the relationship I wish to achieve with you.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Fertilizer does no good in a heap, but a little spread around works miracles all over.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: It's very difficult to escape your background. You know, I don't think it's necessary to even try to escape it. More and more, I start to think that it's necessary to see exactly what it is that you inherited on both ends of the stick: your timidity, your courage, your self-deceit, and your honesty - and all the rest of it.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: I hate the idea of theatre just being an evening pastime. It should be emotionally and intellectually demanding. I love football. The level of analysis that you listen to on the terraces is astonishing. If people did that in the theatre... but they don't. They expect to sit back and not participate.
author: Sarah Kane

quote: I think the aloe is one of South Africa's most powerful, beautiful and celebratory symbols. It survives out there in the wild when everything else is dried.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: Love always, in one way or another, means pain as well as joy.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: When I heard the Pogues, I connected with the songs immediately, but it was also the first time I didn't reject out of hand the kind of music that my parents had always tried to push on to us when we were growing up.
author: Martin McDonagh

quote: Who knows better than artists how much ugliness there is on the way to beauty, how many ghastly, mortifying missteps, how many days of granitic blockheadedness and dismaying ineptitude there is on the way to accomplishment, how partial all accomplishment is, how incomplete?
author: Tony Kushner

quote: I have always thought of sophistication as rather a feeble substitute for decadence.
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: It would be bad form for me to describe people I don't know and don't understand.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: A theatre, a literature, an artistic expression that does not speak for its own time has no relevance.
author: Dario Fo

quote: You can't always let people do their own thing.
author: Peter Shaffer

quote: Moliere and Arthur Miller affected me at a very young age. In adulthood, I became overwhelmed by Chekhov. Those are my big theatrical influences.
author: Theresa Rebeck

quote: I think the Irish woman was freed from slavery by bingo. They can go out now, dressed up, with their handbags and have a drink and play bingo. And they deserve it.
author: John B. Keane

quote: Harmony is pure love, for love is complete agreement.
author: Lope de Vega

quote: Comedy is an escape, not from truth but from despair; a narrow escape into faith.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Only the more rugged mortals should attempt to keep up with current literature.
author: George Ade

quote: I was 22 and stopped writing plays, and I didn't start again until I was 25. I was writing badly. In college, I attempted to write these more conventional plays, but the theater I loved was downtown experimental theater. I didn't feel like I could do that either. It didn't occur to me to do my own thing.
author: Annie Baker

quote: A good play puts the audience through a certain ordeal.
author: Howard Barker

quote: Change is tough, people don't like it, but it is necessary. Take two aspirins and call me in the morning.
author: Christopher Bond

quote: Adolescents show off. That's another way of wanting to connect with people. It's not an aspect of human behavior that we generally consider to be very admirable, but it is, in some way, a means of connecting with someone else and not being alone.
author: Kenneth Lonergan

quote: When you destroy a population, once femicide happens, we're going to see the end of humanity, because I don't know how you sustain a future without vitalised women.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: Having deadlines helps because people are constantly breathing down my neck, and tapping their toes waiting for pages. So I just have to work nine to five. If I didn't have deadlines then I might be more of a golden hour kind of guy, writing from eight to noon and calling it a day, but that's just not the way I work right now.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: That was all and it was enough for me: fantasies are better left fantasies.
author: Arthur Laurents

quote: 'Killer Joe' provides a lot of red meat for the theater. Pam MacKinnon is the perfect director to shepherd a group of actors who share a certain bloodlust.
author: Tracy Letts

quote: When you write a script, you hope that people will give it life beyond the script.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: Uneasy lies the head that craves the crown.
author: Howard E. Koch

quote: Childhood is a promise that is never kept.
author: Ken Hill

quote: There is no forgiveness in nature.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: A lot of people have asked me whether I am a cynic or take a cynical view of politics and are often surprised when I say that I consider myself an optimist, but an optimist dressed in the robes of a realist.
author: Beau Willimon

quote: I've never tried to define my states of mind when I write.
author: Adrienne Kennedy

quote: A man ninety years old was asked to what he attributed his longevity. I reckon, he said, with a twinkle in his eye, it because most nights I went to bed and slept when I should have sat up and worried.
author: Garson Kanin

quote: Few women care to be laughed at and men not at all, except for large sums of money.
author: Alan Ayckbourn

quote: I did write a couple of original screenplays, but I'd rather write plays.
author: Beth Henley

quote: We've managed to keep a spirit of fun, I guess, of urban satire and finding new and odd interesting angles to the ways of life to put on the stage.
author: Adolph Green

quote: A woman who becomes famous through her work reduces her erotic value. A woman is permitted to chat or babble, but speaking in public with authority is still the greatest transgression.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: You write a play mostly out of yourself. There's a need to get a certain thing down.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: It's true, I don't like the real world.
author: Richard Foreman

quote: The mission of the playwright is to look in his heart and write, to write whatever concerns him at the moment; to write with passion and conviction. Of course the measure of the man will be the measure of the play.
author: Robert Anderson

quote: In many ways I'm similar to Barack Obama, who also has a strange name but was raised by a white American mother. His background is far more complicated than his name would suggest. Furthermore, the fact that I was a child during the hostage crisis has caused me to equate being Iranian with being alienated.
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: I think I can be an intimidating energy in the room. I think I come in with an aura of wanting results because as the playwright, I know how it goes, and there's the thought, 'Why can't they catch up?'
author: Richard Greenberg

quote: I think in a lot of romantic comedies it ends with a kiss, and I feel like in modern day relationships, and maybe just my own experience, it starts with a kiss and then all sort of falls apart and then comes together. You're texting. You're wondering what's going on. There's no definitions, there's no labels.
author: Elizabeth Meriwether

quote: Things always happen in series.
author: Arthur Adamov

quote: It takes time for the absent to assume their true shape in our thoughts. After death they take on a firmer outline and then cease to change.
author: Colley Cibber

quote: Don't live down to expectations. Go out there and do something remarkable.
author: Wendy Wasserstein

quote: To live happily with other people, ask of them only what they can give.
author: Tristan Bernard

quote: Early on, I said to myself that I would like to write a kind of moral and spiritual history of a place. It sounds a little pretentious, I know. But that's really what I set for myself.
author: Horton Foote

quote: Men and women of high professional standing have been reduced to the status of vagrants.
author: Elmer Rice

quote: I am at war... with the principal personage of traditional philosophy, that abstract subject who masquerades as everyone and anyone, but is really a male subject in disguise.
author: Pam Gems

quote: I am not sure why, but I have been obsessed by the Atom Bomb ever since it first happened.
author: Lanford Wilson

quote: Nobody bores any man as much as an unhappy female.
author: Moss Hart

quote: There is a tide in the affairs of men, Which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune. Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound in shallows and in miseries. On such a full sea are we now afloat. And we must take the current when it serves, or lose our ventures.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I can't go on. I'll go on.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Strength was the virtue of paganism; obedience is the virtue of Christianity.
author: David Hare

quote: I like long walks, especially when they are taken by people who annoy me.
author: Noel Coward

quote: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
author: Moliere

quote: All art is political in the sense that it serves someone's politics.
author: August Wilson

quote: You can't spend your life beating yourself up for something that happened yesterday. You die if you don't follow your desire.
author: Hanif Kureishi

quote: A politician is the devil's quilted anvil; He fashions all sins on him, and the blows are never heard.
author: John Webster

quote: There are still a lot of cases in the world where you order something and then you see 'Delivery will be in 8-12 weeks.' This is because of the faxes and forms that still exist.
author: John Patrick

quote: We're never so vulnerable than when we trust someone - but paradoxically, if we cannot trust, neither can we find love or joy.
author: Walter Anderson

quote: A fact is like a sack - it won't stand up if it's empty. To make it stand up, first you have to put in it all the reasons and feelings that caused it in the first place.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: To smile at the jest which plants a thorn in another's breast is to become a principal in the mischief.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: In real life we don't know what's going to happen next. So how can you be that way on a stage? Being alive to the possibility of not knowing exactly how everything is going to happen next - if you can find places to have that happen onstage, it can resonate with an experience of living.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: There's no such thing as failure - just waiting for success.
author: John Osborne

quote: I don't feel I have to defend myself for being English or for being Irish, because, in a way, I don't feel either. And, in another way, of course, I'm both.
author: Martin McDonagh

quote: You have to have hope. It's irresponsible to give false hope, which I think a lot of playwrights are guilty of. But I also think it's irresponsible to simply be a nihilist, which quite a lot of playwrights, especially playwrights younger than me, have become guilty of.
author: Tony Kushner

quote: Don't let others put thoughts into your mind that takes away your self-confidence.
author: Katori Hall

quote: Of all the mediums, theatre is the one where you really need to have something to say - because it's just you, the words, and the space.
author: Abi Morgan

quote: It's my rule never to lose me temper till it would be detrimental to keep it.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: We had extremely democratic town councils in medieval Italy which knew the value of working together, and every now and then, down the centuries, this spirit returns.
author: Dario Fo

quote: Black Comedy is a farce that is played in the dark, as you know, with the lights full on. It's the Chinese convention of reversing light and dark, and exactly where anybody is at any given moment is the play.
author: Peter Shaffer

quote: I was born and raised in the Midwest, where people were taught that decency and integrity and community were all important values. We were democrats with a little 'd.'
author: Theresa Rebeck

quote: 'Yellow Face' marks my summation of multiculturalism.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: What after all, is a halo? It's only one more thing to keep clean.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: I feel like there's an obsession with pace right now in theater, with things being very fast and very witty and very loud, and I think we're all so freaked out about theater keeping audiences interested because everybody's so freaked out about theater becoming irrelevant.
author: Annie Baker

quote: A friend who is near and dear may in time become as useless as a relative.
author: George Ade

quote: I submit all my plays to the National Theatre for rejection. To assure myself I am seeing clearly.
author: Howard Barker

quote: Yes, beef is what was for dinner last night. Tonight it will be my dinner, and it will continue to be.
author: Christopher Bond

quote: People are sad. People are broke. People are worried about money, people are worried that they're not enough and not amounting to anything and they don't feel good about themselves. People have rough times, and everybody's pretending it's not true, and we need to break that veneer.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: We have this myth that if you work hard, you can accomplish anything. It's not a very American thing to say, but I don't think that's true. It's true for a lot of people, but you need other things to succeed. You need luck, you need opportunity, and you need the life skills to recognize what an opportunity is.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: Even at our birth, death does but stand aside a little. And every day he looks towards us and muses somewhat to himself whether that day or the next he will draw nigh.
author: Robert Bolt

quote: Sex - the poor man's polo.
author: Clifford Odets

quote: I think it's disingenuous to believe that being born into a privileged world means you feel like you are having an easy time.
author: Laura Wade

quote: The weaker the country, the stronger the smile.
author: Howard E. Koch

quote: Music is about textures as well as melody.
author: Ken Hill

quote: I definitely prefer to write under my own volition and see what happens.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: I don't believe in updating. If a play works, it draws something from being true to its time.
author: Frank D. Gilroy

quote: People go to see beautiful paintings to see how much they cost. Wow. The practical value is that it shows you what the human spirit can do.
author: John Guare

quote: The humble and meek are thirsting for blood.
author: Joe Orton

quote: He was a god, such as men might be, if men were gods.
author: Maxwell Anderson

quote: You have to transmit to them what it's like being in the theater. And it has to come from somewhere inside you and not by being like what somebody did last year.
author: Adolph Green

quote: I am a sort of justice fanatic, and I always have to give a voice to those who get a raw deal.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: I learned Hebrew from a high school teacher named Mr. Cohen. We would drive down the highway to meet his car, and Jewish boys from these Massachusetts towns would sit in his car and learn the lessons.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: Now, when I started my theater, the modus operandi was having the actors stare right into the audience.
author: Richard Foreman

quote: I'm not like a champion of profanity. I write what I hear, and the characters that I write, that's how they talk. That's how I talk a lot of the time. So I'm not trying to advance a social cause.
author: Stephen Adly Guirgis

quote: There's always been something a little pathetic for me at the work parties I've attended, especially thinking back to the restaurants I worked in. I remember a Christmas party in which we all got free T-shirts with the restaurant on the front and our names on the back.
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: For a writer, published works are like fallen flowers, but the expected new work is like a calyx waiting to blossom.
author: Cao Yu

quote: I shall not die young, for I am already near seventy: I may die old.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: I'm anxious about work, the future, friendships, past relationships... I'm just one of those people that, whatever I'm doing, it's a big worry.
author: Conor McPherson

quote: Thou strange piece of wild nature!
author: Colley Cibber

quote: I wish I were one of those terribly clever people who, when they write their autobiographies, always say, when I was fifteen months old I distinctly remember my Aunt Fanny saying to me, etc.
author: George Seaton

quote: Not just my parents, but teachers, friends, mentors - a host of people are to be thanked for any success I have had, and a whole lot of just plain luck.
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: I don't think I'll ever stop writing. I write almost every day. I'd write plays even if they were never done again. You're at the mercy of whatever talent you have.
author: Horton Foote

quote: Take care of him. And make him feel important. And if you can do that, you'll have a happy and wonderful marriage. Like two out of every ten couples.
author: Neil Simon

quote: I love researching, I love interviewing.
author: Quiara Alegria Hudes

quote: Well we took it apart scene by scene. We examined every sentence, every full stop, every comma. He has a most wonderful eye for detail, Roman, and you know, he's a very good artist.
author: Ronald Harwood

quote: So far as I know, anything worth hearing is not usually uttered at seven o'clock in the morning; and if it is, it will generally be repeated at a more reasonable hour for a larger and more wakeful audience.
author: Moss Hart

quote: I wrote my first play when I was eight.
author: Pam Gems

quote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: We do not see people as they are, but as they appear to us. And these appearances are usually misleading.
author: Robert Greene

quote: Thought is the wind and knowledge the sail.
author: David Hare

quote: Seems like God don't see fit to give the black man nothing but dreams - but He did give us children to make them dreams seem worthwhile.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: The apple cannot be stuck back on the Tree of Knowledge; once we begin to see, we are doomed and challenged to seek the strength to see more, not less.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Do you believe in fairies? Say quick that you believe. If you believe, clap your hands!
author: James M. Barrie

quote: This veridic nose arrives everywhere a quarter of an hour before its master. Ten shoemakers, good round fat ones too, go and sit down to work under it out of the rain.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: Let us celebrate the occasion with wine and sweet words.
author: Plautus

quote: The target market is for people who have not been entrenched in Web culture.
author: John Patrick

quote: I think there is no world without theatre.
author: Edward Bond

quote: In bed my real love has always been the sleep that rescued me by allowing me to dream.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The people sometimes who are closest to us are the ones who bear the brunt of our frustration.
author: Lynn Nottage

quote: You know, most good playwrights write seven good plays and then something happens and after that they're crap.
author: Sarah Kane

quote: I feel like I've never had a home, you know? I feel related to the country, to this country, and yet I don't know exactly where I fit in... There's always this kind of nostalgia for a place, a place where you can reckon with yourself.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: I can't think of a single one of my plays that does not represent a coincidence between an external and an internal event. Something outside of me, outside even my own life, something I read in a newspaper or witness on the street, something I see or hear, fascinates me. I see it for its dramatic potential.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: We all have a fight - some an easy one, and some a big one, and if you have formed the idea that there is a kind of dividing line in the world, and that on the one side is the good, and on the other side the bad, why, all I can say is that you have a wrong notion of things.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: AIDS is a shared truth - it's not selective in its wrath.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: The important thing is not to know where you are going, to be open to accidents. That's what keeps it fun.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: I can only speak for myself, but when I was growing up in Memphis - and having the Martin Luther King holiday and the moment of pause on April 4th - he was just a statue to me. I wanted to make him a little bit more real to me as a human being.
author: Katori Hall

quote: Art must take reality by surprise.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: With comedy I can search for the profound.
author: Dario Fo

quote: He who never leaves his country is full of prejudices.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: I always have something big enough to say as a playwright. It's storytelling.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: With a few flowers in my garden, half a dozen pictures and some books, I live without envy.
author: Lope de Vega

quote: Do you know how helpless you feel if you have a full cup of coffee in your hand and you start to sneeze?
author: Jean Kerr

quote: I think growing up in a small town, the kind of people I met in my small town, they still haunt me. I find myself writing about them over and over again.
author: Annie Baker

quote: One man's poison ivy is another man's spinach.
author: George Ade

quote: I identify as queer. I just don't know what any of these labels mean.
author: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

quote: If you are connected to your own internal being, it is very hard to be screwing and destroying and hurting another human being, because you'll be feeling what they're feeling. If you're separated, it's not a hard thing to do at all.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: 'Arctic Summer,' as you might know, is the title of Forster's one unfinished novel.
author: Damon Galgut

quote: Before I had kids, I thought you should never lie to a kid. But now I've had them, I realize you almost lie to them by definition, because if you're trying to summarize something for your 1-year-old, you put it in very simple terms. You only gradually complicate the explanation as they get older.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: If it's December 1941 in Casablanca, what time is it in New York?
author: Howard E. Koch

quote: The law is not a 'light' for you or any man to see by; the law is not an instrument of any kind. The law is a causeway upon which so long as he keeps to it a citizen may walk safely.
author: Robert Bolt

quote: I wish to God I was organized enough to tell you that, 'Yes, there will be 14 books, and this one will go here, and that one will go there'... but to be honest, I hardly know what I'm going to do when I get up in the morning.
author: Jeff Lindsay

quote: It's an odd mix, the life of a playwright.
author: Laura Wade

quote: There are two kinds of marriages - where the husband quotes the wife and where the wife quotes the husband.
author: Clifford Odets

quote: Memories are like stones, time and distance erode them like acid.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: I grew up in a family where the love of stories is very strong. And there's also a love of performance. I think one reason stories were so important in my family was that we moved around a lot.
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: You must keep people happy backstage because that affects what's onstage. During a run, the playwright feels like the mayor of a small town filled with noble creatures who have to get out there and make it brand new every night. When a production works, it's unlike any other joy in the world.
author: John Guare

quote: We had a certain kind of really big prestige among, I suppose not just intellectual folk, but a sort of nice middle class intelligent folk of a very urban nature.
author: Adolph Green

quote: You can't just go in there and open your mouth until the cast and director feel comfortable with you.
author: Beth Henley

quote: I can really write what I want. I can take time; I can do nothing for a year. That is paradise.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: I'm not always interested in Hollywood norms and boy-next-door kind of characters.
author: Kelly Masterson

quote: I've always been a fighter - it's always been a part of my personality.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: You can create a good impression on yourself by being right, he realizes, but for creating a good impression on others there's nothing to beat being totally and catastrophically wrong.
author: Michael Frayn

quote: I think anything that anyone writes that's any good is going to have a lot of autobiography.
author: Stephen Adly Guirgis

quote: You know, one had as good be out of the world, as out of the fashion.
author: Colley Cibber

quote: One does not devote one's life in art to shock an audience.
author: Richard Foreman

quote: Sometimes I want to clean up my desk and go out and say, respect me, I'm a respectable grown-up, and other times I just want to jump into a paper bag and shake and bake myself to death.
author: Wendy Wasserstein

quote: Stasis is something that has marked my life since I was a boy growing up in Pittsburgh with my mother. It was the natural state that we existed in. For one thing, she suffered from a debilitating depression throughout my childhood, and depression is nothing if not static.
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: One of the reasons I admire David Lindsay-Abaire's work is that he, like the Greeks I've spent so much of my professional life contemplating, is not afraid of taking on the big stuff - huge, human, moral issues - what do we owe to those we love?
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: In many ways, theatre is more rewarding for a writer. I used to think it was like painting a wall - that when the play is finished, it's done - but now I realise it's more like gardening; you plant the thing, then you have to constantly tend it. You're part of a thing that's living.
author: Lee Hall

quote: I think it's a very ephemeral thing, what makes a show a success.
author: Douglas Carter Beane

quote: The best way for me to procrastinate as a writer is research.
author: Quiara Alegria Hudes

quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Where I am, I don't know, I'll never know, in the silence you don't know, you must go on, I can't go on, I'll go on.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Reputation is the cornerstone of power. Through reputation alone you can intimidate and win; once it slips, however, you are vulnerable, and will be attacked on all sides. Make your reputation unassailable.
author: Robert Greene

quote: As human beings, we are all not conducting just one narrative but many narratives all at the same time.
author: David Hare

quote: Extraordinary how potent cheap music is.
author: Noel Coward

quote: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: The insufferable arrogance of human beings to think that Nature was made solely for their benefit, as if it was conceivable that the sun had been set afire merely to ripen men's apples and head their cabbages.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: I'm interested in philosophical psychology, people like Nietzsche, Freud, Alcan, Foucault, Derrida.
author: Hanif Kureishi

quote: You must spend money to make money.
author: Plautus

quote: With me, writing is 60% imagination, 30% people you know and 10% you don't know where it comes from.
author: Terrence McNally

quote: If you engage people on a vital, important level, they will respond.
author: Edward Bond

quote: Nature uses human imagination to lift her work of creation to even higher levels.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Multiculturalism is a white people joke.
author: Ntozake Shange

quote: I'm simply trying to tell the truth about human behaviour as I see it.
author: Sarah Kane

quote: For most of my writing life, I've refused to allow myself to believe that writing was a significant form of action. I always felt very uneasy about the fact that all I did was write in a situation as desperate as apartheid South Africa. Whether I was correct or not is a different issue.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: As I grow older, I think friendship between women is a thing to cherish.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: I forgot that San Francisco is not an angry city like New York. Gays have gotten what they wanted there over the years, unlike New York, where we had to fight for everything.
author: Larry Kramer

quote: I think theatre must be an event, an experience, not compete with cinema. When people are able to download stories on Netflix, you need to give them a good reason to jump into the car and drive two hours. It has to be something you can only see in the theatre, and it has to be worth it.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: Musicals spring forth from minstrelsy, vaudeville, melodramas; it was all these things combined to create the form.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: You know very well that unless you're a scientist, it's much more important for a theory to be shapely, than for it to be true.
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: I always believe things are going to work out.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Noble bold is an accident of fortune; noble actions characterize the great.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: Write about your experiences! When I moved to L.A., I didn't have any friends, and the office janitor was the person who I saw the most. He would always come in at around 10:00 P.M., and I would still be at my desk, so I wrote a play about a first-year TV writer and the friendship that she developed with the janitor. Our stories matter.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: If I do a play, it's my vision, and everybody else is working on the production to support that. If I do an opera, I feel like part of my job is to support that composer, to try and create something that allows the composer to do his or her best work. In movies, it's usually the director.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: I think success has no rules, but you can learn a great deal from failure.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: A play is a passion.
author: Jerome Lawrence

quote: It is not time for mirth and laughter, the cold, gray dawn of the morning after.
author: George Ade

quote: I'm very interested in silence. And, more importantly, in what happens when people aren't talking on stage. I'm interested in letting actors play and do things between the lines. And in slowing everything down.
author: Annie Baker

quote: The revolution is like a vessel filled with the pulsating heartbeat of millions of working people.
author: Ernst Toller

quote: One thing I like about historical fiction is that I'm not constantly focusing on me, or people like me; you're obliged to concentrate on lives that are completely other than your own.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: Mistakes can be good things, because it is an unexpected thing.
author: Ken Hill

quote: If you look at Victorian England, being a soldier was considered a noble profession.
author: Jeff Lindsay

quote: I'm not very good at sticking at things if I can't be successful at them. I gave up on sport a long time ago.
author: Laura Wade

quote: Murderers, in general, are people who are consistent, people who are obsessed with one idea and nothing else.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: I had spent four months in Cedar City, Utah, right after graduation as an intern at the Utah Shakespearean Festival. It's a town that has many people living the polygamous lifestyle.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: If you practice an art, be proud of it and make it proud of you It may break your heart, but it will fill your heart before it breaks it; it will make you a person in your own right.
author: Maxwell Anderson

quote: What I loved about the acting class was that you got to think all day long about a person that wasn't you, and figure out why they were sad and what they wanted, what they dreamed.
author: Beth Henley

quote: 'Fall on Your Knees' is really a story about secrets and family, and the idea that there are some stories or truths that need to be expressed.
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: Young men who have been away, been to war, they are different when they come home.
author: Frank D. Gilroy

quote: I don't consciously start writing a play that involves issues. After it's done, I sit back like everyone else and think about what it means.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: Literature that keeps employing new linguistic and formal modes of expression to draft a panorama of society as a whole while at the same time exposing it, tearing the masks from its face - for me that would be deserving of an award.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: My failure, during the first five or six years of my art training, to get set in the right direction, and the disappointment which it caused me, drove me the more persistently into writing as an alternative.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: I'm not a good storyteller - I much prefer to be with people who are chatty, to have the luxury of listening.
author: Conor McPherson

quote: The laws of this world are for children.
author: Frank Wedekind

quote: The good thing is that life is sometimes a work in progress.
author: Stephen Adly Guirgis

quote: Because of Mozart, it's all over after the age of seven.
author: Wendy Wasserstein

quote: I've redone plays of mine and made changes. A play is a living thing, and I'd never say I wouldn't rewrite years later. Tennessee Williams did that all the time, and it's distressing, because I'd like the play to be out there in its finished form.
author: Horton Foote

quote: Duncan Sheik and I are trucking along on 'American Psycho,' which is sort of the anti-Superman, you know? But it's a lot of fun, too, in a much, much darker way, obviously.
author: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa

quote: From kings to groundlings, Shakespeare made his work profound for everybody. That is how it should be. There is no hierarchy in theatre. It makes everyone part of a collective.
author: Lee Hall

quote: I'm half Puerto Rican and half Jewish and so, in some ways, living in many worlds at once is where I feel most at home.
author: Quiara Alegria Hudes

quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Poets are the sense, philosophers the intelligence of humanity.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: If a nation values anything more than freedom, it will lose its freedom, and the irony of it is that if it is comfort or money that it values more, it will lose that too.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: We have no reliable guarantee that the afterlife will be any less exasperating than this one, have we?
author: Noel Coward

quote: It is not only for what we do that we are held responsible, but also for what we do not do.
author: Moliere

quote: I just write stuff down and pile it up, and when I get enough stuff, I spread it out and look at it and figure out how to use it.
author: August Wilson

quote: The British were indeed very far superior to the Americans in every respect necessary to military operations, except the revivified courage and resolution, the result of sudden success after despair.
author: Mercy Otis Warren

quote: Integrity of life is fame's best friend, which nobly, beyond death, shall crown in the end.
author: John Webster

quote: I'm of the school 'Write what you know.' You can educate yourself, but the best writing usually comes from the heart.
author: Terrence McNally

quote: Auschwitz is a place in which tragedy cannot occur.
author: Edward Bond

quote: There's never any ebb in human misery.
author: Lynn Nottage

quote: If anything is life-changing, being the descendant of a slave is.
author: Ntozake Shange

quote: I think all of my writing life led up to the writing of 'The Train Driver' because it deals with my own inherited blindness and guilt and all of what being a white South African in South Africa during those apartheid years meant.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: The biggest stories are written about the things which draw human beings closer together.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: Dublin people think they are the center of the world and the center of Ireland. And they don't realize that people have to leave Ireland to get work, and they look down on people who do.
author: Martin McDonagh

quote: It's easier to be cynical and edgy and tough rather than overly emotional.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: I've always been a little scared of technology, which is why I explore it.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: Sometimes, unfortunately, hatred is more powerful than progress.
author: Katori Hall

quote: Marriage? It's like asparagus eaten with vinaigrette or hollandaise, a matter of taste but of no importance.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Pretexts are not wanting when one wishes to use them.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: For so long, the narrative - I'm speaking for Latinx - we've been invisible, the ones cleaning and taking care of your kids and doing your lawns.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: My new play 'Chinglish,' which will go to Broadway, is about a white American businessman who goes to a provincial capital in China, hoping to make a deal there. It's bilingual. And it's about trying to communicate across language and cultural barriers.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: A man never feels more important than when he receives a telegram containing more than ten words.
author: George Ade

quote: Yeah, I have the detail-obsessed, controlling personality of a novelist, but I somehow ended up writing plays.
author: Annie Baker

quote: The first theater subscription I ever bought was the August Wilson season at Signature. I remember thinking a whole season to one playwright was a great way for a master to do a victory lap.
author: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

quote: In tragedy every moment is eternity; in comedy, eternity is a moment.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Advances in technology will continue to reach far into every sector of our economy. Future job and economic growth in industry, defense, transportation, agriculture, health care, and life sciences is directly related to scientific advancement.
author: Christopher Bond

quote: South Africa is highly politicised; even small issues become politicised, and it becomes quite bitter.
author: Damon Galgut

quote: The Pulitzer has nothing to do with me; it's more about people's perceptions of me, whatever they may be. I'm not being humble - I honestly do not and cannot think about that. It's a lovely piece of crystal on my bookcase, but that's all it is to me.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: Location is a very important aspect to songwriting.
author: Ken Hill

quote: I don't believe moviegoers don't have patience. Screenwriters are told a scene can't be longer than three minutes, that you have to cut to the chase. Not true!
author: Tracy Letts

quote: I wrote my first play because I wanted to try directing something, and I couldn't afford the rights - it was an adaptation of a book called 'The Wave' by Morton Rhue.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: This free will business is a bit terrifying anyway. It's almost pleasanter to obey, and make the most of it.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: When you're lucky enough to get paid a nice chunk of change to write a movie or a TV show, you have no right to complain, really. I guess it's more of an appeal to the powers that be that the less they interfere, the more likely, actually, they are to get something that works, I think.
author: Beau Willimon

quote: Kiss till the cow comes home.
author: Francis Beaumont

quote: It's unfortunate we've never been just songwriters.
author: Adolph Green

quote: What we're dealt with hopefully is two arms, two eyes, two legs, a head, a heart. The variations, the extensions, the possibilities of the human body, what that can do.
author: John Guare

quote: I've done nothing with my life but write plays.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: The way plays happen, at least with me, it's spontaneous combustion of things you've had in your head.
author: Frank D. Gilroy

quote: In terms of the secrets that imbue and underlie 'Fall on Your Knees', they were as much of a mystery to me as I was creating the story as they are to the readers.
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: I think isolation is one of the greatest problems, an ever-growing obstacle to political solidarity.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: Stage is so important because it teaches me how to convey character with words - how to convey how a character reacts by the way they appear on stage. I can usually tell a playwright from someone who has never written for the stage. Did the character work? Did the dialogue reveal who the character is?
author: Kelly Masterson

quote: Plays are always about intense relationships, whether they're intense love relationships or family relationships or existential relationships.
author: David Ives

quote: While writing my memoir, 'When Skateboards Will Be Free,' I would sometimes have to pore over hours of microfilm at the New York Public Library in order to try to get one obscure detail right. For instance, was the Socialist Workers Party originally called the American Workers Party or the Workers Party of the United States?
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: Life is the most versatile thing under the sun; and in the pursuit of life and character the author who works in a groove works in blinkers.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: I'm very comfortable in the air. And if you're really in love with flight, you're in love to a certain extent with being outside of the body, not grounded. The problem is, if you're not in your body, you can't actually feel anything particularly authentically.
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: I've lived long enough to know things go in and out of fashion, and things not well received now can be totally reversed years later.
author: Horton Foote

quote: I'm a huge Stephen King fan.
author: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa

quote: There is absolutely no point in not being a populist. What I feel emboldened to do is to take something which is a minority interest and make it accessible without dumbing it down. I'm such an enthusiast for peculiar things, things that are perhaps a bit avant-garde, and try and involve everyone.
author: Lee Hall

quote: I am myself of a mixed background.
author: Quiara Alegria Hudes

quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The crown of literature is poetry.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: If, by some miracle, women should not ever utter a single protest against their condition, there would still exist among men those who could not endure in peace until her liberation had been achieved.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: I think it's a mistake to ever look for hope outside of one's self.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Always be a little kinder than necessary.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: I work as an artist, and I think the audience of one, which is the self, and I have to satisfy myself as an artist. So I always say that I write for the same people that Picasso painted for. I think he painted for himself.
author: August Wilson

quote: The extraordinary exertions of the colonies, in cooperation with British measures, against the French, in the late war, were acknowledged by the British parliament to be more than adequate to their ability.
author: Mercy Otis Warren

quote: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
author: Plautus

quote: Young people have got to start their own theaters, really. All good theater is a kind of mom-and-pop operation. Start your own theater.
author: Terrence McNally

quote: I write plays not to make money, but to stop myself from going mad. Because it's my way of making the world rational to me.
author: Edward Bond

quote: Death's a debt; his mandamus binds all alike- no bail, no demurrer.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: Writing for theatre is certainly different to writing an essay or any other kind of fiction or prose: it's physical. You're also telling a story, but sometimes the story isn't exactly what you intend; maybe you uncover something you had no idea you were going to uncover.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: Life is a wonderful thing to talk about, or to read about in history books - but it is terrible when one has to live it.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: By nature, I'm an optimistic person. No one believes it, but I am.
author: Larry Kramer

quote: All my work shares a kind of balance between black comedy and sad and despairing melancholy.
author: Martin McDonagh

quote: I haven't become a satanist, but I am fascinated by the character of the devil.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: The way you give love is the most profoundly human part of you. When people say it's ugly or a perversion or an abomination, they're attacking the center of your being.
author: Tony Kushner

quote: I am always running away from something.
author: Abi Morgan

quote: You should celebrate the end of a love affair as they celebrate death in New Orleans, with songs, laughter, dancing and a lot of wine.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: There is none to tell the rich to go on striving, for a rich man makes the law that hallows and hollows his own life.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: I'm an idiot who won the Literature Nobel Prize.
author: Dario Fo

quote: A wise traveler never depreciates their own country.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: You can't visit Guanajuato without going to the mummy museum.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: I write a lot because, if I don't, I start to panic, and I calm down when I write.
author: Theresa Rebeck

quote: One of the most difficult things to contend with in a hospital is that assumption on the part of the staff that because you have lost your gall bladder you have also lost your mind.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: I was raised by a single psychologist mother and we spent every evening sitting at the kitchen table and dissecting our emotions and speculating about the inner life of everyone we knew.
author: Annie Baker

quote: All experience helps when you write.
author: Jerome Lawrence

quote: Women consume, and they must be directed what to consume, or they may identify you as lunch.
author: John Patrick Shanley

quote: I think when people begin to tell their stories, everything changes, because not only are you legitimised in the telling of your story and are you found, literally, like you matter, you exist in the telling of your story, but when you hear your story be told, you suddenly exist in community and with others.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: Any radical change or trauma always makes for interesting subject matter, but then all stories deal, to some extent, with the disjuncture between past and present.
author: Damon Galgut

quote: And suddenly, like light in darkness, the real truth broke in upon me; the simple fact of Man, which I had forgotten, which had lain deep buried and out of sight; the idea of community, of unity.
author: Ernst Toller

quote: I've always been religiously inclined, but it doesn't come up in most of my books.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: Good writing does not come from verbiage but from words.
author: Jeff Lindsay

quote: The stressful time is the blank page at the beginning. When you're starting to see things being made flesh, and you're able to respond to that flesh, that's really exciting.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: Is self-interest a bad thing? We want our leaders to be pure and good, but at the same time we want them to be effective, and to be effective you often have to be ruthless and not bound by ideology or the same morals that we pretend to hold ourselves to.
author: Beau Willimon

quote: But what is past my help is past my care.
author: Francis Beaumont

quote: I had met a young lady who wanted to be in the theater. It was Judy Holliday. She had somehow fallen down the steps of the Village Vanguard, which still exists today.
author: Adolph Green

quote: I started my career as an actor, then morphed into a playwright who accidentally became a novelist with my first book 'Fall On Your Knees.'
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: I think of myself as a storyteller.
author: Frank D. Gilroy

quote: Someone yelled at me once, 'You never write about yourself.' People used to get so mad at me for that. But my definition of myself is completely up for grabs. I'm everywhere, just like we all are.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: I'm not well-versed in the science fiction world. I'm hoping that I'll get more opportunities in it because you get to create a new world.
author: Kelly Masterson

quote: Necessarily, I'm always involved in casting, as any playwright is, because the whole process of putting on a play is a collaborative, organic effort on the part of a bunch of people trying to think alike.
author: David Ives

quote: I guess I'm attracted and repelled by isolation. It scares me. And it's why I tend to write about older characters, too, because for them the stakes are somewhat higher.
author: Conor McPherson

quote: I've lived with women, loved women, lost women. They've loved me, lost me, whatever.
author: Stephen Adly Guirgis

quote: What does being a woman today mean? Is there a right way of doing it? Is there a wrong way of doing it? Different kinds of women, female friendships: It's all pretty funny, and worth making fun of.
author: Elizabeth Meriwether

quote: Dietz and Schwartz have sort of fallen by the wayside a little bit, and they are up there with Rodgers and Hart and Irving Berlin and Cole Porter. They are the finest of the revue composers - their stuff is so good and so strong.
author: Douglas Carter Beane

quote: You must realize that honorary degrees are given generally to people whose SAT scores were too low to get them into schools the regular way. As a matter of fact, it was my SAT scores that led me into my present vocation in life, comedy.
author: Neil Simon

quote: I don't think theatre has changed; it's society that has changed.
author: Lee Hall

quote: It's a terrific... you can't put it down. So I phoned him back and I said I'd love to do it. I went over to Paris for a meeting, and we just talked very generally about the approach.
author: Ronald Harwood

quote: Children see things very well sometimes - and idealists even better.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: The structure of a play is always the story of how the birds came home to roost.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Grammar, which knows how to control even kings.
author: Moliere

quote: Keep your hands moving. Writing is rewriting.
author: August Wilson

quote: But truth is most likely to be exhibited by the general sense of contemporaries, when the feelings of the heart can be expressed without suffering itself to be disguised by the prejudices of man.
author: Mercy Otis Warren

quote: Man is most happy, when his own actions are arguments and examples of his virtue.
author: John Webster

quote: Religion enabled society to organise itself to debate goodness, just as Greek drama had once done.
author: Edward Bond

quote: I am interested in people living in the margins of society, and I do have a mission to tell the stories of women of colour in particular. I feel we've been present throughout history, but our voices have been neglected.
author: Lynn Nottage

quote: A fluent tongue is the only thing a mother don't like her daughter to resemble her in.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: My father had a real short fuse. He had a tough life - had to support his mother and brother at a very young age when his dad's farm collapsed. You could see his suffering, his terrible suffering, living a life that was disappointing and looking for another one. My father was full of terrifying anger.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: Night-time is when I brainstorm; last thing, when the family's asleep and I'm alone, I think about the next day's writing and plan a strategy for my assault on the blank page.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: Women are used to worrying over trifles.
author: Susan Glaspell

quote: Everybody wants to be remembered for the best of who they are.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: I don't think there is any kind of magic about what I do. All of the connections are there, somewhere in the subconscious or in the collective unconscious. If I let the elements speak to each other, then these coincidences will happen. And they do happen. They happen all the time.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: I'm very opinionated, very intelligent and not afraid to show that.
author: Katori Hall

quote: Jazz music is an intensified feeling of nonchalance.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: Joyce for all his devotion to his art, terrible in its austerity, was a lad born with a song on one side of him, a dance on the other; two gay guardian angels every human ought to have.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: He who talks much cannot talk well.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: The big, radical thing that I'm trying to do is to portray Latinas as complex human beings.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: I knew I was Chinese, but growing up, it never occurred to me that that had any particular implication or that it should differentiate me in any way. I thought it was a minor detail, like having red hair.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: Nothing is improbable until it moves into past tense.
author: George Ade

quote: I don't hate people who colour-blind cast, but I hate people who colour-blind cast and pretend that they're not, who pretend that these bodies on stage don't actually carry specific meaning.
author: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

quote: The best thing we can do is to make wherever we're lost in look as much like home as we can.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: It is time that we take control and find a way to curtail the explosive costs of health care. Small businesses deserve a chance to channel these funds toward other needs, such as expanding and creating more jobs for the economy.
author: Christopher Bond

quote: I like to believe that if you pay close attention to the sentences as they unfold, they will draw you in rather than pushing you away.
author: Damon Galgut

quote: I saw the dead without really seeing them.
author: Ernst Toller

quote: With studio work, I'm always the bottom man on the totem pole.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: Music is an art form. It is a way to wordlessly communicate.
author: Ken Hill

quote: In theater, the playwright is the boss, period. The decisions will go through him or her. In movies, the writer is pretty far down on the list.
author: Tracy Letts

quote: I am trying to write a play that is big and I feel represents me - that's my big ambition.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: In writing 'The Humans,' I obsessed over the financial district and the architecture.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: You can tell a lot about a person by the people who work for them.
author: Ann-Marie MacDonald

quote: And what would be great numbers in a Broadway show are now on stage of the New York City Ballet.
author: John Guare

quote: I just loved being divorced from my own wretchedness.
author: Beth Henley

quote: I love my lecture tours. I get up onstage. I have my stack of books and a glass of water and a microphone. No podium, no distance between me and the audience, and I just talk to people and get all excited and tell a lot of jokes, and sing some songs, and read from my work and remind people how powerful they are and how beautiful they are.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: I have a visceral response to a memory of working-class life.
author: Israel Horovitz

quote: I was raised a Catholic, so I can even feel a little, you know, embarrassed or guilty if I'm really offending people's sensibilities. To a degree.
author: Stephen Adly Guirgis

quote: But it has also enabled me to find my feet as a lecturer and a reader of my own plays to audiences who like to hear them; and that experience of immediate appreciation gives greater pleasure and more stimulus towards further activity than even the most laudatory of reviews.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: If I wasn't plagued by needing to write things, that would perhaps be a blessing.
author: Conor McPherson

quote: I started out wanting to be an actor and I like to give actors as much as possible. I love writing stuff where they can really lose control.
author: Elizabeth Meriwether

quote: One of my favorite graphic novels of all time is Grant Morrison's 'Earth-2.'
author: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa
