quote: I only tend to think of the week ahead, to keep my eye on the ball and question whether a full stop is in the right place. It's easy to get distracted by the wrong things. If you start thinking of grand gestures, it's going to be a lot of hot air. You have to be logical. The theatre is a very logical place.
author: Lee Hall

quote: I so earnestly believe that prayer can be helpful and guide you and protect you and inspire you. I mean, I'm in awe.
author: Horton Foote

quote: Ethics and power are separate.
author: Robert Greene

quote: When they speak, dead frogs fall out of their mouths.
author: David Hare

quote: Men continue to misinterpret the second-rate status of women as implying a privileged status for themselves; heterosexuals think the same way about homosexuals; gentiles about Jews; whites about blacks; haves about have-nots.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

quote: If I see an ending, I can work backward.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: There are few more impressive sights in the world than a Scotsman on the make.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: A large nose is the mark of a witty, courteous, affable, generous and liberal man.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: I've never had any desire to be good. I don't like goodness particularly.
author: Hanif Kureishi

quote: I've had wonderful collaborators. They're very different, just as actors are. Working on a show with Nathan Lane is different from working on a show with Chita Rivera. It keeps you on your toes because it's different every time.
author: Terrence McNally

quote: The history of mankind is the history of ideas.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: You write with ease to show your breeding, but easy writing's curst hard reading.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: All good writing comes out of aloneness.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: I'm always in disguise in one form or another in my plays.
author: Athol Fugard

quote: The whole point of a sacrifice is that you give up something you never really wanted in the first place. People are doing it around you all the time. They give up their careers, say - or their beliefs - or sex.
author: John Osborne

quote: There's no question that the gay movement would not be as far along as it is without AIDS. But how can there be any other issue in the face of death, possible extinction?
author: Larry Kramer

quote: Theater originated with technology. People forget that.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: The rules I sort of live by for my theater career, which I hope to live for my film career, is that if there's something that intrigues me or fascinates me, or I don't know how to do it, then I should do it.
author: George C. Wolfe

quote: I find I have to give myself a day when I just shut myself off and do nothing but read.
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: Playwrights are the most gregarious writers - to get our work done, we need actors, directors, set designers.
author: Katori Hall

quote: Wealth often takes away chances from men as well as poverty. There is none to tell the rich to go on striving, for a rich man makes the law that hallows and hollows his own life.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: I am the jongleur. I leap and pirouette, and make you laugh. I make fun of those in power, and I show you how puffed up and conceited are the big shots who go around making wars in which we are the ones who get slaughtered. I reveal them for what they are. I pull out the plug, and... pssss... they deflate.
author: Dario Fo

quote: I always was missing that female brown queer perspective, and I think in 'Vida' we have that. A lot of things I wanted to touch on and deal with, I get to do here.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: With theatre, we all agree to suspend our disbelief about so many things, but not about race. It's totally OK to have one actor playing five roles - people are willing to believe that. But they won't believe it if there's a black or an Asian kid who has white parents. What does that say about us?
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: I'm terrible at speaking extemporaneously about my work - I get completely tongue-tied and consumed with fear.
author: Annie Baker

quote: How do we refresh our language? Why do we still use, like, a 150-year-old classification system to talk about people? It's so weird! We still call people black and white?
author: Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

quote: The lines marking a penalty area are a disgrace to the playing fields of a public school.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Playwriting is the last great bastion of the individual writer. It's exciting precisely because it's where the money isn't. Money goes to safety, to consensus. It's not individualism.
author: John Patrick Shanley

quote: One of the most radical things women can do is to love their body.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: I was nearly a teen-ager before I stopped assuming that everyone I met was Jewish.
author: Kenneth Lonergan

quote: I've been pretty well treated by the critics, but the critics who didn't like my comedies hated them with an unbridled passion, and then I would see these same people writing very respectfully about ordinary naturalistic plays.
author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quote: I don't agree with capital punishment as it is now, because too often mistakes are made. But I think that if you eliminate the mistakes, then there are times when it is justified.
author: Jeff Lindsay

quote: Apparently the show happens even if I'm not there. Who knew?
author: Laura Wade

quote: 'Mad' is a term we use to describe a man who is obsessed with one idea and nothing else.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: The older I get, the more appreciative I am of where I came from.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: Interest makes some people blind, and others quick-sighted.
author: Francis Beaumont

quote: It's a lucky life to be a playwright.
author: John Guare

quote: I don't care what anybody says. Stick to the spirit of the play and you're doing it right. It's about embracing the spirit of the text instead of noodling some idea about things.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: The work I did on 'Killing Kennedy' was very meticulous and, in some ways, actually tedious. It was hard work because there is so much known about John F. Kennedy and Lee Harvey Oswald. To try to distill that into a clear narrative that's interesting and tells two great stories was a real challenge.
author: Kelly Masterson

quote: I believe absolutely in love being the central motive force of the universe.
author: Laurence Housman

quote: If I wasn't in the theater, I would be a hermit.
author: Richard Foreman

quote: It's very difficult for me to look at politics with clear eyes. I'll read a story in the paper and the first thing that pops into my head is, what would my dad say about that? Then I try to break out of that and think, 'What would Said say about that,' and then it gets complicated.
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: I have enormous respect for the human being because they're asked to take on a lot. And I don't think there's any easy solution. But I think the journey is what you have to finally be satisfied with, but not be afraid of the lessons one has to learn... it ends up as grace. And you grow; you find a way to continue.
author: Horton Foote

quote: Musicals and horror movies are my two favorite genres because they're about extremes.
author: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa

quote: My generation of playwrights have grown up writing for studio theatres, and so the task of writing for more than ten or so actors is a huge challenge. Logistically, it's like doing an enormous Sudoku. Making sure everyone is in the right place at the right time in the right order instantly sends me into a cold sweat.
author: Lee Hall

quote: I'm an actor and a playwright, and I don't earn much.
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: Democracy is a device that ensures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: An elusive, enigmatic aura will make people want to know more, drawing them into your circle. Create such a power by hinting at something contradictory within you.
author: Robert Greene

quote: It is my art. I am better at it than I ever was. And I will do it as long as I can. When you reach a certain age you can slough off what is unnecessary and concentrate on what is. And why not?
author: Arthur Miller

quote: I'm youth, I'm joy, I'm a little bird that has broken out of the egg.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: I do - very specifically, I remember Bessie Smith; I used to collect 78 records that I would buy from the St Vincent de Paul store at five cents apiece, and I did this indiscriminately. I would just take whatever was there. And I listened to Patti Page and Walter Huston, 'September Song.'
author: August Wilson

quote: The defeat of the Americans in Canada and the advantages gained by the British arms in the Jerseys, and indeed for some months in every other quarter, gave to the royal cause an air of triumph.
author: Mercy Otis Warren

quote: Courage in danger is half the battle.
author: Plautus

quote: Whatever is a reality today, whatever you touch and believe in and that seems real for you today, is going to be - like the reality of yesterday - an illusion tomorrow.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The surest way to fail is not to determine to succeed.
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

quote: Grief is bizarre territory because there's no predicting how long it'll take to get over certain things. You just don't know how long it's going to resound in your life.
author: Sam Shepard

quote: One cannot weep for the entire world, it is beyond human strength. One must choose.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: It is easy to answer the ultimate questions - it saves you bothering with the immediate ones.
author: John Osborne

quote: Gay life in 1970 was very bleak, compartmentalized. You didn't take it to work. You had to really lead a double life. There were bars, but you sort of snuck in and snuck out. Activism and gay pride simply didn't exist. I don't even think the word 'gay' was in existence.
author: Larry Kramer

quote: We have a tendency in Quebec - and I include myself in this - to describe ourselves using the past. We're always nostalgic.
author: Robert Lepage

quote: Unlike films, which can be easily disseminated worldwide via DVDs and the Internet, plays struggle to find an international audience.
author: Katori Hall

quote: My greatest love is my children, and they have inspired me to fight and stand up for the right things.
author: Abi Morgan

quote: No man is so old as to believe he cannot live one more year.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: Tragedy, for me, is not a conflict between right and wrong, but between two different kinds of right.
author: Peter Shaffer

quote: When you get a bunch of Latinxs together, we get to handle our stories. A cultural shorthand happens.
author: Tanya Saracho

quote: I felt pretty good growing up. I didn't feel a lot of prejudice or racism. But I do remember, if there was going to be a movie or a television show with Asian characters, I would go out of my way to avoid them, because they portrayed all Asians as either ridiculously good or ridiculously bad; you know, the whole Charlie Chan-Fu Manchu thing.
author: David Henry Hwang

quote: The dark is light enough.
author: Christopher Fry

quote: Do unto yourself as your neighbors do unto themselves and look pleasant.
author: George Ade

quote: I'm really trying to stop setting my plays in this one fictional town in Vermont.
author: Annie Baker

quote: My dream is that people will find a way back home, into their bodies, to connect with the earth, to connect with each other, to connect with the poor, to connect with the broken, to connect with the needy, to connect with people calling out all around us, to connect with the beauty, poetry, the wildness.
author: Eve Ensler

quote: While apartheid was in operation, the set-up was a gift for writers if you were looking for a big theme.
author: Damon Galgut

quote: Some writers can produce marvelous plots without planning it out, but I can't. In particular I need to know the structure of a novel: what's going to happen in each chapter and each scene.
author: Emma Donoghue

quote: I think London is a bit sad, and I find it a bit overwhelming. There's a lot of quite unhappy people, and it's very goal-driven.
author: Jack Thorne

quote: You don't work as hard to watch a movie. You work harder to watch a play, so what the audience puts into it is interesting.
author: Tracy Letts

quote: Writing a tribe is fun. They have their own language, their own slang; they repeat it, and it becomes part of the texture of the play. For a writer, that's thrilling. That's when my pen flies.
author: Laura Wade

quote: If you really think that ambition, power, lust, desire are not as applicable in the media as in politics or on Wall Street or anywhere else, you're deluding yourself.
author: Beau Willimon

quote: I was not exposed to a lot of culture. The shows we saw in high school, like 'Phantom of the Opera' and 'Miss Saigon,' were thrilling. But my love affair with theater started with seeing a production of 'Little Shop of Horrors' that my sister was in.
author: Stephen Karam

quote: The New York City Ballet is always about the realm of possibilities, the realm of what the human body can do, what the human spirit can do. And it's about listening, it's about listening to remarkable music and how we respond to that.
author: John Guare

quote: I describe the relationship between man and woman as a Hegelian relationship between master and slave. As long as men are able to increase their sexual value through work, fame or wealth, while women are only powerful through their body, beauty and youth, nothing will change.
author: Elfriede Jelinek

quote: I was just restless with being in school; so I went out to Los Angeles.
author: Beth Henley

quote: Everything I write doesn't appear to be biography until later. I often say that I've never written about anything I've experienced. Of course, that's not true. But it doesn't appear familiar to me at all. And maybe that's because I have to be in a kind of coma in order to write. If it appeared familiar, I wouldn't.
author: Suzan-Lori Parks

quote: I came to success very late in life.
author: Kelly Masterson

quote: My mother wanted me to be a writer. But she was a child of the Depression and never understood that she wasn't poor. So, you know, the idea of not having a job, it would creep through. But she tried very hard to be subtle about it.
author: Richard Greenberg

quote: I have to expend an awful lot of energy actively undoing the impact of my name. Understandably, people assume that I have at least some connection to Iran. The truth is that I don't. I have very little knowledge about the culture, the language, the history. I've never been to Iran. I've never even been inside a mosque.
author: Said Sayrafiezadeh

quote: If you're raised Methodist, Catholicism is a bit of a workout. It's sort of like you're up, you're down, you're up, you're down. It's a continual hokey-pokey.
author: Douglas Carter Beane

quote: Everyone thinks they can write a play; you just write down what happened to you. But the art of it is drawing from all the moments of your life.
author: Neil Simon

quote: In 'Angels in America,' I got to fulfill a lifelong dream. I was in the air eight nights a week for two years, and I just loved it.
author: Ellen McLaughlin

quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: In the landscape of extinction, precision is next to godliness.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Excess on occasion is exhilarating. It prevents moderation from acquiring the deadening effect of a habit.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

quote: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Science has not yet taught us if madness is or is not the sublimity of the intelligence.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: That though the radiance which was once so bright be now forever taken from my sight. Though nothing can bring back the hour of splendor in the grass, glory in the flower. We will grieve not, rather find strength in what remains behind.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
author: John Keats

quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night but rage, rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Even if the hopes you started out with are dashed, hope has to be maintained.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: I would prefer even to fail with honor than win by cheating.
author: Sophocles

quote: Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.
author: John Donne

quote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
author: Saadi

quote: Time flies never to be recalled.
author: Virgil

quote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Time is the substance from which I am made. Time is a river which carries me along, but I am the river; it is a tiger that devours me, but I am the tiger; it is a fire that consumes me, but I am the fire.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Friendship is a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Man's inhumanity to man makes countless thousands mourn!
author: Robert Burns

quote: We first make our habits, and then our habits make us.
author: John Dryden

quote: Let us be grateful to the mirror for revealing to us our appearance only.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Cherish your human connections: your relationships with friends and family.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Unity is strength... when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: Really, at the end of the day, the only thing you can control is yourself; the only person you can truly educate is yourself. You have to redefine what beauty is to you so you can't be affected by what people are saying.
author: Rupi Kaur

quote: Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Until we are all free, we are none of us free.
author: Emma Lazarus

quote: If one had but a single glance to give the world, one should gaze on Istanbul.
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quote: We are each other's magnitude and bond.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: You can close your eyes to reality but not to memories.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
author: Novalis

quote: Poetry begins where language starts: in the shadows and accidents of one person's life.
author: Eavan Boland

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Basho

quote: The sound of water is worth more than all the poets' words.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: The connections between and among women are the most feared, the most problematic, and the most potentially transforming force on the planet.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Things are not always as they seem; the first appearance deceives many.
author: Phaedrus

quote: Life has a practice of living you, if you don't live it.
author: Philip Larkin

quote: Loneliness is the poverty of self; solitude is the richness of self.
author: May Sarton

quote: Individually, we are one drop. Together, we are an ocean.
author: Ryunosuke Satoro

quote: Every gift which is given, even though it be small, is in reality great, if it is given with affection.
author: Pindar

quote: If this be not love, it is madness, and then it is pardonable.
author: William Congreve

quote: The house of delusions is cheap to build but drafty to live in.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: And how can man die better than facing fearful odds, for the ashes of his fathers, and the temples of his Gods?
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: The English language is nobody's special property. It is the property of the imagination: it is the property of the language itself.
author: Derek Walcott

quote: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Getting better from depression demands a lifelong commitment. I've made that commitment for my life's sake and for the sake of those who love me.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

quote: Deep in their roots, all flowers keep the light.
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: A man who is not afraid of the sea will soon be drowned, he said, for he will be going out on a day he shouldn't. But we do be afraid of the sea, and we do only be drownded now and again.
author: John Millington Synge

quote: Maturity is the ability to think, speak and act your feelings within the bounds of dignity. The measure of your maturity is how spiritual you become during the midst of your frustrations.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: Literature allows us to be open, to listen, and to be curious.
author: Tracy K. Smith

quote: Nothing is more memorable than a smell. One scent can be unexpected, momentary and fleeting, yet conjure up a childhood summer beside a lake in the mountains.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: You are young, gifted, and Black. We must begin to tell our young, There's a world waiting for you, Yours is the quest that's just begun.
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: I don't read reviews and I don't know what to do with opinions, so I just lose them. They take up space, they become a process of manufacturing a persona, which I want to avoid.
author: Anne Carson

quote: In me the tiger sniffs the rose.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

quote: When I began to listen to poetry, it's when I began to listen to the stones, and I began to listen to what the clouds had to say, and I began to listen to others. And I think, most importantly for all of us, then you begin to learn to listen to the soul, the soul of yourself in here, which is also the soul of everyone else.
author: Joy Harjo

quote: All is mine but nothing owned, nothing owned for memory, and mine only while I look.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: No rival will steal away my sure love; that glory will be my gray hair.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: The past is always - one moment it's what happened three minutes ago, and one minute it's what happened 30 years ago. And they flow into each other in ways that we can't predict and that we keep discovering in dreams, which keep bringing up feelings and moments, some of which we never actually saw.
author: W. S. Merwin

quote: Every soul is a melody which needs renewing.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: Real friendship, like real poetry, is extremely rare - and precious as a pearl.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: Waiting for the spark from heaven to fall.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: He conquers who endures.
author: Persius

quote: When I see a bird that walks like a duck and swims like a duck and quacks like a duck, I call that bird a duck.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: If you aren't having no fun, die, because you're running a worthless program, far as I'm concerned.
author: Gil Scott-Heron

quote: Our goodness comes solely from thinking on goodness; our wickedness from thinking on wickedness. We too are the victims of our own contemplation.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: Such a gift might be easily taken back again.
author: Veronica Franco

quote: A lasting marriage, they say, is one where the two reach for different sections of the Sunday paper. Me, I go right for the obituaries, just like those very elderly characters in Muriel Spark's spooky novel, 'Memento Mori.'
author: Billy Collins

quote: Part of the delight of my garden is that you just get lost in it before you've even started to do anything.
author: Ross Gay

quote: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning; for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: Slow and steady wins the race.
author: Robert Lloyd

quote: I have a rendezvous with life.
author: Countee Cullen

quote: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

quote: The patriot's blood is the seed of Freedom's tree.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: When I'm actually writing by hand, I get more of a sense of the rhythm of sentences, of syntax. The switch to the computer is when I actually start thinking about lines. That's the workhorse part. At that point, I'm being more mathematical about putting the poem on the page and less intuitive about the rhythm of the syntax.
author: Natasha Trethewey

quote: Conceal a flaw, and the world will imagine the worst.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: However big the fool, there is always a bigger fool to admire him.
author: Nicolas Boileau-Despreaux

quote: Against her ankles as she trod The lucky buttercups did nod.
author: Jean Ingelow

quote: Young men think old men are fools; but old men know young men are fools.
author: George Chapman

quote: What would the world be, once bereft Of wet and wildness? Let them be left, O let them be left, wildness and wet, Long live the weeds and the wildness yet.
author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

quote: An unsophisticated forecaster uses statistics as a drunken man uses lamp-posts - for support rather than for illumination.
author: Andrew Lang

quote: My problem isn't death but old age. I fret about my lack of balance, my buckling knee, my difficulty standing up and sitting down.
author: Donald Hall

quote: Show me your garden and I shall tell you what you are.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Be curious, not judgmental.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Today is the first of August. It is hot, steamy and wet. It is raining. I am tempted to write a poem. But I remember what it said on one rejection slip: 'After a heavy rainfall, poems titled 'Rain' pour in from across the nation.'
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Find ecstasy in life; the mere sense of living is joy enough.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: A loaf of bread, a jug of wine, and thou.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Life is divided into three terms - that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present, to live better in the future.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Comfortable shoes and the freedom to leave are the two most important things in life.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: When one burns one's bridges, what a very nice fire it makes.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: I have begun to think of life as a series of ripples widening out from an original center.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: The richness of life lies in memories we have forgotten.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: I fear God and next to God I mostly fear them that fear him not.
author: Saadi

quote: A picture is a poem without words.
author: Horace

quote: The wing of the Falcon brings to the king, the wing if the crow brings him to the cemetery.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: Nothing is built on stone; all is built on sand, but we must build as if the sand were stone.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: To cherish what remains of the Earth and to foster its renewal is our only legitimate hope of survival.
author: Wendell Berry

quote: Nostalgia is not a place to live.
author: Gulzar

quote: History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Natural life, lived naturally as it is lived in the countryside, has none of that progress which is the base of happiness. Men and women in rural communities can be compared to a spring that rises out of a rock and spreads in irregular ever-widening circles. But the general principle is static.
author: Patrick Kavanagh

quote: War: a massacre of people who don't know each other for the profit of people who know each other but don't massacre each other.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Whoever controls the media, the images, controls the culture.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: The moon is a friend for the lonesome to talk to.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Living well is the best revenge.
author: George Herbert

quote: My heart is like a singing bird.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish; Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: I feel social media can be very distracting, unhealthy, and harmful to one's self-confidence. I don't even log on to it on my phone except when I post something on Instagram.
author: Rupi Kaur

quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Censure acquits the raven, but pursues the dove.
author: Juvenal

quote: When you can imagine you begin to create and when you begin to create you realize that you can create a world that you prefer to live in, rather than a world that you're suffering in.
author: Ben Okri

quote: Sometimes, only one person is missing, and the whole world seems depopulated.
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

quote: Exhaust the little moment. Soon it dies. And be it gash or gold it will not come Again in this identical guise.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: A hero is one who knows how to hang on one minute longer.
author: Novalis

quote: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: Every day is a journey, and the journey itself is home.
author: Matsuo Basho

quote: Bad company corrupts good character.
author: Menander

quote: A man is either free or he is not. There cannot be any apprenticeship for freedom.
author: Amiri Baraka

quote: And the blood of brave men was shed like unto the shedding of rain from a black cloud.
author: Ferdowsi

quote: Every journey into the past is complicated by delusions, false memories, false namings of real events.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: A man who always speaks the truth wholeheartedly is greater than those who do penance and deeds of charity.
author: Thiruvalluvar

quote: If I told you about a land of love, friend, would you follow me and come?
author: Yunus Emre

quote: For poetry there exists neither large countries nor small. Its domain is in the heart of all men.
author: Giorgos Seferis

quote: It is the unknown that excites the ardor of scholars, who, in the known alone, would shrivel up with boredom.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: As civilization advances, poetry almost necessarily declines.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Modesty is not possible in performance in the Caribbean - and that's wonderful.
author: Derek Walcott

quote: Equality and self-determination should never be divided in the name of religious or ideological fervor.
author: Rita Dove

quote: The Siren waits thee, singing song for song.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Lord, confound this surly sister, blight her brow with blotch and blister, cramp her larynx, lung and liver, in her guts a galling give her.
author: John Millington Synge

quote: I think if there's a great depression there might be some hope.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: You are as young as your self-confidence, as old as your fears; as young as your hope, as old as your despair.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Hurricane season brings a humbling reminder that, despite our technologies, most of nature remains unpredictable.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: He that is taught only by himself has a fool for a master.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: I love the sound of the saxophone. It became my singing voice, and it sounds so human. The saxophone could carry the words past the border of words. It can carry it a little bit farther.
author: Joy Harjo

quote: As I have not worried to be born, I do not worry to die.
author: Federico Garcia Lorca

quote: Keep up the good work, if only for a while, if only for the twinkling of a tiny galaxy.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: Not only the bull attacks his enemies with curved horn, but also the sheep, when harmed fights back.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: If fortune favors you do not be elated; if she frowns do not despond.
author: Ausonius

quote: Emigration is no longer a solution; it's a defeat. People are risking death, drowning every day, but they're knocking on doors that are not open.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: You don't make a poem with ideas, but with words.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: On the day when man told the story of his life to man, history was born.
author: Alfred de Vigny

quote: Flowers are without hope. Because hope is tomorrow and flowers have no tomorrow.
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: Satan trembles when he sees the weakest saint upon their knees.
author: William Cowper

quote: The present in New York is so powerful that the past is lost.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
author: Lucy Larcom

quote: Be true to your work, your word, and your friend.
author: John Boyle O'Reilly

quote: I'm all for poetry catching up with technology, and just as there are iTunes, I think we should have iPoems. I mean, people should be able to walk around with their earbuds in and listening to poems on their iPod.
author: Billy Collins

quote: They hate whom they fear.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: There is no secret to success except hard work and getting something indefinable which we call 'the breaks.' In order for a writer to succeed, I suggest three things - read and write - and wait.
author: Countee Cullen

quote: I don't really care who gets their inspiration from where, it's the end results that count.
author: Robert Lloyd

quote: Now if the harvest is over, And the world cold, Give me the bonus of laughter, As I lose hold.
author: John Betjeman

quote: It is difficult to obtain the friendship of a cat. It is a philosophical animal... one that does not place its affections thoughtlessly.
author: Theophile Gautier

quote: Simplicity is natures first step, and the last of art.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: Glory paid to our ashes comes too late.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: The art of losing isn't hard to master; so many things seem filled with the intent to be lost that their loss is no disaster.
author: Elizabeth Bishop

quote: The dreadful burden of having nothing to do.
author: Nicolas Boileau-Despreaux

quote: He who would tell divers tales must know how to vary the tune.
author: Marie de France

quote: Her face betokened all things dear and good, The light of somewhat yet to come was there Asleep, and waiting for the opening day, When childish thoughts, like flowers would drift away.
author: Jean Ingelow

quote: Do what your inner soul tells you to do, regardless of any money or success it will bring you.
author: Etel Adnan

quote: Living is no laughing matter: you must live with great seriousness like a squirrel for example - I mean without looking for something beyond and above living, I mean living must be your whole occupation.
author: Nazim Hikmet

quote: The glory of gardening: hands in the dirt, head in the sun, heart with nature. To nurture a garden is to feed not just on the body, but the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Contentment is work so engrossing that you do not know that you are working.
author: Donald Hall

quote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

quote: And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his own funeral drest in his shroud.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old bray of my heart. I am. I am. I am.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Animals praise a good day, a good hunt. They praise rain if they're thirsty. That's prayer. They don't live an unconscious life, they simply have no language to talk about these things. But they are grateful for the good things that come along.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: Tell me I'm clever, Tell me I'm kind, Tell me I'm talented, Tell me I'm cute, Tell me I'm sensitive, Graceful and wise, Tell me I'm perfect - But tell me the truth.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
author: Ovid

quote: A slave is one who waits for someone to come and free him.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: He who laughs has not yet heard the bad news.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Politics, it seems to me, for years, or all too long, has been concerned with right or left instead of right or wrong.
author: Richard Armour

quote: A person isn't who they are during the last conversation you had with them - they're who they've been throughout your whole relationship.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Death be not proud, though some have called thee Mighty and dreadful, for thou art not so. For, those, whom thou think'st thou dost overthrow. Die not, poor death, nor yet canst thou kill me.
author: John Donne

quote: The pattern of the narrative never of necessity wants to end, it never has to.
author: Robert Creeley

quote: No man ever got very high by pulling other people down. The intelligent merchant does not knock his competitors. The sensible worker does not knock those who work with him. Don't knock your friends. Don't knock your enemies. Don't knock yourself.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: A thousand words will not leave so deep an impression as one deed.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Happiness is inward, and not outward; and so, it does not depend on what we have, but on what we are.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

quote: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Malice is only another name for mediocrity.
author: Patrick Kavanagh

quote: The wide world is all before us - but a world without a friend.
author: Robert Burns

quote: The weight of the world is love. Under the burden of solitude, under the burden of dissatisfaction.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Life is like an onion. You peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: We've learned that quiet isn't always peace and the norms and notions of what just is, isn't always justice.
author: Amanda Gorman

quote: Prayer should be the key of the day and the lock of the night.
author: George Herbert

quote: Better by far you should forget and smile that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Fond memory brings the light of other days around me.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: Sweet April showers do spring May flowers.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: The mind is its own place and in itself, can make a Heaven of Hell, a Hell of Heaven.
author: John Milton

quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
author: Juvenal

quote: The trouble with a kitten is that eventually it becomes a cat.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: I've never met a happy atheist.
author: John Cooper Clarke

quote: After all is said and done, sit down.
author: Bill Copeland

quote: We are more closely connected to the invisible than to the visible.
author: Novalis

quote: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
author: Lucretius

quote: Our present will become the past of other men and women. We depend on them to remember it with the complexity with which it was suffered. As others, once, depended on us.
author: Eavan Boland

quote: We live, not as we wish to, but as we can.
author: Menander

quote: I think we all have our own personality, unique and distinctive, and at the same time, I think that our own unique and distinctive personality blends with the wind, with the footsteps in the street, with the noises around the corner, and with the silence of memory, which is the great producer of ghosts.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: I was trying my damnedest to lead a conventional life, for that was how I was brought up, and it was what my husband wanted of me. But one can't build little white picket fences to keep nightmares out.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Fate loves the fearless.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Nothing, like something, happens anywhere.
author: Philip Larkin

quote: Extend a hand whether or not you know it shall be grasped.
author: Ryunosuke Satoro

quote: Thought is an errand boy, fear a mine of worries.
author: Yunus Emre

quote: Music has charms to sooth a savage breast, to soften rocks, or bend a knotted oak.
author: William Congreve

quote: The measure of a man's real character is what he would do if he knew he would never be found out.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Death is the mother of Beauty; hence from her, alone, shall come fulfillment to our dreams and our desires.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: The discontent that lies in the human condition is not satisfied simply by material things.
author: Derek Walcott

quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: We think that we suffer from ingratitude, while in reality we suffer from self-love.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: A translation is no translation, he said, unless it will give you the music of a poem along with the words of it.
author: John Millington Synge

quote: These are international criminals, and the spineless Democrats are doing nothing about it.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: You want a poem to unsettle something. There's a deep and interesting kind of troubling that poems do, which is to say, 'This is what you think you're certain of, and I'm going to show you how that's not enough. There's something more that might be even more rewarding if you're willing to let go of what you already know.'
author: Tracy K. Smith

quote: Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind; it is not a matter of rosy cheeks, red lips and supple knees; it is a matter of the will, quality of the imagination, a vigor of the emotions; it is the freshness of the deep springs of life.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: She was my first love, and I loved her as only a boy loves.
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: Soldiers are citizens of death's grey land, drawing no dividend from time's tomorrows.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

quote: With their souls of patent leather, they come down the road. Hunched and nocturnal, where they breathe they impose, silence of dark rubber, and fear of fine sand.
author: Federico Garcia Lorca

quote: Irony is a clear consciousness of an eternal agility, of the infinitely abundant chaos.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Let each man pass his days in that wherein his skill is greatest.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: Kings may be judges of the earth, but wise men are the judges of kings.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: The flesh, alas, is sad, and I have read all the books.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: Journalism is literature in a hurry.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: Out of nothing can come, and nothing can become nothing.
author: Persius

quote: It is no use to grumble and complain; It's just as cheap and easy to rejoice; When God sorts out the weather and sends rain - Why, rain's my choice.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: The way you get to know yourself is by the expressions on other people's faces, because that's the only thing that you can see, unless you carry a mirror about.
author: Gil Scott-Heron

quote: Let us love winter, for it is the spring of genius.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: Even if happiness forgets you a little bit, never completely forget about it.
author: Jacques Prevert

quote: Friendship's the wine of life: but friendship new... is neither strong nor pure.
author: Edward Young

quote: I walk out to my backyard garden at certain times of the year, and I can't get 30 feet without stopping for 20 minutes because the goumis need trimming.
author: Ross Gay

quote: Nourish beginnings, let us nourish beginnings. Not all things are blest, but the seeds of all things are blest. The blessing is in the seed.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Judge of a jest when you have done laughing.
author: Robert Lloyd

quote: Silver and ermine and red faces full of port wine.
author: John Betjeman

quote: To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind.
author: Theophile Gautier

quote: To bear is to conquer our fate.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: Fortune gives too much to many, enough to none.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: The whole shadow of Man is only as big as his hat.
author: Elizabeth Bishop

quote: No one who cannot limit himself has ever been able to write.
author: Nicolas Boileau-Despreaux

quote: Great were the lamentation and the cry when the news of this mischance was noised about the city. Such a tumult of mourning was never before heard, for the whole city was moved.
author: Marie de France

quote: The moon looks upon many night flowers; the night flowers see but one moon.
author: Jean Ingelow

quote: Places are part of nature, of the bigger picture. We are interrelated. When we contemplate them in their own right, they can sometimes change our lives; they can become spiritual experiences.
author: Etel Adnan

quote: And don't forget, a prisoner's wife must always think good thoughts.
author: Nazim Hikmet

quote: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: When I lament and darken over my diminishments, I accomplish nothing. It's better to sit at the window all day, pleased to watch birds, barns, and flowers.
author: Donald Hall

quote: Teach me to feel another's woe, to hide the fault I see, that mercy I to others show, that mercy show to me.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: We all have a hungry heart, and one of the things we hunger for is happiness. So as much as I possibly could, I stayed where I was happy.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Myself when young did eagerly frequent doctor and saint, and heard great argument about it and about: but evermore came out by the same door as in I went.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
author: John Keats

quote: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Music is the best means we have of digesting time.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Love will find a way through paths where wolves fear to prey.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Though lovers be lost, love shall not.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: In a war situation or where violence and injustice are prevalent, poetry is called upon to be something more than a thing of beauty.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Success is dependent on effort.
author: Sophocles

quote: For God's sake hold your tongue, and let me love.
author: John Donne

quote: Whatever makes an impression on the heart seems lovely in the eye.
author: Saadi

quote: They can because they think they can.
author: Virgil

quote: My strength is as the strength of ten, because my heart is pure.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: The majority is always wrong; the minority is rarely right.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Democracy is an abuse of statistics.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Never sell the bear's skin before one has killed the beast.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: The greatest pleasure of life is love.
author: Euripides

quote: Nothing wilts faster than laurels that have been rested upon.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The exciting quality about Joyce is that when you read him, you are not told of the large public issues that were agitating the minds of politicians and journalists on those days. Joyce is interested in the mind of a man who has put five shillings on a horse.
author: Patrick Kavanagh

quote: A mother is a mother still, The holiest thing alive.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
author: Robert Burns

quote: There is a pleasure in being mad which none but madmen know.
author: John Dryden

quote: But, truly, I have wept too much! The Dawns are heartbreaking. Every moon is atrocious and every sun bitter.
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: He that cannot forgive others, breaks the bridge over which he himself must pass if he would ever reach heaven; for everyone has need to be forgiven.
author: George Herbert

quote: It is well to read everything of something, and something of everything.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Keep all special thoughts and memories for lifetimes to come. Share these keepsakes with others to inspire hope and build from the past, which can bridge to the future.
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: Make hunger thy sauce, as a medicine for health.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: I love thee to the depth and breadth and height my soul can reach.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: My own curiosity and interest are insatiable.
author: Emma Lazarus

quote: The magician and the politician have much in common: they both have to draw our attention away from what they are really doing.
author: Ben Okri

quote: I've always thought of myself as a reporter.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Only an artist can interpret the meaning of life.
author: Novalis

quote: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: The moon is brighter since the barn burned.
author: Matsuo Basho

quote: To read a poem is to hear it with our eyes; to hear it is to see it with our ears.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Observe due measure, for right timing is in all things the most important factor.
author: Hesiod

quote: We might possess every technological resource... but if our language is inadequate, our vision remains formless, our thinking and feeling are still running in the old cycles, our process may be 'revolutionary' but not transformative.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Democracy gives every man the right to be his own oppressor.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I can't understand these chaps who go round American universities explaining how they write poems: It's like going round explaining how you sleep with your wife.
author: Philip Larkin

quote: Find patience in the breath of life.
author: Ryunosuke Satoro

quote: Seek not, my soul, the life of the immortals; but enjoy to the full the resources that are within thy reach.
author: Pindar

quote: To admit regret is to understand that we are fallible - that there are powers beyond us. To admit regret is to lose control not only of a difficult past but of the very story we tell about our present. To admit sincere and abiding regret is one of our greatest but unspoken contemporary sins.
author: David Whyte

quote: The troubles of our proud and angry dust are from eternity, and shall not fail. Bear them we can, and if we can we must. Shoulder the sky, my lad, and drink your ale.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Give fools their gold, and knaves their power; let fortune's bubbles rise and fall; who sows a field, or trains a flower, or plants a tree, is more than all.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: The American Dream is a phrase we'll have to wrestle with all of our lives. It means a lot of things to different people. I think we're redefining it now.
author: Rita Dove

quote: My own life was filled with so much love and joy that when depression struck, it was like a prison door slamming shut and I was being placed in an isolation cell. No one else could possibly be feeling what I was. I hated my depression and all of its symptoms.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

quote: No ashes are lighter than those of incense, and few things burn out sooner.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: What is the price of a thousand horses against a son where there is one son only?
author: John Millington Synge

quote: Southern California, where the American Dream came too true.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: There are two worlds: the world we can measure with line and rule, and the world that we feel with our hearts and imagination.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: In Berlin I especially enjoyed the orchestral concerts, and I attended a large number of them. I formed the acquaintance of a good many musicians, several of whom spoke of my playing in high terms.
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: To speak and to speak well, are two things. A fool may talk, but a wise man speaks.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: When you play a sax, that saxophone is irreverent. It's noisy; it's a trickster... you cannot hide the saxophone in your hands, so it's a good teacher.
author: Joy Harjo

quote: I am not protesting against the conduct of the war, but against the political errors and insincerities for which the fighting men are being sacrificed.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

quote: In Spain, the dead are more alive than the dead of any other country in the world.
author: Federico Garcia Lorca

quote: Although strength should fail, the effort will deserve praise. In great enterprises the attempt is enough.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: Your secret is your prisoner; once you reveal it, you become its slave.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: What a great poem teaches you - and it's not intellectual at all - is the resonance in the language that's heard there. This goes back to the very origins of poetry and to the very origins of language.
author: W. S. Merwin

quote: Be vigilant, for nothing one achieves lasts forever.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: Poetry is simply the most beautiful, impressive, and widely effective mode of saying things.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: If you do not raise your eyes you will think you are the highest point.
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: As a boy, I felt ashamed of being Mexican. I'd say I was Hawaiian.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: Do you not see with your own eyes the chrysalis fact assume by degrees the wings of fiction?
author: Alfred de Vigny

quote: I want to find someone on the earth so intelligent that he welcomes opinions which he condemns.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: A man's real possession is his memory. In nothing else is he rich, in nothing else is he poor.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: With the advance of feudalism came the growth of iron armor, until, at last, a fighting-man resembled an armadillo.
author: John Boyle O'Reilly

quote: I think my poems are slightly underrated by the word 'accessible.'
author: Billy Collins

quote: Be wise with speed; a fool at forty is a fool indeed.
author: Edward Young

quote: He whose wisdom cannot help him, gets no good from being wise.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: Breathe-in experience, breathe-out poetry.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: It is no use painting the foot of the tree white, the strength of the bark cries out from beneath the paint.
author: Aime Cesaire

quote: Shakespeare and Rembrandt have in common the faculty of quickening speculation and compelling the minds of men to combat and discussion.
author: William Ernest Henley

quote: In dreams begin responsibilities.
author: Delmore Schwartz

quote: And muse on Nature with a poet's eye.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: The world is full of fools; and he who would not wish to see one, must not only shut himself up alone, but must also break his looking-glass.
author: Nicolas Boileau-Despreaux

quote: A man who lives everywhere lives nowhere.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: I've been most happy to be an advocate for the kinds of grassroots things that people are doing who care about poetry.
author: Natasha Trethewey

quote: Who to himself is law, no law doth need, offends no law, and is a king indeed.
author: George Chapman

quote: I really feel better about aging at the age of 86 than I did at 70.
author: Donald Hall

quote: I have learned so much from God that I can no longer call myself a Christian, a Hindu, a Muslim, a Buddhist, a Jew.
author: Hafez

quote: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Love is like a virus. It can happen to anybody at any time.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried, Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I have a notion that if you are going to be spiritually curious, you better not get cluttered up with too many material things.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The thoughtful soul to solitude retires.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: When from our better selves we have too long been parted by the hurrying world, and droop. Sick of its business, of its pleasures tired, how gracious, how benign is solitude.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: If you want to be loved, be lovable.
author: Ovid

quote: Literature does not exist in a vacuum. Writers as such have a definite social function exactly proportional to their ability as writers. This is their main use.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Somebody's boring me. I think it's me.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be.
author: Robert Browning

quote: In larger things we are convivial; what causes trouble is the trivial.
author: Richard Armour

quote: We know little of the things for which we pray.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: The oaths of a woman I inscribe on water.
author: Sophocles

quote: Nature's great masterpiece, an elephant; the only harmless great thing.
author: John Donne

quote: Again like Williams, with the emphasis now regrettable, when a man makes a poem, makes it mind you, he takes the words as he finds them lying interrelated about him.
author: Robert Creeley

quote: Pale death, with impartial step, knocks at the hut of the poor and the towers of kings.
author: Horace

quote: Nations are born in the hearts of poets, they prosper and die in the hands of politicians.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: It never troubles the wolf how many the sheep may be.
author: Virgil

quote: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control; these three alone lead life to sovereign power.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: A community is like a ship; everyone ought to be prepared to take the helm.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Money, again, has often been a cause of the delusion of the multitudes. Sober nations have all at once become desperate gamblers, and risked almost their existence upon the turn of a piece of paper.
author: Charles Mackay

quote: Nothing is as dangerous as an ignorant friend; a wise enemy is to be preferred.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love, to work, to play, and to look up at the stars.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: There is even a happiness - that makes the heart afraid.
author: Thomas Hood

quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A great man is one who leaves others at a loss after he is gone.
author: Paul Valery

quote: All things are subject to decay and when fate summons, monarchs must obey.
author: John Dryden

quote: I saw that all beings are fated to happiness: action is not life, but a way of wasting some force, an enervation. Morality is the weakness of the brain.
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: Life is one long process of getting tired.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
author: George Herbert

quote: Who included me among the ranks of the human race?
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: Remember to play after every storm.
author: Mattie Stepanek

quote: God sendeth and giveth both mouth and meat.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: Where wealth accumulates, men decay.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: How many desolate creatures on the earth have learnt the simple dues of fellowship and social comfort, in a hospital.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I am never going to write for the sake of writing.
author: Emma Lazarus

quote: Parents were invented to make children happy by giving them something to ignore.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: I had TB as a boy. They said my skeletal frame never developed properly.
author: John Cooper Clarke

quote: When you use the term minority or minorities in reference to people, you're telling them that they're less than somebody else.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: When you jump for joy, beware that no one moves the ground from beneath your feet.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: Pleasant it is, when over a great sea the winds trouble the waters, to gaze from shore upon another's great tribulation; not because any man's troubles are a delectable joy, but because to perceive you are free of them yourself is pleasant.
author: Lucretius

quote: I think Lil Uzi is dope. Future is dope. I love Young Thug. I'm a huge Young Thug fan.
author: Joyner Lucas

quote: Deserve your dream.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Death's in the good-bye.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Helmet was joined to helmet, and spear to spear, and jewels, baggage, and elephants without number went with them, and you would have said it was a host that none could understand.
author: Ferdowsi

quote: Not failure, but low aim, is crime.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Above all, though, children are linked to adults by the simple fact that they are in process of turning into them. For this they may be forgiven much. Children are bound to be inferior to adults, or there is no incentive to grow up.
author: Philip Larkin

quote: The more articulate one is, the more dangerous words become.
author: May Sarton

quote: A graceful and honorable old age is the childhood of immortality.
author: Pindar

quote: Poetry is often the art of overhearing yourself say things you didn't know you knew. It is a learned skill to force yourself to articulate your life, your present world or your possibilities for the future.
author: David Whyte

quote: Poor, dear, silly Spring, preparing her annual surprise!
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: A great many people now reading and writing would be better employed keeping rabbits.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Through my own struggles with depression, I discovered that knowledge, therapy, medication and education can provide the strength to get through it in one piece.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

quote: A lively understandable spirit Once entertained you. It will come again. Be still. Wait.
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: I have some friends, some honest friends, and honest friends are few; My pipe of briar, my open fire, A book that's not too new.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: My hope is to create spaces where people of all stripes can come together and speak at a lower decibel level. We make more sense that way. We sound more like our real selves that way.
author: Tracy K. Smith

quote: The same people who can deny others everything are famous for refusing themselves nothing.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: I do think I have an ability to record sensual and emotional facts and factoids, to construct a convincing surface of what life feels like, both physical life and emotional life.
author: Anne Carson

quote: Statistics are the triumph of the quantitative method, and the quantitative method is the victory of sterility and death.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: My ancestors include Monahwee, who was one of the leaders in the Red Stick War, which was the largest Indian uprising in history, and Osceola, who refused to sign a treaty with the United States.
author: Joy Harjo

quote: I am making this statement as an act of wilful defiance of military authority, because I believe that the War is being deliberately prolonged by those who have the power to end it.
author: Siegfried Sassoon

quote: Every uneducated person is a caricature of himself.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: I grew up in a bookless house - my parents didn't read poetry, so if I hadn't had the chance to experience it at school I'd never have experienced it. But I loved English, and I was very lucky in that I had inspirational English teachers, Miss Scriven and Mr. Walker, and they liked us to learn poems by heart, which I found I loved doing.
author: Carol Ann Duffy

quote: A wise man's question contains half the answer.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: In Morocco, it's possible to see the Atlantic and the Mediterranean at the same time.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: I love 'Nuts in May.' A simple tale about a couple of well-meaning campers, determined to have a nice time in the country but thwarted by that classic fly in the ointment: 'other people.'
author: Tim Key

quote: The ripest peach is highest on the tree.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: Each man has his own desires; all do not possess the same inclinations.
author: Persius

quote: San Diego shaped me a lot. The visual landscapes, the emotional panoramas, the teachers and mentors I had from the third grade through San Diego High - it's all a big part of the poetry fountain that I continue to drink from.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: O solitude, where are the charms That sages have seen in thy face? Better dwell in the midst of alarms, Than reign in this horrible place.
author: William Cowper

quote: Why should the eyes be denied what delights them most?
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: The first line is the DNA of the poem; the rest of the poem is constructed out of that first line. A lot of it has to do with tone because tone is the key signature for the poem. The basis of trust for a reader used to be meter and end-rhyme.
author: Billy Collins

quote: Here is he laid to whom for daring deed, nor friend nor foe could render worthy meed.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: However confused the scene of our life appears, however torn we may be who now do face that scene, it can be faced, and we can go on to be whole.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: I was reared in the conservative atmosphere of a Methodist parsonage.
author: Countee Cullen

quote: Let each man think himself an act of God, His mind a thought, his life a breath of God; And let each try, by great thoughts and good deeds, To show the most of Heaven he hath in him.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: The cat is a dilettante in fur.
author: Theophile Gautier

quote: If fame is to come only after death, I am in no hurry for it.
author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote: Do you know, a horrible thing has happened to me. I have begun to doubt Tennyson.
author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

quote: Advice is seldom welcome; and those who want it the most always like it the least.
author: George Chapman

quote: No rules exist, and examples are simply life-savers answering the appeals of rules making vain attempts to exist.
author: Andre Breton

quote: He missed an invaluable opportunity to hold his tongue.
author: Andrew Lang

quote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself, I am large, I contain multitudes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed was the ninth beatitude.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Come Fairies, take me out of this dull world, for I would ride with you upon the wind and dance upon the mountains like a flame!
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I have discovered in life that there are ways of getting almost anywhere you want to go, if you really want to go.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: We loved with a love that was more than love.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: The child asks, 'Why don't I have this happiness thing you're telling me about?'
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Intelligence is not to make no mistakes, but quickly to see how to make them good.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Remember tonight... for it is the beginning of always.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: The problem as you get older... is that you become more self-aware. At the same time, you have to surprise yourself. There's no way of arranging the surprise, so it is tricky.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Humiliation is the beginning of sanctification.
author: John Donne

quote: There are a lot of editorials that have nothing to do with anything like that. But I was just thinking of that sense of prose as being very responsible and perceptive, thoughtful, intimate, and contriving a quote statement.
author: Robert Creeley

quote: Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even.
author: Horace

quote: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: The spirit of truth and the spirit of freedom - these are the pillars of society.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: To be immortal is commonplace; except for man, all creatures are immortal, for they are ignorant of death; what is divine, terrible, incomprehensible, is to know that one is immortal.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Every day brings new choices.
author: Martha Beck

quote: I truly believe that everything that we do and everyone that we meet is put in our path for a purpose. There are no accidents; we're all teachers - if we're willing to pay attention to the lessons we learn, trust our positive instincts and not be afraid to take risks or wait for some miracle to come knocking at our door.
author: Marla Gibbs

quote: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: No matter what you're going through, there's a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you'll find the positive side of things.
author: Demi Lovato

quote: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I think anything is possible if you have the mindset and the will and desire to do it and put the time in.
author: Roger Clemens

quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Few things in the world are more powerful than a positive push. A smile. A world of optimism and hope. A 'you can do it' when things are tough.
author: Richard M. DeVos

quote: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.
author: Leah LaBelle

quote: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.
author: Allen Klein

quote: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: The person who can bring the spirit of laughter into a room is indeed blessed.
author: Bennett Cerf

quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
author: George Allen, Sr.

quote: It's your outlook on life that counts. If you take yourself lightly and don't take yourself too seriously, pretty soon you can find the humor in our everyday lives. And sometimes it can be a lifesaver.
author: Betty White

quote: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all; and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.
author: Willard Scott

quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
author: Joyce Brothers

quote: It takes but one positive thought when given a chance to survive and thrive to overpower an entire army of negative thoughts.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Delete the negative; accentuate the positive!
author: Donna Karan

quote: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: People deal too much with the negative, with what is wrong. Why not try and see positive things, to just touch those things and make them bloom?
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: I've always believed that you can think positive just as well as you can think negative.
author: James Baldwin

quote: There are powers inside of you which, if you could discover and use, would make of you everything you ever dreamed or imagined you could become.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Instead of hating, I have chosen to forgive and spend all of my positive energy on changing the world.
author: Camryn Manheim

quote: A positive attitude is something everyone can work on, and everyone can learn how to employ it.
author: Joan Lunden

quote: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Even when bad things happen you have to try to use those bad things in a positive manner and really just take the positive out of it.
author: Natalie du Toit

quote: Miracles occur naturally as expressions of love. The real miracle is the love that inspires them. In this sense everything that comes from love is a miracle.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: A lot of times people look at the negative side of what they feel they can't do. I always look on the positive side of what I can do.
author: Chuck Norris

quote: Talking is always positive. That's why I talk too much.
author: Louis C. K.

quote: I was blessed with certain gifts and talents and God gave them to me to be the best person I can be and to have a positive impact on other people.
author: Bryan Clay

quote: I believe that you should gravitate to people who are doing productive and positive things with their lives.
author: Nadia Comaneci
