quote: So that godly sorrow may be discerned by this train of graces wherewith it is accompanied, that worldly sorrow wants, at least in the truth of them, though it may have some shadows of them.
author: Thomas Hooker

quote: All truth, in the long run, is only common sense clarified.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: The truth doesn't have to do with cruelty, the truth has to do with mercy.
author: Ken Kesey

quote: The truth is that we live out our lives putting off all that can be put off; perhaps we all know deep down that we are immortal and that sooner or later all men will do and know all things.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: The truth is that those who join gangs - more often than not they are young men in their later teens - often do come from the most difficult family backgrounds, from an environment where they feel neglected and unwanted. Gang membership can bring a perverse sense of belonging which they may not have ever got at home.
author: Chris Grayling

quote: Journalism has changed tremendously because of the democratization of information. Anybody can put something up on the Internet. It's harder and harder to find what the truth is.
author: Robert Redford

quote: My style is in the 21st century. If you look at the process, it goes from photography through Photoshop, where certain features are heightened, elements of the photo are diminished. There is no sense of truth when you're looking at the painting or the photo or that moment when the photo was first taken.
author: Kehinde Wiley

quote: An author must be nothing if he do not love truth; a barrister must be nothing if he do.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: The science of operations, as derived from mathematics more especially, is a science of itself, and has its own abstract truth and value.
author: Ada Lovelace

quote: The truth is the Super Bowl long ago became more than just a football game. It's part of our culture like turkey at Thanksgiving and lights at Christmas, and like those holidays beyond their meaning, a factor in our economy.
author: Bob Schieffer

quote: To the artist is sometimes granted a sudden, transient insight which serves in this matter for experience. A flash, and where previously the brain held a dead fact, the soul grasps a living truth! At moments we are all artists.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: I've been & am absurdly over-estimated. There are no supermen & I'm quite ordinary, & will say so whatever the artistic results. In that point I'm one of the few people who tell the truth about myself.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: But now I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Now all we need is to continue to speak the truth fearlessly, and we shall add to our number those who will turn the scale to the side of equal and full justice in all things.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: I'm Billy the Kid, the fastest draw. It's not arrogance. It's the truth.
author: David Geffen

quote: When I went through my eating disorder, I never sought medical assistance. I created myths in my head about how I should get through things, so the idea that I could surround myself with truth and feel comfortable enough to speak mine allowed me to breathe.
author: Lily Collins

quote: The Bible must be considered as the great source of all the truth by which men are to be guided in government as well as in all social transactions.
author: Noah Webster

quote: Truth is often a multiplicity of perspectives, and sometimes the more viewpoints and versions of events there are, the closer the reader gets to an overarching truth.
author: Susan Barker

quote: Learning is always rebellion... Every bit of new truth discovered is revolutionary to what was believed before.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: A pessimist is a man who tells the truth prematurely.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: Yeah, I think that's it... It's like Jesse James. He became really popular because he lasted so long. You know, there is some degree of truth to the fact that time will dignify anything, too.
author: John Milius

quote: I don't want to tell President Obama how to make a speech. He's a much better speech maker than I am. But I think always to tell the truth in a sometimes blatant way, even though it might be temporarily unpopular, is the best approach.
author: Jimmy Carter

quote: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practise to deceive!
author: Walter Scott

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean Paul

quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: It is not who is right, but what is right, that is of importance.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

quote: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: I will not follow where the path may lead, but I will go where there is no path, and I will leave a trail.
author: Muriel Strode

quote: Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Once you label me you negate me.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?
author: Jim Carrey

quote: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
author: John Burroughs

quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: My father said there were two kinds of people in the world: givers and takers. The takers may eat better, but the givers sleep better.
author: Marlo Thomas

quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: Start wide, expand further, and never look back.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Always keep an open mind and a compassionate heart.
author: Phil Jackson

quote: The wheel that squeaks the loudest is the one that gets the grease.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Today's mighty oak is just yesterday's nut, that held its ground.
author: David Icke

quote: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: It's easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
author: William Blake

quote: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
author: George Eliot

quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: I praise loudly. I blame softly.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Wise sayings often fall on barren ground, but a kind word is never thrown away.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.
author: Loretta Young

quote: Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
author: Tom Wilson

quote: Perhaps too much of everything is as bad as too little.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The future has already arrived. It's just not evenly distributed yet.
author: William Gibson

quote: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.
author: Dan Rather

quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Never cut what you can untie.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quote: It's not the having, it's the getting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: A closed mouth catches no flies.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
author: Confucius

quote: All of us, at certain moments of our lives, need to take advice and to receive help from other people.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: None knows the weight of another's burden.
author: George Herbert

quote: If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: If you want to go east, don't go west.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages are perpetuated by quotations.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: It is much more difficult to measure nonperformance than performance.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: If you want to be found stand where the seeker seeks.
author: Sidney Lanier

quote: This is the highest wisdom that I own; freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: If you call failures experiments, you can put them in your resume and claim them as achievements.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
author: Jane Wyman

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: The soul's joy lies in doing.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Quick decisions are unsafe decisions.
author: Sophocles

quote: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: This is what I learned: that everybody is talented, original and has something important to say.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Almost every wise saying has an opposite one, no less wise, to balance it.
author: George Santayana

quote: You have to find out what's right for you, so it's trial and error. You are going to be all right if you accept realistic goals for yourself.
author: Teri Garr

quote: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: He dares to be a fool, and that is the first step in the direction of wisdom.
author: James Huneker

quote: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
author: Aesop

quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Deliberately seek opportunities for kindness, sympathy, and patience.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

quote: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

quote: It is like the seed put in the soil - the more one sows, the greater the harvest.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Nobody can give you wiser advice than yourself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: You can observe a lot by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The more one pleases everybody, the less one pleases profoundly.
author: Stendhal

quote: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
author: Josh Billings

quote: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
author: Confucius

quote: Everything in the world may be endured except continual prosperity.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Please all, and you will please none.
author: Aesop

quote: Look twice before you leap.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Wisdom sails with wind and time.
author: John Florio

quote: Wisdom is the quality that keeps you from getting into situations where you need it.
author: Doug Larson

quote: The difference between chirping out of turn and a faux pas depends on what kind of a bar you're in.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: Strong characters are brought out by change of situation, and gentle ones by permanence.
author: Jean Paul

quote: Self-suggestion makes you master of yourself.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I didn't get where I am today by worryin' about how I'd feel tomorrow.
author: Ron White

quote: Habit is the nursery of errors.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: He who devotes sixteen hours a day to hard study may become at sixty as wise as he thought himself at twenty.
author: Mary Wilson Little

quote: When you betray somebody else, you also betray yourself.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Never find fault with the absent.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.
author: William Inge

quote: We are wiser than we know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: To advise is not to compel.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: An ounce of cheerfulness is worth a pound of sadness to serve God with.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Eventually, we reach the point where we start to realize that we are not going to find peace, contentment, happiness, strength, fearlessness - all of the things that in our heart of hearts we wish we had - outside of us.
author: Guy Finley

quote: Let deeds match words.
author: Plautus

quote: Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil, not the strength to choose between the two.
author: John Cheever

quote: Wisdom is a sacred communion.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: People seldom refuse help, if one offers it in the right way.
author: A. C. Benson

quote: Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: In seeking wisdom thou art wise; in imagining that thou hast attained it - thou art a fool.
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

quote: Everything important always begins from something trivial.
author: Donald Hall

quote: Man is only great when he acts from passion.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The chief condition on which, life, health and vigor depend on, is action. It is by action that an organism develops its faculties, increases its energy, and attains the fulfillment of its destiny.
author: Colin Powell

quote: When defeat is inevitable, it is wisest to yield.
author: Quintilian

quote: It is great folly to wish to be wise all alone.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Few of the many wise apothegms which have been uttered have prevented a single foolish action.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
author: Clifford Stoll

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
author: Plato

quote: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Always keep your mind as bright and clear as the vast sky, the great ocean, and the highest peak, empty of all thoughts. Always keep your body filled with light and heat. Fill yourself with the power of wisdom and enlightenment.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
author: Homer

quote: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.
author: Mark Goulston

quote: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: We learn from each other. We learn from others' mistakes, from their experience, their wisdom. It makes it easier for us to come to better decisions in our own lives.
author: Adrian Grenier

quote: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
author: Marcia Fudge

quote: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
author: Akhenaton

quote: An owl is traditionally a symbol of wisdom, so we are neither doves nor hawks but owls, and we are vigilant when others are resting.
author: Urjit Patel

quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Theroux

quote: Those who improve with age embrace the power of personal growth and personal achievement and begin to replace youth with wisdom, innocence with understanding, and lack of purpose with self-actualization.
author: Bo Bennett

quote: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: We learn wisdom from failure much more than from success. We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
author: Hippolyte Taine

quote: Community organizing is all about building grassroots support. It's about identifying the people around you with whom you can create a common, passionate cause. And it's about ignoring the conventional wisdom of company politics and instead playing the game by very different rules.
author: Tom Peters

quote: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: To know one's self is wisdom, but not to know one's neighbors is genius.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: A thought transfixed me: for the first time in my life, I saw the truth as it is set into song by so many poets, proclaimed as the final wisdom by so many thinkers. The truth - that love is the ultimate and the highest goal to which man can aspire.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Few people have the wisdom to prefer the criticism that would do them good, to the praise that deceives them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: This age thinks better of a gilded fool Than of a threadbare saint in wisdom's school.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I think that music opens portals and doorways into unknown sectors that it takes courage to leap into. I always think that there's a potential that we all have, and we can emerge, rise up to this potential, when necessary. We have to be fearless, courageous, and draw upon wisdom that we think we don't have.
author: Wayne Shorter

quote: Influential people are never satisfied with the status quo. They're the ones who constantly ask, 'What if?' and 'Why not?' They're not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom, and they don't disrupt things for the sake of being disruptive; they do it to make things better.
author: Travis Bradberry

quote: Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the furthest thing from it. Because cynics don't learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness: a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say 'no.' But saying 'yes' begins things. Saying 'yes' is how things grow.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: Sometimes you surprise yourself with what you can handle, and if you come out the other end with some wisdom, then it's not such a bad thing.
author: Boy George

quote: Through consciousness, our minds have the power to change our planet and ourselves. It is time we heed the wisdom of the ancient indigenous people and channel our consciousness and spirit to tend the garden and not destroy it.
author: Bruce Lipton

quote: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: Strength and wisdom are not opposing values.
author: William J. Clinton

quote: The philosophies of one age have become the absurdities of the next, and the foolishness of yesterday has become the wisdom of tomorrow.
author: William Osler

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The all-seeing eye of God beheld our deplorable state; infinite pity touched the heart of the Father of mercies; and infinite wisdom laid the plan of our recovery.
author: David Brainerd

quote: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
author: Frank Abagnale

quote: I have devoted my life to uncertainty. Certainty is the death of wisdom, thought, creativity.
author: Shekhar Kapur

quote: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.
author: Alex Grey

quote: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
author: Riccardo Muti

quote: One part of wisdom is knowing what you don't need anymore and letting it go.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.
author: Walter Benjamin

quote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Our experience is composed rather of illusions lost than of wisdom acquired.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Memory is not wisdom; idiots can by rote repeat volumes. Yet what is wisdom without memory?
author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

quote: It doesn't matter how much wisdom you have. If you don't have position, you have nothing. That's the tragedy of India.
author: Rahul Gandhi

quote: Age does not bring you wisdom, age brings you wrinkles.
author: Estelle Getty

quote: Sciences may be learned by rote, but wisdom not.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: The Divine of the Lord in heaven is love, for the reason that love is receptive of all things of heaven, such as peace, intelligence, wisdom and happiness.
author: Emanuel Swedenborg

quote: Since human wisdom cannot secure us from accidents, it is the greatest effort of reason to bear them well.
author: John Paul Jones

quote: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: There is a universal, intelligent, life force that exists within everyone and everything. It resides within each one of us as a deep wisdom, an inner knowing. We can access this wonderful source of knowledge and wisdom through our intuition, an inner sense that tells us what feels right and true for us at any given moment.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, and the wisdom of cookbook writers.
author: Laurie Colwin

quote: There is no pain equal to that which two lovers can inflict on one another. This should be made clear to all who contemplate such a union. The avoidance of this pain is the beginning of wisdom, for it is strong enough to contaminate the rest of our lives.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Because in the school of the Spirit man learns wisdom through humility, knowledge by forgetting, how to speak by silence, how to live by dying.
author: Johannes Tauler

quote: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
author: Bill Bradley

quote: Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: The price of wisdom is innocence. So, I have definitely become wiser but sadly a little less innocent.
author: Mahira Khan

quote: Good economic policy requires not so much the bravado to implement drastic change as the strength and wisdom to make reasonable trade-offs over the many years it takes to transform a country's standard of living.
author: Peter Blair Henry

quote: The wisdom of crowds works when the crowd is choosing the price of an ox, when there's a single numeric average. But if it's a design or something that matters, the decision is made by committee, and that's crap. You want people and groups who are able to think thoughts before they share.
author: Jaron Lanier

quote: The wisdom acquired with the passage of time is a useless gift unless you share it.
author: Esther Williams

quote: The more I work with the body, keeping my assumptions in a temporary state of reservation, the more I appreciate and sympathize with a given disease. The body no longer appears as a sick or irrational demon, but as a process with its own inner logic and wisdom.
author: George MacDonald

quote: New ideas that fly in the face of conventional wisdom of the day are always greeted with doubt and scorn, even fear.
author: John C. Bogle

quote: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: It's time to listen to the stories of the Indigenous; we are blessed as a country to look to the wisdom of a really old country.
author: Gord Downie

quote: What is the price of experience? Do men buy it for a song? Or wisdom for a dance in the street? No, it is bought with the price of all the man hath, his house, his wife, his children.
author: William Blake

quote: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Consider this point. It is a main point of true wisdom. Whenever there is an execution of purpose, there must be an agent.
author: Adoniram Judson

quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: If I am fool, it is, at least, a doubting one; and I envy no one the certainty of his self-approved wisdom.
author: Lord Byron

quote: To think ill of mankind and not wish ill to them, is perhaps the highest wisdom and virtue.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Unrestrained zeal to make the world better could make it worse. Promoting democracy must be undertaken with humility, care, and wisdom.
author: Richard N. Haass

quote: It seems to me that, in every culture, I come across a chapter headed 'Wisdom.' And then I know exactly what is going to follow: 'Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.'
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: After the knowledge of, and obedience to, the will of God, the next aim must be to know something of His attributes of wisdom, power, and goodness as evidenced by His handiwork.
author: James Prescott Joule

quote: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: The wisdom and experience of older people is a resource of inestimable worth. Recognizing and treasuring the contributions of older people is essential to the long-term flourishing of any society.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: What a company's been earning doesn't mean anything. What you have to look at is what people think it's going to earn. If you can see something in two years is going to be entirely different than the conventional wisdom, that's how you make money.
author: Stanley Druckenmiller

quote: I went out of my way to play games I didn't like or find interesting. Those ended up being a lot more informative for me. At home, I have literally thousands of games, and I think of them as pearls of wisdom from my predecessors.
author: Masahiro Sakurai

quote: Come, come, leave business to idlers, and wisdom to fools: they have need of 'em: wit be my faculty, and pleasure my occupation, and let father Time shake his glass.
author: William Congreve

quote: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: I'll come to you with gifts of knowledge, wisdom and truth.
author: Barry White

quote: Mainstream media tend to just mouth the conventional wisdom, to see everything through the filter of right and left.
author: Arianna Huffington

quote: But in its final creation it was not the part of the Father's power to fail as though exhausted. It was not the part of His wisdom to waver in a needful matter through poverty of counsel.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: The beginning of wisdom is to desire it.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
author: Wallace Stegner

quote: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

quote: Women are stronger than men - they do not die of wisdom.
author: James Stephens

quote: I don't see the wisdom in modern politicians that I once saw in men like Dean Acheson, David Bruce, or George Marshall. In my day, the northeastern establishment dominated foreign policy formulation, but the composition and distribution of our population is very different today.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Men who know themselves are no longer fools. They stand on the threshold of the door of Wisdom.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: This, and this alone, is Christianity, a universal holiness in every part of life, a heavenly wisdom in all our actions, not conforming to the spirit and temper of the world but turning all worldly enjoyments into means of piety and devotion to God.
author: William Law

quote: The stupidity of people comes from having an answer for everything. The wisdom of the novel comes from having a question for everything.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Teach your children poetry; it opens the mind, lends grace to wisdom and makes the heroic virtues hereditary.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Even by common wisdom, there seem to be both people and objects in my dream that are outside myself, but clearly they were created in myself and are part of me, they are mental constructs in my own brain.
author: Ray Kurzweil

quote: We live in a culture that doesn't acknowledge or validate human intuition and doesn't encourage us to rely on our intuitive wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: When you get older, you learn certain life lessons. You apply that wisdom, and suddenly you say, 'Hey, I've got a new lease on this thing. So let's go.'
author: Robert Redford

quote: They whom truth and wisdom lead, can gather honey from a weed.
author: William Cowper

quote: They would need to be already wise, in order to love wisdom.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Any successful nominee should possess both the temperament to interpret the law and the wisdom to do so fairly. The next Supreme Court Justice should have a record of protecting individual rights and a strong willingness to put aside any political agenda.
author: Bennie Thompson

quote: I love being. There's so much wisdom in it. You wake up in the morning and you think, Hey, isn't it great just being?
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

quote: Robots have already surpassed human beings in calculation and memory, but I have no doubt that the time will come when they will surpass in wisdom as well.
author: Masayoshi Son

quote: Lessons of wisdom have the most power over us when they capture the heart through the groundwork of a story, which engages the passions.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: In the long-run every Government is the exact symbol of its People, with their wisdom and unwisdom; we have to say, Like People like Government.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No one ever found wisdom without also being a fool. Writers, alas, have to be fools in public, while the rest of the human race can cover its tracks.
author: Erica Jong

quote: As a parent and a citizen, I'll take a Bill Gates (or Warren Buffett) over Steve Jobs every time. If we must have billionaires, better they should ignore Jobs's example and instead embrace the morality and wisdom of the great industrialist-philanthropist Andrew Carnegie.
author: Eric Alterman

quote: You know, many people have said that I'm on the edge and I'm maverick for some of the big operations that I've done. I'm not at all. I pray; I ask God to give me wisdom, 'Should I do it?', guidance in terms of how to do it, who to consult with. All those kind of things are incredibly important.
author: Ben Carson

quote: No single person can possess the wisdom to chart our course.
author: Jonathan Schell

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: Both old and young alike ought to seek wisdom: the former in order that, as age comes over him, he may be young in good things because of the grace of what has been, and the latter in order that, while he is young, he may at the same time be old, because he has no fear of the things which are to come.
author: Epicurus

quote: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
author: Parker Palmer

quote: For most of us, wisdom is acquired in the thicket of experience and usually meets us somewhere along the way if we live long enough. But sooner is better than later.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: If people can't acknowledge the wisdom of indigenous cultures, then that's their loss.
author: Jay Griffiths

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: The wisdom of age: don't stop walking.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: I have learned throughout my life as a composer chiefly through my mistakes and pursuits of false assumptions, not by my exposure to founts of wisdom and knowledge.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: I know that inner wisdom is more precious than wealth. The more you spend it, the more you gain.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The marvel of the Bhagavad-Gita is its truly beautiful revelation of life's wisdom which enables philosophy to blossom into religion.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William Penn

quote: It has become part of the accepted wisdom to say that the twentieth century was the century of physics and the twenty-first century will be the century of biology.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern, so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
author: Buddha

quote: If we have built on the fragile cornerstones of human wisdom, pride, and conditional love, things may look good for a while, but a weak foundation causes collapse when storms hit.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The enemy of the conventional wisdom is not ideas but the march of events.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The more I draw and write, the more I realise that accidents are a necessary part of any creative act, much more so than logic or wisdom. Sometimes a mistake is the only way of arriving at an original concept, and the history of successful inventions is full of mishaps, serendipity and unintended results.
author: Shaun Tan

quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
author: Socrates

quote: Experience - the wisdom that enables us to recognise in an undesirable old acquaintance the folly that we have already embraced.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Kindness is wisdom.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: What could be more lonely than to be enveloped in silence, to be the last of your people to speak your native tongue, to have no way to pass on the wisdom of the elders, to anticipate the promise of the children. This tragic fate is indeed the plight of someone somewhere roughly every two weeks.
author: Wade Davis

quote: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Purity engenders Wisdom, Passion avarice, and Ignorance folly, infatuation and darkness.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Instead of looking at life as a narrowing funnel, we can see it ever widening to choose the things we want to do, to take the wisdom we've learned and create something.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: Arianna Huffington has exercised her renowned wisdom to give journalism another boost along the ever busier Internet. Her blog site promises to be an interesting challenge for those of us lucky enough to be invited to participate with our occasional contributions.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself; the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Wisdom and understanding can only become the possession of individual men by travelling the old road of observation, attention, perseverance, and industry.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: I've always shied away from conventional wisdom, though I know the power of it.
author: Peter Jennings

quote: For the subtlest folly proceeds from the subtlest wisdom.
author: John Webster

quote: Those who govern, having much business on their hands, do not generally like to take the trouble of considering and carrying into execution new projects. The best public measures are therefore seldom adopted from previous wisdom, but forced by the occasion.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There should be a point to movies. Sure, you're giving people a diversion from the cold world for a bit, but at the same time, you pass on some facts and rules and maybe a little bit of wisdom.
author: George Lucas

quote: To light one candle to God and another to the Devil is the principle of wisdom.
author: Jose Bergamin

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

quote: However glorious an action in itself, it ought not to pass for great if it be not the effect of wisdom and intention.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: War involves in its progress such a train of unforeseen circumstances that no human wisdom can calculate the end; it has but one thing certain, and that is to increase taxes.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: There is a wisdom in this beyond the rules of physic: a man's own observation what he finds good of and what he finds hurt of is the best physic to preserve health.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Mothers are supposed to listen and, afterward, to respond with some wisdom and perspective, but these things were not my mother's strong suit.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: The seven wise men of Greece, so famous for their wisdom all the world over, acquired all that fame, each of them, by a single sentence consisting of two or three words.
author: Robert South

quote: The experience gathered from books, though often valuable, is but the nature of learning; whereas the experience gained from actual life is one of the nature of wisdom.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or aeroplane, or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Age is a terrible avenger. The lessons of life give you so much to work with, but by the time you've got all this great wisdom, you don't get to be young anymore.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quote: The novelist teaches the reader to comprehend the world as a question. There is wisdom and tolerance in that attitude. In a world built on sacrosanct certainties the novel is dead.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: I sought my father in the world of the black musician, because it contained wisdom, experience, sadness and loneliness. I was not ever interested in the music of boys. From my youngest years, I was interested in the music of men.
author: Eric Clapton

quote: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: The more you meditate on the laws of Moses, the more striking and brighter does their wisdom appear.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: If an idea is indeed sensible, it will eventually become just part of the accepted wisdom.
author: Nigel Farage

quote: Radical common sense is the wisdom gleaned from the past that recognizes the perishable opportunities of the moment. It is the willingness to admit error and the refusal to be deterred by failure.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: Every speaker has a mouth; An arrangement rather neat. Sometimes it's filled with wisdom. Sometimes it's filled with feet.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Many spiritual teachers - in Buddhism, in Islam - have talked about first-hand experience of the world as an important part of the path to wisdom, to enlightenment.
author: bell hooks

quote: I covered my face because they had taken my wisdom teeth out.
author: Josh Brolin

quote: Wisdom is important in every man's life.
author: Rza

quote: In societies where mature workers are respected and where their wisdom is respected, everybody benefits. Workers are more engaged and productive. Their health is better. They live longer.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: Wisdom finds its literary expression in wisdom literature.
author: Paul Ricoeur

quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
author: Sophocles

quote: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Where fear is present, wisdom cannot be.
author: Lactantius

quote: We are all responsible to Jesus first, and then, under him, to various other persons and offices. Discerning the path of love and obedience when two or more of these submissive relationships collide is a call to humble, Bible-saturated, spiritual wisdom.
author: John Piper

quote: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

quote: Being a philosopher is to think, seek wisdom, and have principles that guide and influence what you do. It's to give meaning to things, find your way in the world, believe that in the end, in every instance, good will overcome evil, even if there's a bit of suffering along the way.
author: Andrea Pirlo

quote: What if Barack Obama established a Presidential Advisory Committee that would meet once every couple of months, bringing together the former presidents for a conference in order to seek their collective wisdom? There is a wealth of experience in former presidents that generally goes untapped.
author: Tony Campolo

quote: Lion sounds that have not grown from the mouse may exude naked power... but cannot convey any wisdom or understanding... The initial steps on the path to courageous speech then are the first tentative steps into the parts of us that cannot speak.
author: David Whyte

quote: Man is wise and constantly in quest of more wisdom; but the ultimate wisdom, which deals with beginnings, remains locked in a seed. There it lies, the simplest fact of the universe and at the same time the one which calls forth faith rather than reason.
author: Hal Borland

quote: Every day, every birthday candle I blow out, every penny I throw over my shoulder in a wishing well, every time my daughter says, 'Let's make a wish on a star,' there's one thing I wish for: wisdom.
author: Rene Russo

quote: Preconceived notions are the locks on the door to wisdom.
author: Mary Browne

quote: The arts, quite simply, nourish the soul. They sustain, comfort, inspire. There is nothing like that exquisite moment when you first discover the beauty of connecting with others in celebration of larger ideals and shared wisdom.
author: Gordon Gee

quote: If I have brought any message today, it is this: Have the courage to have your wisdom regarded as stupidity. Be fools for Christ. And have the courage to suffer the contempt of the sophisticated world.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.
author: George Eliot

quote: A wholesome oblivion of one's neighbours is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Richard Le Gallienne

quote: Wit and playfulness represent a desperately serious transcendence of evil. Humor is both a form of wisdom and a means of survival.
author: Tom Robbins

quote: Spend time reflecting on your emotional and physical existence and how that applies to the voice. You have to apply that wisdom and experience when you sing - it's what comes through.
author: K. D. Lang

quote: The Relation we bear to the Wisdom of the Father, the Son of His Love, gives us indeed a dignity which otherwise we have no pretence to. It makes us something, something considerable even in God's Eyes.
author: Mary Astell

quote: Your law may be perfect, your knowledge of human affairs may be such as to enable you to apply it with wisdom and skill, and yet without individual acquaintance with men, their haunts and habits, the pursuit of the profession becomes difficult, slow, and expensive.
author: William Dunbar

quote: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Education makes us more stupid than the brutes. A thousand voices call to us on every hand, but our ears are stopped with wisdom.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: The hunger for facile wisdom is the root of all false philosophy.
author: George Santayana

quote: Back of every mistaken venture and defeat is the laughter of wisdom, if you listen.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Enraging liberals is simply one of the more enjoyable side effects of my wisdom.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quote: Wisdom, prudence, forethought, these are essential. But not second to these that noble courage which adventures the right, and leaves the consequences to God.
author: Robert Dale Owen

quote: I think we are evolving rapidly into one world culture. It's certainly one world economy. With billions of people online, I think we'll appreciate the wisdom in many different traditions as we learn more about them. People were very isolated and didn't know anything about other religions 100 years ago.
author: Ray Kurzweil

quote: We all have within us a deep wisdom, but sometimes we don't know we have it.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: There is a trade off - as you grow older you gain wisdom but you lose spontaneity.
author: Kenny Rogers

quote: In the frank expression of conflicting opinions lies the greatest promise of wisdom in governmental action.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: Putting is like wisdom - partly a natural gift and partly the accumulation of experience.
author: Arnold Palmer

quote: Through mutual understanding, sincerity and goodwill, and with great wisdom and broad views, the leaders on both sides should jointly initiate new opportunities for peace, stability, cooperation and mutual benefit.
author: Chen Shui-bian

quote: Look at anyone's bookcase at home, no matter how modest, and you're going to find a book that contains wisdom or ideas or a language that's at least a thousand years old. And the idea that humans have created a mechanism to time travel, to hurl ideas into the future, it sort of bookends. Books are a time machine.
author: Jonathan Nolan

quote: I am not one who was born in the custody of wisdom; I am one who is fond of olden times and intense in quest of the sacred knowing of the ancients.
author: Gustave Courbet

quote: I have no agenda except to be funny. Neither I or the writers profess to offer any worldly wisdom.
author: Julia Louis-Dreyfus

quote: It is my earnest hope that all parties across the political spectrum will bear Hong Kong's long-term interests in mind, apply their political wisdom, and seek a consensus through open and rational communication with people of different views.
author: Carrie Lam

quote: Much of the wisdom of one age, is the folly of the next.
author: Charles Simmons

quote: After a gig I always head back to the hotel, remembering granny's words of wisdom. I cancel the late-night pizza and watch the Jonathan Ross show instead.
author: Jimmy Carr

quote: Focus on the mind and the soul. Read. Study. Enrol in a course of lectures. Pray. Become a member of a religious congregation. Study the Bible or other ancient works of wisdom.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: We have no words for speaking of wisdom to the stupid. He who understands the wise is wise already.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: What's different now is that while political leaders used to give talking points to talk radio, now talk-radio hosts are giving talking points to political leaders. It's all part of the suffocating spin cycle we're in. In media, politics and publishing, the conventional wisdom is to play to this base.
author: John Avlon

quote: There's the conventional wisdom, of which I have none, where you get a record deal, you get a publicist, you get a campaign, and you do the tour, but none of that adds up to things like nuance and subtlety and dynamic.
author: Chris Robinson

quote: The time of wisdom cannot be measured, and for me, wisdom is the garden. There is no time in the garden.
author: W. S. Merwin

quote: Courage is always the surest wisdom.
author: Wilfred Grenfell

quote: Wisdom not only gets, but once got, retains.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: The left has come to regard common sense - the traditional wisdom and folkways of the community - as an obstacle to progress and enlightenment.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: God in His wisdom has decided that He will reward no works but His own.
author: Johannes Tauler

quote: People used to grow up in small communities where folk wisdom was passed down. But we don't live there anymore. We can't go next door to your aunt and ask her for the answers.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estes

quote: God the Father, the supreme Architect, had already built this cosmic home we behold, the most sacred temple of His godhead, by the laws of His mysterious wisdom.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: My mother is a great source of advice and wisdom and consolation for me.
author: Katherine Heigl

quote: Second, this epic tale allows the audience to actually listen to the Native Americans and receive their wisdom. Spielberg conveys the respect for Native Americans that is normally lacking in Western films.
author: Beau Bridges

quote: Many people have their reputations as reporters and analysts because they are on television, batting around conventional wisdom. A lot of these people have never reported a story.
author: Bob Woodward

quote: Silence and reserve will give anyone a reputation for wisdom.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: Beauty, the eternal Spouse of the Wisdom of God and Angel of his Presence thru' all creation.
author: Robert Bridges

quote: I quite like the idea - just as an abstract idea - of 12 people's collective life experience and wisdom being this formidable thing. People say juries can be led - I think 12 people from different backgrounds, different races, different genders, different ages, it's hard to hoodwink.
author: Peter Morgan

quote: Conventional wisdom tells us we'll only be happier after a divorce if the marriage itself was a war zone.
author: Ariel Gore

quote: In my own personal life, God plays a great role in the risk, because I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.
author: Ben Carson

quote: Conventional wisdom notwithstanding, there is no reason either in football or in poetry why the two should not meet in a man's life if he has the weight and cares about the words.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: Saudi Arabia is a puritanical state that claims a monopoly of wisdom and virtue.
author: James Buchan

quote: I have the responsibility of over four million people, and I am in a position to do good, to be able to bring about a new life for my people, and I will continue to move in that direction. It's a burden, but it needs to be done, and you have to have the courage and wisdom to see it through.
author: Abdullah II of Jordan

quote: Money can be taken away from you, by the IRS or by pistol. That's why I always measure riches in terms of wisdom. No one can ever take from you what you know.
author: Juan Gabriel

quote: It is now conventional wisdom that Americans do not care why we went to war in Iraq, that it is enough that the world is better off without Saddam Hussein.
author: Adam Schiff

quote: To suppose more than one supreme Source of infinite wisdom, power, and all perfections, is to assert that there is no supreme Being in existence.
author: Adam Clarke

quote: I'm not an academic philosopher, and don't agree with the way the universities approach the subject. I'm a philosopher only in the very loose sense of someone interested in wisdom and well-being attained through reason. But I'm as interested in psychoanalysis and art as I am in philosophy.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: I think we do need to try to not just rely on the central bank to, in its wisdom, adjust interest rates, but allow for people to avoid being exposed to inflation risk.
author: Robert J. Shiller

quote: I have no wisdom to share on dating.
author: Rachel Dratch

quote: Writing is no dying art form in America because most published writers here accept the wisdom and the necessity of encouraging the talent that follows in their footsteps.
author: Elizabeth George

quote: In particular, for younger researchers on whom the future of mankind may depend. We believe that they are working with all the scientific wisdom at their disposal for the preservation of the inheritance of the earth and for the lasting survival of mankind.
author: Kenichi Fukui

quote: At sixty, I know little more about wisdom than I did at thirty, but I know a great deal more about folly.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Surely, God on high has not refused to give us enough wisdom to find ways to bring us an improvement in relations between the two great nations on earth.
author: Mikhail Gorbachev

quote: We don't pray for the land. We pray for the humans, all humans... starting with the president, Mohammed Morsi, and all officials, and for God to give everyone wisdom and responsibility to manage the affairs of this country and its people in true Egyptian spirit.
author: Pope Theodoros II

quote: If we can return to a government that the Founders, in their wisdom, envisioned for us, we can return to a government that will allow our economy to thrive again, and our people to live in liberty.
author: Nan Hayworth

quote: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
author: Joseph Prince

quote: While many of us never knew Ronald Reagan personally, we felt close to him because we shared his lighthearted sense of humor, admired his uncommon virtue, and were moved by his remarkable wisdom.
author: Randy Forbes

quote: One reason the human race has such a low opinion of itself is that it gets so much of its wisdom from writers.
author: Wilfrid Sheed

quote: Remembering is painful, it's difficult, but it can be inspiring and it can give wisdom.
author: Paul Greengrass

quote: They are few in the midst of an overwhelming mass of brute force, and their submission is wisdom; but for a nation like England to submit to be robbed by any invader who chooses to visit her shores seemed to me to be nonsense.
author: George Combe

quote: You need to have extraordinary wisdom to be the forerunner.
author: Ma Huateng

quote: In order to have wisdom we must have ignorance.
author: Theodore Dreiser

quote: Government is a contrivance of human wisdom to provide for human wants. People have the right to expect that these wants will be provided for by this wisdom.
author: Jimmy Carter

quote: I like to tell people that I have some of the biggest mentors in the world... they just don't know I exist. Dave Ramsey, Sara Blakely, Oprah, Tony Robbins, Brendon Burchard - I've learned everything I know from their wisdom through books, podcasts and conferences.
author: Rachel Hollis

quote: You can only make sense of the online world by going offline and by getting the wisdom and emotional clarity to know how to make the best use of the Internet.
author: Pico Iyer

quote: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.
author: Plautus

quote: Big money is not a good thing for a little soul: it will only ensnare his feet, and he will fall to his ruin. Wealth is safe only for those who have a wealth of wisdom.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: Though sages may pour out their wisdom's treasure, there is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: The constitutions of Maryland and New York are founded in higher wisdom.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: The sublimity of wisdom is to do those things living, which are to be desired when dying.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: 'Focusing' is no conventional repackaging of self-help wisdom. It is at once a manual and a philosophy. It talks about the body's wisdom, the steps of the focusing technique, how to discover the richness in others by learning to listen.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: The most important lesson of New Labour is this: Every time we made progress we did it by challenging the conventional wisdom.
author: Ed Miliband

quote: Spending two years on my uncle's ranch in Montana as a young man gave me the wisdom and the thrust to do westerns.
author: Robert Duvall

quote: In science, as in art, and, as I believe, in every other sphere of human activity, there may be wisdom in a multitude of counsellors, but it is only in one or two of them.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: If to live is to progress, if you are lucky, from foolishness to wisdom, then to write novels is to broadcast the various stages of your foolishness.
author: Jane Smiley

quote: What is all wisdom save a collection of platitudes?
author: Norman Douglas

quote: What we call wisdom is the result of all the wisdom of past ages. Our best institutions are like young trees growing upon the roots of the old trunks that have crumbled away.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Wisdom prepares for the worst, but folly leaves the worst for the day when it comes.
author: Richard Cecil

quote: The plan was criticized by some retired military officers embedded in TV studios. But with every advance by our coalition forces, the wisdom of that plan becomes more apparent.
author: Dick Cheney

quote: Dr. Johnson has said that the chief glory of a country arises from its authors. But then that is only as they are oracles of wisdom; unless they teach virtue, they are more worthy of a halter than of the laurel.
author: Jane Porter

quote: As great as Ed is, the wisdom out here is that he can't carry a movie. They'll pay him $3 million to be the second banana in Julia Roberts things. But they won't put up $3 million for an Ed Harris movie.
author: George A. Romero

quote: I have sympathy for young people, for their growing pains, but I balk when these growing pains are pushed into the foreground, when you make these young people the only vehicles of life's wisdom.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

quote: The perceived wisdom is that people do not go in large numbers to black-and-white movies anymore - which is a great shame, but I'd love to make a black-and-white movie one day.
author: Sam Mendes

quote: In justice to human society it may perhaps be said of almost all the polities and civil institutions in the world, however imperfect, that they have been founded in and carried on with very considerable wisdom.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: As I visited the various neighborhoods in the campaign, I learned fast that it's a mistake to think that all of the wisdom and possible solutions to our problems are available only in this building.
author: Jane Byrne

quote: If they can prove that I am wrong by that time, I will give it up to their wisdom, but not after to any one's judgment, till I see the end of another year; for the Lord will begin with a new century; and I will see what he will do, before I will hearken to any man's judgment.
author: Joanna Southcott

quote: We have heeded no wisdom offering guidance.
author: Dora Russell

quote: I have tried at every point to seek God's wisdom on the decisions I made, and I made it my business to speak up on behalf of the things God tells us are important to Him.
author: Jesse Helms

quote: Theology in general seems to me a substitution of human ingenuity for divine wisdom.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: Your aim will be knowledge and wisdom, not the reflected glamour of fame.
author: Abbott L. Lowell

quote: As far as feeling freedom in my career now versus five years ago... I think if I feel any more free it's simply because of the experiences that I've had, and the wisdom I've accumulated from that time.
author: Mary Chapin Carpenter

quote: Your art kind of changes as you get older, by nature of the fact that you're hopefully gaining wisdom and you're starting to watch things with a better overview.
author: Sheryl Crow

quote: I continue to believe, contrary to the given wisdom, that it's more interesting to have an album - or, indeed, an individual song - which has variety rather than homogeneity.
author: Peter Hammill

quote: The most excellent and divine counsel, the best and most profitable advertisement of all others, but the least practiced, is to study and learn how to know ourselves. This is the foundation of wisdom and the highway to whatever is good.
author: Pierre Charron

quote: Novels are the Socratic dialogues of our time. Practical wisdom fled from school wisdom into this liberal form.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Raising children is an incredibly hard and risky business in which no cumulative wisdom is gained: each generation repeats the mistakes the previous one made.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: My government, you can be assured, will be less focused on personalities. It is about treating people with respect. I think complaining about the community not being able to see the wisdom of our ideas is the wrong approach.
author: Jay Weatherill

quote: Around '93, '94, the conventional wisdom about the Internet was that it was a toy for academics and researchers. So it was very, very underestimated for about two years.
author: Marc Andreessen

quote: Conventional wisdom on government's role in inequality often has it backwards. Tax reforms have resulted in a more progressive federal income tax; government transfer payments have become less progressive.
author: Paul Ryan

quote: Now our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity were fleeing, and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and the emotions of the times.
author: Chris Christie

quote: In my definition of consciousness, consciousness is the same thing as life. What wisdom traditions also call spirit.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: I learned some valuable lessons about the legislative process, the importance of bipartisan cooperation and the wisdom of taking small steps to get a big job done.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: When I wrote Living in the Light, I wanted to share about how I live my own life and to encourage people to tap into their own inner wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: I don't think you can come into your wisdom until you have made mistakes on your own skin and felt them in reality of your own life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: This society in which we live is radically changing. What previous generations saw as evil is now embraced as being good. It is a dangerous and slippery slope upon which we stand when we reject what Solomon called the beginning of wisdom - the fear of God.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: I don't think I really have any wisdom. Stay out of trouble. Good luck. Stay away from women because they will burn you, haha.
author: Jason Aldean

quote: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another steppingstone to greatness.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Ah, women. They make the highs higher and the lows more frequent.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Women need real moments of solitude and self-reflection to balance out how much of ourselves we give away.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot.
author: John Lennon

quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Any time women come together with a collective intention, it's a powerful thing. Whether it's sitting down making a quilt, in a kitchen preparing a meal, in a club reading the same book, or around the table playing cards, or planning a birthday party, when women come together with a collective intention, magic happens.
author: Phylicia Rashad

quote: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another; but women are by nature enemies.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: In our society, the women who break down barriers are those who ignore limits.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: You see a lot of smart guys with dumb women, but you hardly ever see a smart woman with a dumb guy.
author: Erica Jong

quote: A woman should be like a single flower, not a whole bouquet.
author: Anna Held

quote: Women want mediocre men, and men are working to be as mediocre as possible.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: I write for those women who do not speak, for those who do not have a voice because they were so terrified, because we are taught to respect fear more than ourselves. We've been taught that silence would save us, but it won't.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: I like intelligent women. When you go out, it shouldn't be a staring contest.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: Women will never be as successful as men because they have no wives to advise them.
author: Dick Van Dyke

quote: Women's liberation is the liberation of the feminine in the man and the masculine in the woman.
author: Corita Kent

quote: Men are governed by lines of intellect - women: by curves of emotion.
author: James Joyce

quote: After all those years as a woman hearing 'not thin enough, not pretty enough, not smart enough, not this enough, not that enough,' almost overnight I woke up one morning and thought, 'I'm enough.'
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: To understand how any society functions you must understand the relationship between the men and the women.
author: Angela Davis

quote: But, alas! what poor Woman is ever taught that she should have a higher Design than to get her a Husband?
author: Mary Astell

quote: I'm not denyin' the women are foolish. God Almighty made 'em to match the men.
author: George Eliot

quote: I guess at the end of the day, all women like to be appreciated and treated with respect and kindness.
author: Sofia Vergara

quote: I think today women are very scared to celebrate themselves, because then they just get labeled.
author: Charlize Theron

quote: This man is frank and earnest with women. In Fresno, he's Frank and in Chicago he's Ernest.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: People don't want to see women doing things they don't think women should do.
author: Joan Jett

quote: Women are made to be loved, not understood.
