quote: I actually feel like women in my position, when we have all at our disposal to help us, shouldn't complain when we consider all of the people who are really struggling and don't have the means or support. Many people are single, raising children. That's hard.
author: Angelina Jolie

quote: I've always wanted to do a video of me following a girl down the street. Michael Jackson's done it. Omarion's done it. All these male pop artists have followed women down streets in videos - it's kind of the classic thing. And I was like, there is no video of a girl following a girl down the street. I need to do this at some point in my life.
author: Hayley Kiyoko

quote: To qualify the term 'boss' by adding 'girl' or 'babe' or 'honey' or 'pink' or whatever other ridiculous, antiquated-gender role assignment the media thinks is cute this month, is, at the least, disrespectful and at the worst, damaging to the way young women view themselves and our fight for equality in the business world.
author: Rachel Hollis

quote: I've got cousins galore. Mexicans just spread all their seeds. And the women just pop them out.
author: Jessica Alba

quote: I think if women are visible in the media, truly visible, in an empowered role, it empowers us to be more visible in any area of our lives.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Women were very, very good at 'Pong'. It was part of the dating scene. The number of people who told me they met their wife or husband playing 'Pong' was huge. They were shoulder to shoulder, talking and playing. It was body contact and verbal contact.
author: Nolan Bushnell

quote: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

quote: Christianity, if false, is of no importance, and if true, of infinite importance. The only thing it cannot be is moderately important.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Memory is the way we keep telling ourselves our stories - and telling other people a somewhat different version of our stories.
author: Alice Munro

quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
author: Jane Austen

quote: There is an abiding beauty which may be appreciated by those who will see things as they are and who will ask for no reward except to see.
author: Vera Brittain

quote: Where we love is home - home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: I think you can make fun of anything except things people can't help. They can't help their race or their sex or their age, so you ridicule their pretension or their ego instead. You can ridicule ideas - ideas don't have feelings. You can ridicule an idea that someone holds without hurting them.
author: Ricky Gervais

quote: True love is not a strong, fiery, impetuous passion. It is, on the contrary, an element calm and deep. It looks beyond mere externals, and is attracted by qualities alone. It is wise and discriminating, and its devotion is real and abiding.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.
author: E. B. White

quote: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself. A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Don't dwell on what went wrong. Instead, focus on what to do next. Spend your energies on moving forward toward finding the answer.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty; not knowing what comes next.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: There's no story if there isn't some conflict. The memorable things are usually not how pulled together everybody is. I think everybody feels lonely and trapped sometimes. I would think it's more or less the norm.
author: Wes Anderson

quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Everything is politics.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quote: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring - it was peace.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
author: Warren Bennis

quote: With love and patience, nothing is impossible.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Belief is the death of intelligence.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: Revenge is a sorrow for the person who has to take it on. And the person who is rash enough to think it's going to help a situation is always wrong.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: Capitalism is what is left when beliefs have collapsed at the level of ritual or symbolic elaboration, and all that is left is the consumer-spectator, trudging through the ruins and the relics.
author: Mark Fisher

quote: You can't be unhappy in the middle of a big, beautiful river.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: The great thing about irony is that it splits things apart, gets up above them so we can see the flaws and hypocrisies and duplicates.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: Things are not quite so simple always as black and white.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: The majority of meetings should be discussions that lead to decisions.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: School didn't work for me. I hated it.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: Mathematics allows for no hypocrisy and no vagueness.
author: Stendhal

quote: You will never win if you never begin.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: There are only three things that can kill a farmer: lightning, rolling over in a tractor, and old age.
author: Bill Bryson

quote: London is a city of ghosts; you feel them here. Not just of people, but eras. The ghost of empire, or the blitz, the plague, the smoky ghost of the Great Fire that gave us Christopher Wren's churches and ushered in the Georgian city.
author: A. A. Gill

quote: Since the time of Homer every European, in what he could say about the Orient, was a racist, an imperialist, and almost totally ethnocentric.
author: Edward Said

quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day, a fresh try, one more start, with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: There is a fifth dimension, beyond that which is known to man. It is a dimension as vast as space and as timeless as infinity. It is the middle ground between light and shadow, between science and superstition.
author: Rod Serling

quote: All the world old is queer save thee and me, and even thou art a little queer.
author: Robert Owen

quote: Two children of same cruel parent look at one another and see in each other the image of the cruel parent or the image of their past oppressor. This is very much the case between Jew and Arab: It's a conflict between two victims.
author: Amos Oz

quote: Only by living absurdly is it possible to break out of this infinite absurdity.
author: Julio Cortazar

quote: Being aware of your fear is smart. Overcoming it is the mark of a successful person.
author: Seth Godin

quote: Here is where our real selfhood is rooted, in the divine spark or seed, in the image of God imprinted on the human soul. The True Self is not our creation, but God's. It is the self we are in our depths. It is our capacity for divinity and transcendence.
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use the words.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: What you see is not what others see. We inhabit parallel worlds of perception, bounded by our interests and experience. What is obvious to some is invisible to others.
author: George Monbiot

quote: Donald Trump really understood how to float a story, how to float a rumor, how to manipulate the truth.
author: Jeannette Walls

quote: The best thing that ever happened to me is that nothing happened in writing. I ended up working for engineering companies, and that's where I found my material, in the everyday struggle between capitalism and grace. Being broke and tired, you don't come home your best self.
author: George Saunders

quote: In high school I dated a white woman. She would come to visit me on the rez. And her dad, who was very racist, didn't like that at all. And he told her one time, 'You shouldn't go on the rez if you're white because Indians have a lot of anger in their heart.'
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: Mourning is not forgetting... It is an undoing. Every minute tie has to be untied and something permanent and valuable recovered and assimilated from the dust.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: Creativity requires input, and that's what research is. You're gathering material with which to build.
author: Gene Luen Yang

quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing.
author: Clive James

quote: Every minute of every hour of every day you are making the world, just as you are making yourself, and you might as well do it with generosity and kindness and style.
author: Rebecca Solnit

quote: I get ideas from my own personal experiences, from my imagination, and from my research and from old stories.
author: Mary Pope Osborne

quote: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
author: Sholom Aleichem

quote: Part of courage is simple consistency.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: Tea time is a chance to slow down, pull back and appreciate our surroundings.
author: Letitia Baldrige

quote: If they can get you asking the wrong questions, they don't have to worry about the answers.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: Empathy is about finding echoes of another person in yourself.
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: It's been my policy to view the Internet not as an 'information highway', but as an electronic asylum filled with babbling loonies.
author: Mike Royko

quote: Education is not just about going to school and getting a degree. It's about widening your knowledge and absorbing the truth about life.
author: Shakuntala Devi

quote: The secret to multitasking is that it isn't actually multitasking. It's just extreme focus and organization.
author: Joss Whedon

quote: To swallow and follow, whether old doctrine or new propaganda, is a weakness still dominating the human mind.
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quote: It is a sore point, because you do have advantages if you have access to more than one language. You also have problems, because on bad days you don't trust yourself, either in your first or your second language, and so you feel like a complete halfwit.
author: W. G. Sebald

quote: We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another.
author: Luciano De Crescenzo

quote: People live with the illusion that we have a democratic system, but it's only the outward form of one. In reality we live in a plutocracy, a government of the rich.
author: Jose Saramago

quote: Reading is an exercise in empathy; an exercise in walking in someone else's shoes for a while.
author: Malorie Blackman

quote: Italy was where the soul went to find calm and love, and I wanted to hold the best of it in the palm of my hand.
author: Lisa Brennan-Jobs

quote: You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data.
author: Daniel Keys Moran

quote: If you want to be thought a liar, always tell the truth.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: The big problem for atomic energy is that it can't compete on price with the new age of cheap shale gas and, to a lesser extent, clean coal.
author: Stephen Moore

quote: Yes, though I have nothing but gratitude for my upbringing in the church.
author: John McGahern

quote: I hate to witness animals in captivity - or see circus elephants paraded down the streets. When animals are caged, it's a loss of what they are.
author: K. A. Applegate

quote: Life and death matters, yes. And the question of how to behave in this world, how to go in the face of everything. Time is short and the water is rising.
author: Raymond Carver

quote: It was inevitable that in doing this I should arrive at new results, and it is perhaps understandable that in the end I have felt impelled to present these results not only in the dry form of a catalogue, but also in a more connected and personal one.
author: Alfred Einstein

quote: Of the seven deadly sins, only envy is no fun at all.
author: Joseph Epstein

quote: Nothing is said that has not been said before.
author: Terence

quote: There is an element of autobiography in all fiction in that pain or distress, or pleasure, is based on the author's own. But in my case that is as far as it goes.
author: William Trevor

quote: God is so unique in giving His people ways to fellowship, witness, and remember what a mighty and merciful God He is.
author: Monica Johnson

quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The youth is the hope of our future.
author: Jose Rizal

quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: I hate all politics. I don't like either political party. One should not belong to them - one should be an individual, standing in the middle. Anyone that belongs to a party stops thinking.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: To sit in the shade on a fine day and look upon verdure is the most perfect refreshment.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I know one husband and wife who, whatever the official reasons given to the court for the break up of their marriage, were really divorced because the husband believed that nobody ought to read while he was talking and the wife that nobody ought to talk while she was reading.
author: Vera Brittain

quote: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: I am not a wolf in sheep's clothing, I'm a wolf in wolf's clothing.
author: Ricky Gervais

quote: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: We are fast approaching the stage of the ultimate inversion: the stage where the government is free to do anything it pleases, while the citizens may act only by permission; which is the stage of the darkest periods of human history, the stage of rule by brute force.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Animals are something invented by plants to move seeds around. An extremely yang solution to a peculiar problem which they faced.
author: Terence McKenna

quote: Absences are a good influence in love and keep it bright and delicate.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: We may achieve climate, but weather is thrust upon us.
author: O. Henry

quote: Each day is the scholar of yesterday.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it's thinking of yourself less.
author: Rick Warren

quote: When you're wounded and left on Afghanistan's plains, and the women come out to cut up what remains, jest roll to your rifle and blow out your brains and go to your gawd like a soldier.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: There can be no failure to a man who has not lost his courage, his character, his self respect, or his self-confidence. He is still a King.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: I think people are frightened of saying what they think, and I think that's a bad thing for society.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: If you do enough planning before you start to write, there's no way you can have writer's block. I do a complete chapter by chapter outline.
author: R. L. Stine

quote: In matters of the heart, nothing is true except the improbable.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: I think that quite often you can only find a choice between bad and worse. But I think it's worth making the effort, and I like to expose my characters to that sort of situation.
author: Robert Jordan

quote: If at first you don't succeed, failure may be your style.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: We feel free when we escape - even if it be but from the frying pan to the fire.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: To be successful in life what you need is education, not literacy and degrees.
author: Munshi Premchand

quote: Memories are like mulligatawny soup in a cheap restaurant. It is best not to stir them.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Japan learned from the bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki that the tragedy wrought by nuclear weapons must never be repeated and that humanity and nuclear weapons cannot coexist.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: All phenomena are real in some sense, unreal in some sense, meaningless in some sense, real and meaningless in some sense, unreal and meaningless in some sense, and real and unreal and meaningless in some sense.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: It's odd the things that people remember. Parents will arrange a birthday party, certain it will stick in your mind forever. You'll have a nice time, then two years later you'll be like, 'There was a pony there? Really? And a clown with one leg?'
author: David Sedaris

quote: Children are our second chance to have a great parent-child relationship.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: Corruption is like a ball of snow, once it's set a rolling it must increase.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Some people hear their own inner voices with great clearness. And they live by what they hear. Such people become crazy... or they become legend.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: To achieve the mood of a warrior is not a simple matter. It is a revolution. To regard the lion and the water rats and our fellow men as equals is a magnificent act of a warrior's spirit. It takes power to do that.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: Idealism is like a castle in the air if it is not based on a solid foundation of social and political realism.
author: Claude McKay

quote: The interesting thing is why we're so desperate for this anesthetic against loneliness.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: Small things amuse small minds.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: 'The Immigrant Story,' which took me about twenty-five years to write, was a very simple story, but I couldn't think of how to tell it. Then twenty years after I started it, I found this one page and realized it was going to be the story. That's the only way you get it sometimes.
author: Grace Paley

quote: Compatibility is an achievement of love; it shouldn't be its precondition.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Home is any four walls that enclose the right person.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: It is no use to blame the looking glass if your face is awry.
author: Nikolai Gogol

quote: For me, there is very little difference between magic and art. To me, the ultimate act of magic is to create something from nothing: It's like when the stage magician pulls the rabbit from the hat.
author: Alan Moore

quote: We don't even know how strong we are until we are forced to bring that hidden strength forward. In times of tragedy, of war, of necessity, people do amazing things. The human capacity for survival and renewal is awesome.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: Until the June 1967 war I was completely caught up in the life of a young professor of English. Beginning in 1968, I started to think, write, and travel as someone who felt himself to be directly involved in the renaissance of Palestinian life and politics.
author: Edward Said

quote: It is the loose ends with which men hang themselves.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach. One can collect only a few, and they are more beautiful if they are few.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Man is the creature of circumstances.
author: Robert Owen

quote: The opposite of compromise is fanaticism and death.
author: Amos Oz

quote: Everything can be killed except nostalgia for the kingdom, we carry it in the color of our eyes, in every love affair, in everything that deeply torments and unties and tricks.
author: Julio Cortazar

quote: A desk is a dangerous place from which to view the world.
author: John le Carre

quote: I like being able to see an innocence in people. I see a lot of beauty in youth. Young people are in progress. Their faces and bodies and minds are constantly changing. It's exciting to capture that on film.
author: Bernardo Bertolucci

quote: Bill, The United States is not a company. It is a country.
author: Stewart Alsop

quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: We try, we fail, we posture, we aspire, we pontificate - and then we age, shrink, die, and vanish.
author: George Saunders

quote: No man knows the value of innocence and integrity but he who has lost them.
author: William Godwin

quote: I have lexical-gustatory synesthesia. I can taste, and always have tasted, words. I remember when I was a kid and learning to read I mentioned to my mom that certain words I was learning tasted certain ways, thinking everyone was like that, and didn't understand why she didn't get what I was saying.
author: Kat Timpf

quote: The Boxer Rebellion is a war that was fought on Chinese soil in the year 1900. The Europeans, the Japanese and their Chinese Christian allies were on one side. On the other were poor, starving, illiterate Chinese teenagers whom the Europeans referred to as the Boxers.
author: Gene Luen Yang

quote: To sin by silence, when we should protest, Makes cowards out of men.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: It is only when they go wrong that machines remind you how powerful they are.
author: Clive James

quote: Circles create soothing space, where even reticent people can realize that their voice is welcome.
author: Margaret J. Wheatley

quote: With my writing, I can still play inside an enchanted castle or live inside an old fort. I can run from ghosts or ride dolphins any day of the week.
author: Mary Pope Osborne

quote: When the heart is full, the eyes overflow.
author: Sholom Aleichem

quote: Beware the politically obsessed. They are often bright and interesting, but they have something missing in their natures; there is a hole, an empty place, and they use politics to fill it up. It leaves them somehow misshapen.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: Good manners are cost effective. They not only increase the quality of life in the workplace, they contribute to employee morale, embellish the company image, and play a major role in generating profit.
author: Letitia Baldrige

quote: Paranoia's the garlic in life's kitchen, right: you can never have too much.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: I think I've always been drawn to the second person. When I was growing up and playing with my friends, the usual way we interacted with imaginary worlds was as characters: a bench was 'your' boat, leaves on a lawn were the fins of sharks out to get 'you.'
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: Hating the Yankees is as American as pizza pie, unwed mothers, and cheating on your income tax.
author: Mike Royko

quote: Without mathematics, there's nothing you can do. Everything around you is mathematics. Everything around you is numbers.
author: Shakuntala Devi

quote: I was just very interested in the American frontier and the growth of capitalism - those enormous fortunes that were being made, more often than not, on the blood of poor people, black people, Indian people. They were the ones who paid very dearly for those great fortunes.
author: Peter Matthiessen

quote: The anguish of the neurotic individual is the same as that of the saint. The neurotic, the saint are engaged in the same battle. Their blood flows from similar wounds. But the first one gasps and the other one gives.
author: Georges Bataille

quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something, while to secure it in this world we must do something.
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quote: We learn more by looking for the answer to a question and not finding it than we do from learning the answer itself.
author: Lloyd Alexander

quote: Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are.
author: Jose Saramago

quote: I wanted to be a pilot. I loved flying and I loved all the technology and the equipment and the sense of adventure that came with it. I think that feeling still bleeds over into everything I do today.
author: Graham Brown

quote: I dunno whether it was to do with my parents - we were working-class - but it was important to me to be self-sufficient.
author: Ian Rankin

quote: The universe is not fair and it is never going to be fair.
author: Daniel Keys Moran

quote: I prefer listening to talking, reading to socializing, and cozy chats to group settings.
author: Susan Cain

quote: I just want to be remembered as a person who loved God, who served others more than he served himself, who was trying to grow in maturity and stability.
author: Mike Yaconelli

quote: You climb to reach the summit, but once there, discover that all roads lead down.
author: Stanislaw Lem

quote: Amongst Women concentrated on the family, and the new book concentrates on a small community. The dominant units in Irish society are the family and the locality. The idea was that the whole world would grow out from that small space.
author: John McGahern

quote: Oh, my ways are strange ways and new ways and old ways, And deep ways and steep ways and high ways and low, I'm at home and at ease on a track that I know not, And restless and lost on a road that I know.
author: Henry Lawson

quote: I think all writers write from the time they're really young, and you just start asking the question, 'What if?'
author: K. A. Applegate

quote: If a church offers no truth that is not available in the general culture - in, for instance, the editorials of the New York Times or, for that matter, of National Review - there is not much reason to pay it attention.
author: Richard John Neuhaus

quote: One of the pleasures of being a Jew, I don't have to tell you, it allows you anti-Semitism.
author: Joseph Epstein

quote: The capacity you're thinking of is imagination; without it there can be no understanding, indeed no fiction.
author: William Trevor

quote: There is a strange kind of human being in whom there is an eternal struggle between body and soul, animal and god, for dominance. In all great men this mixture is striking, and in none more so than in Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.
author: Alfred Einstein

quote: If the thrill of hunting were in the hunt, or even in the marksmanship, a camera would do just as well.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: I think there is pressure on people to turn every negative into a positive, but we should be allowed to say, 'I went through something really strange and awful and it has altered me forever.'
author: Marian Keyes

quote: Regret is not a proactive feeling. It is situated in disappointment, sorrow, even remorse. It merely wishes things were different without an act to cause a difference. However, repentance is different. Repentance is an admission of, hatred of, and turning away from sin before God.
author: Monica Johnson

quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
author: Voltaire

quote: Politics have no relation to morals.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: I never guess. It is a shocking habit destructive to the logical faculty.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Revenge is an act of passion; vengeance of justice. Injuries are revenged; crimes are avenged.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I want to do with you what spring does with cherry trees.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: We have normality. I repeat, we have normality. Anything you still can't cope with is therefore your own problem.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: And when it rains on your parade, look up rather than down. Without the rain, there would be no rainbow.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today. Have you used one to say 'thank you?'
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: I used to be a classic workaholic, and after seeing how little work and career really mean when you reach the end of your life, I put a new emphasis on things I believe count more. These things include: family, friends, being part of a community, and appreciating the little joys of the average day.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: People say that if you find water rising up to your ankle, that's the time to do something about it, not when it's around your neck.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: The heart is forever making the head its fool.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Luck is not something you can mention in the presence of self-made men.
author: E. B. White

quote: Excellence is not a skill, it's an attitude.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: A smile is the light in your window that tells others that there is a caring, sharing person inside.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: You never know God is all you need until God is all you have.
author: Rick Warren

quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward, but it is the journey that matters in the end.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: I have a way of filming things and staging them and designing sets. There were times when I thought I should change my approach, but in fact, this is what I like to do. It's sort of like my handwriting as a movie director. And somewhere along the way, I think I've made the decision: I'm going to write in my own handwriting.
author: Wes Anderson

quote: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something better tomorrow.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Letting go helps us to to live in a more peaceful state of mind and helps restore our balance. It allows others to be responsible for themselves and for us to take our hands off situations that do not belong to us. This frees us from unnecessary stress.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: The problem with looking in the mirror is that you never know how you will feel about what you see. Sometimes, when my hormones are out of sync, I have no interest in the mirror, and if I do look I think everything is all wrong. Other times, I am quite pleased with what I see.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: A good idea will keep you awake during the morning, but a great idea will keep you awake during the night.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: The more I see of men the more I like dogs.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: I'm not certain that I draw from any one culture more than others. Many myths and legends of many different cultures are really the same story when you get to the heart of it. They are often cultural cautionary tales about how we should behave and how we should live.
author: Robert Jordan

quote: Propaganda does not deceive people; it merely helps them to deceive themselves.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: People are so selfish. Those you help are the ones who turn against you.
author: Munshi Premchand

quote: Why don't you get a haircut? You look like a chrysanthemum.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Suddenly, I became conscious of the fact that the driver was in the act of pulling up the horses in the courtyard of a vast ruined castle, from whose tall black windows came no ray of light, and whose broken battlements showed a jagged line against the sky.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: If you're a liberal, anything you say is protected. If you're a conservative, anything you say is hateful.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: I have felt cats rubbing their faces against mine and touching my cheek with claws carefully sheathed. These things, to me, are expressions of love.
author: James Herriot

quote: Diversity is about all of us, and about us having to figure out how to walk through this world together.
author: Jacqueline Woodson

quote: Sometimes paranoia's just having all the facts.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Upon the clothes behind the tenement, That hang like ghosts suspended from the lines, Linking each flat, but to each indifferent, Incongruous and strange the moonlight shines.
author: Claude McKay

quote: Lust and greed are more gullible than innocence.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: While we teach, we learn.
author: Seneca

quote: I believe in a kind of fidelity to your own early ideas; it's a kind of antagonism in me to prevailing fads.
author: Grace Paley

quote: Humans are the big thing that cause damage in life - in war or whatever - and if I can get away from that and into a wilderness situation, I'm OK. You can more or less live on your own merit.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: The pleasures of love are always in proportion to our fears.
author: Stendhal

quote: A man never knows how to say goodbye; a woman never knows when to say it.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: I still enjoy traveling a lot. I mean, it amazes me that I still get excited in hotel rooms just to see what kind of shampoo they've left me.
author: Bill Bryson

quote: We have to thank the members of the Romantic movement for the sober colours of suits. It was their love of the Gothic that put us in grey and black but the suit stuck.
author: A. A. Gill

quote: What I fear most is power with impunity. I fear abuse of power, and the power to abuse.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: I have been unable to live an uncommitted or suspended life. I have not hesitated to declare my affiliation with an extremely unpopular cause.
author: Edward Said

quote: She was a handsome woman of forty-five and would remain so for many years.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: It may be said with a degree of assurance that not everything that meets the eye is as it appears.
author: Rod Serling

quote: I find the family the most mysterious and fascinating institution in the world.
author: Amos Oz

quote: Marketing is a contest for people's attention.
author: Seth Godin

quote: On weekends, I sit in a lounge chair on my balcony. I love to be outside when the weather's right. I can stay there pretty much all day.
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: I remember being young in the 1960s... we had a great sense of the future, a great big hope. This is what is missing in the youth today. This being able to dream and to change the world.
author: Bernardo Bertolucci

quote: One-planet living means not only seeking to reduce our own consumption, but also mobilising against the system that promotes the great tide of junk. This means fighting corporate power, changing political outcomes and challenging the growth-based, world-consuming system we call capitalism.
author: George Monbiot

quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy person has no time to form.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: When I was 23, I went to Alaska by myself into the glaciers of the coast range and climbed a mountain by myself. It was incredibly reckless, incredibly stupid. But I was lucky. And I survived, and I came back to tell my story.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: Justice is the sum of all moral duty.
author: William Godwin

quote: There is no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can circumvent or hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: See, as a libertarian, I am actually far more liberal on the issue of immigration than many people might expect.
author: Kat Timpf

quote: It takes an endless amount of history to make even a little tradition.
author: Henry James

quote: Bores put you in a mental cemetery while you are still walking.
author: Elsa Maxwell

quote: Determination, energy, and courage appear spontaneously when we care deeply about something. We take risks that are unimaginable in any other context.
author: Margaret J. Wheatley

quote: Language exerts hidden power, like the moon on the tides.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Home is, in the end, not just the place where you sleep, but the place where you stand.
author: Pico Iyer

quote: Great minds are to make others great. Their superiority is to be used, not to break the multitude to intellectual vassalage, not to establish over them a spiritual tyranny, but to rouse them from lethargy, and to aid them to judge for themselves.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Let me be unambiguous. I prefer not to be photographed.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: There is so much bad manners and oafishness in large corporations.
author: Letitia Baldrige

quote: Jealousy is a dog's bark which attracts thieves.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: There is only one way to solve the alleged crisis of the erosion of 'family values.' And that is to get right down to the root cause of the problem.
author: Mike Royko

quote: My three years in politics was very instructive about the way in which the appetite for political power can destroy a human mind, destroy principles and values, and transform people into little monsters.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: Like all young men I set out to be a genius, but mercifully laughter intervened.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: In the history of postwar German writing, for the first 15 or 20 years, people avoided mentioning political persecution - the incarceration and systematic extermination of whole peoples and groups in society. Then, from 1965, this became a preoccupation of writers - not always in an acceptable form.
author: W. G. Sebald

quote: In an effort to create a culture within my classroom where students feel safe sharing the intimacies of their own silences, I have four core principles posted on the board that sits in the front of my class, which every student signs at the beginning of the year: read critically, write consciously, speak clearly, tell your truth.
author: Clint Smith

quote: And almost always there has to be change, change in the characters is the journey - it's the story.
author: Graham Brown

quote: It was a beautiful custom. When a person who had a break of good luck entered a cafe and ordered a cup of coffee, he didn't pay just for one, but for two cups, allowing someone less fortunate who entered later to have a cup of coffee for free.
author: Luciano De Crescenzo

quote: There is a saying: 'The child is parent to the adult', which means whatever happens to you as a child or teenager affects the adult you become. You are forged in your history. And fiction is an incredibly important force in shaping children, and that's why fiction needs to be diverse.
author: Malorie Blackman

quote: Even when the attention focused on me is positive, I am uncomfortable being looked at by a lot of people - it's just not my natural state of being.
author: Susan Cain

quote: I think satire is most effective when you love the thing you're satirizing rather than... have a vendetta against it.
author: Mike Yaconelli

quote: Do not trust people. They are capable of greatness.
author: Stanislaw Lem

quote: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people, and greatly assists the circulation of the blood.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: And opposite the bench, the dock, divided by a partition, with the women to the left and the men to the right, as it is on the stairs or the block in polite society.
author: Henry Lawson

quote: I think we have a real obligation when we do have animals in captivity to understand their needs and to care for them as well as we can.
author: K. A. Applegate

quote: Religion as a human phenomenon is as riddled through with potential for both good and evil as any other phenomenon.
author: Richard John Neuhaus

quote: By the way, the secret of speaking French is confidence. Whether you are right or wrong, you don't hesitate.
author: Joseph Epstein

quote: I value mothers and motherhood enormously. For every inattentive or abusive mother in my fiction I think you'll find a dozen or so who are neither.
author: William Trevor

quote: Sometimes the picture that emerges of the man seems no longer to agree with our conception of the musician. In reality, however, there is a glorious unity.
author: Alfred Einstein

quote: There is a glaring reason that the necessary total ban on nontherapeutic use of antibiotics hasn't happened: The factory farm industry, allied with the pharmaceutical industry, has more power than public-health professionals.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Optimism can be relearnt.
author: Marian Keyes

quote: If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: On some great and glorious day the plain folks of the land will reach their heart's desire at last, and the White House will be adorned by a downright moron.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious, and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't try to do things. You simply must do things.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Very few of us are what we seem.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It may be that our role on this planet is not to worship God - but to create him.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: In my own work, I tend to cover a lot of time and to jump back and forward in time, and sometimes the way I do this is not very straightforward.
author: Alice Munro

quote: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Meek wifehood is no part of my profession; I am your friend, but never your possession.
author: Vera Brittain

quote: I was a workaholic. I never stopped. I lived in fifth gear. I bought cars. I invested in stocks. I made more money than I had ever imagined.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: To reach a port we must sail, sometimes with the wind, and sometimes against it. But we must not drift or lie at anchor.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Proper stupidity is fascinating.
author: Ricky Gervais

quote: If you lose Heaven, you lose everything; if you gain Heaven, you gain everything.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: Hypocrisy is the homage vice pays to virtue.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Ethics and equity and the principles of justice do not change with the calendar.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: It is not in the pursuit of happiness that we find fulfillment, it is in the happiness of pursuit.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Morning comes whether you set the alarm or not.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: That's the kind of movie that I like to make, where there is an invented reality and the audience is going to go someplace where hopefully they've never been before. The details, that's what the world is made of.
author: Wes Anderson

quote: Don't wait for extraordinary opportunities. Seize common occasions and make them great. Weak men wait for opportunities; strong men make them.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Don't violate your own code of values and ethics, but don't waste energy trying to make other people violate theirs.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Girls are socialised in ways that are harmful to their sense of self - to reduce themselves, to cater to the egos of men, to think of their bodies as repositories of shame. As adult women, many struggle to overcome, to unlearn, much of that social conditioning.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

quote: I can't divorce myself from my childhood. I try to write as much fiction as I possibly can, but there are so many things that are touchstones of my childhood like being on the swim team and playing soccer and the particularities of sports season and environments that make their way into my books.
author: Jeff Kinney

quote: I think I've never stopped feeling like a kid.
author: Stan Lee

quote: He who can destroy a thing, can control a thing.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: Success is achieved by developing our strengths, not by eliminating our weaknesses.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: Time cools, time clarifies; no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quote: Delusional pain hurts just as much as pain from actual trauma. So what if it's all in your head?
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Happiness is the longing for repetition.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Leaders are people who do the right thing; managers are people who do things right.
author: Warren Bennis

quote: Of course I'm crazy, but that doesn't mean I'm wrong.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: My sister Tiffany told me years ago, 'You can never write about me.' Then she called six months ago and said she wanted to be in a story. She was worried people thought I didn't like her.
author: David Sedaris

quote: I want to be able to say what's on my mind and in my heart and what I think is helpful and useful without somebody getting angry, some special interest group deciding this is the time to silence a voice of dissent and attack affiliates, attack sponsors. I'm sort of done with that.
author: Laura Schlessinger

quote: The Great Migration can get forgotten if we don't pay attention or bear witness to it. It's part of my personal history and the history of millions of African Americans who left those oppressive conditions for better lives in the North. It's important to put that on the page.
author: Jacqueline Woodson

quote: Hustlers of the world, there is one mark you cannot beat: the mark inside.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: A man of knowledge lives by acting, not by thinking about acting.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: Nothing you do for children is ever wasted. They seem not to notice us, hovering, averting our eyes, and they seldom offer thanks, but what we do for them is never wasted.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: TV's 'real' agenda is to be 'liked,' because if you like what you're seeing, you'll stay tuned. TV is completely unabashed about this; it's its sole raison.
author: David Foster Wallace

quote: Any human anywhere will blossom in a hundred unexpected talents and capacities simply by being given the opportunity to do so.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Yes, I've been in an igloo. They're surprisingly cozy and warm - small, though, you can't really stand up in some.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: The shepherd always tries to persuade the sheep that their interests and his own are the same.
author: Stendhal

quote: Always think of what is useful and not what is beautiful. Beauty will come of its own accord.
author: Nikolai Gogol

quote: There'd never been a more advantageous time to be a criminal in America than during the 13 years of Prohibition. At a stroke, the American government closed down the fifth largest industry in the United States - alcohol production - and just handed it to criminals - a pretty remarkable thing to do.
author: Bill Bryson

quote: Frightened is the natural state for all men.
author: A. A. Gill

quote: Writing is a calling, not a choice.
author: Isabel Allende

quote: Every girl should use what Mother Nature gave her before Father Time takes it away.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Marriage is like paying an endless visit in your worst clothes.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Never argue; repeat your assertion.
author: Robert Owen

quote: There are weapons that are simply thoughts. For the record, prejudices can kill and suspicion can destroy.
author: Rod Serling

quote: And do you accept the idea that there is no explanation?
author: Julio Cortazar

quote: I learned a long time ago that some people would rather die than forgive. It's a strange truth, but forgiveness is a painful and difficult process. It's not something that happens overnight. It's an evolution of the heart.
author: Sue Monk Kidd

quote: Comprehension follows perception.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: Microsoft has a monopoly over the desktop operating systems.
author: Stewart Alsop

quote: My father, Rex, was one of the most charismatic human beings I've ever known, and also one of the most brilliant.
author: Jeannette Walls

quote: Happiness means nothing to me. I just want to have meaning and purpose.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: Don't live up to your stereotypes.
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: I'm a cartoonist. I write and draw comic books and graphic novels. I'm also a coder.
author: Gene Luen Yang

quote: My later jobs as a waitress felt like a posh paradise after my first one at Boston Market.
author: Kat Timpf

quote: Deep experience is never peaceful.
author: Henry James

quote: I walk wherever my errands take me.
author: Rebecca Solnit

quote: Whoever called snooker 'chess with balls' was rude, but right.
author: Clive James

quote: I love reading all kinds of books. I usually have about ten books going at any one time - books about the past, the present, novels, non-fiction, poetry, mythology, religion, etc. Reading is my favorite thing to do.
author: Mary Pope Osborne

quote: No matter how bad things get you got to go on living, even if it kills you.
author: Sholom Aleichem

quote: Candor is a compliment; it implies equality. It's how true friends talk.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: She would give them order. She would create constellations.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: I believe that education is the greatest equalizer; thus, I will continue to fight to equalize the playing field in an educational atmosphere that is not always level!
author: Erin Gruwell

quote: The world seems concerned with Pakistan primarily as an actor in global attempts to combat terrorism.
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: Whether one eats a cat or not is a personal choice, and I don't want to sway anyone one way or another. But if you do, there is one obvious cooking tip: Always remember to remove the bell from the cat's collar before cooking.
author: Mike Royko

quote: I think that literature has the important effect of creating free, independent, critical citizens who cannot be manipulated.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: In my relations with my father, which are difficult and where I'm often met by coolness and indifference, I am constantly tempted to be cold and indifferent. Yet I know that this is a test if I could take it rightly.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: Pleasure only starts once the worm has got into the fruit, to become delightful happiness must be tainted with poison.
author: Georges Bataille

quote: Unless a man undertakes more than he possibly can do, he will never do all he can do.
author: Henry Drummond

quote: I always read the translator's draft all the way through - a very laborious business.
author: W. G. Sebald

quote: This idea of shared humanity and the connections that we make with one another - that's what, in fact, makes life worth living.
author: Clint Smith

quote: Writing itself is a dream. There are days of self doubt and deadlines and wondering how you're going to pay the bills until you write that bestseller. But it's still the best job I've ever had. I've also been able to help a lot of people and even inspire a few and that feels great.
author: Graham Brown

quote: I have a concept of Naples that is not so much of a city, per se, but rather an ingredient of the human spirit that I detect in everyone, Neapolitan or not. The idea that 'Neapolitanism' and mass ignorance are somehow indissolubly linked is one that I am prepared to fight with all the strength I have.
author: Luciano De Crescenzo

quote: Life isn't about quantity, it's about quality.
author: Malorie Blackman

quote: In a way, education by its nature favours the extrovert because you are taking kids and putting them into a big classroom, which is automatically going to be a high-stimulation environment. Probably the best way of teaching in general is one on one, but that's not something everyone can afford.
author: Susan Cain

quote: One of the key principles of Trumponomics is that faster economic growth can help solve a multitude of other social and economic problems, from poverty to inner-city decline to lowering the national debt.
author: Stephen Moore

quote: When you're in danger of losing a thing it becomes precious and when it's around us, it's in tedious abundance and we take it for granted as if we're going to live forever, which we're not.
author: John McGahern

quote: Where do consequences lead? Depends on the escort.
author: Stanislaw Lem

quote: The Giraffe took the horse's head and led him along on the most level parts of the road towards the railway station, and two or three chaps went along to help get the sick man into the train.
author: Henry Lawson

quote: I started to write in 2001. I wrote the books for the fun of it. It was an old idea I had had since the nineties.
author: Stieg Larsson

quote: Biases and blind spots exist in big data as much as they do in individual perceptions and experiences. Yet there is a problematic belief that bigger data is always better data and that correlation is as good as causation.
author: Kate Crawford

quote: The number of ways you can live in one lifetime is limitless. So why limit yourself? The sky is NOT the limit. Beyond the universe is.
author: Suzy Kassem

quote: The cultural expectation should be if there's infidelity, the marriage is more important than fidelity.
author: Dan Savage

quote: Fortune favors the brave.
author: Terence

quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

quote: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Human greatness does not lie in wealth or power, but in character and goodness. People are just people, and all people have faults and shortcomings, but all of us are born with a basic goodness.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful what we pretend to be.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: Where large sums of money are concerned, it is advisable to trust nobody.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Society cares for the individual only so far as he is profitable.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: You are 27 or 28 right? It is very tough to live at that age. When nothing is sure. I have sympathy with you.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: There is hardly anything in the world that some man cannot make a little worse and sell a little cheaper, and the people who consider price only are this man's lawful prey.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Tolerance is the virtue of the man without convictions.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: If you can imagine it, you can achieve it. If you can dream it, you can become it.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: If you are fully alive to the prospect of dying, you really start reprioritising your life.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: The greatest want of the world is the want of men - men who will not be bought or sold; men who in their inmost souls are true and honest; men who do not fear to call sin by its right name; men whose conscience is as true to duty as the needle to the pole; men who will stand for the right though the heavens fall.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: Too great haste to repay an obligation is a kind of ingratitude.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it. Do not count on them. Leave them alone.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: The world is full of people who have never, since childhood, met an open doorway with an open mind.
author: E. B. White

quote: Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: As long as we are persistence in our pursuit of our deepest destiny, we will continue to grow. We cannot choose the day or time when we will fully bloom. It happens in its own time.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: It is said that love makes the world go 'round - the announcement lacks verification. It's wind from the dinner horn that does it.
author: O. Henry

quote: Where there is unity there is always victory.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I'm like a snake sleeping on a rock. I won't bother you unless you poke a stick at me.
author: Harlan Ellison

quote: Down to Gehenna, or up to the Throne, He travels the fastest who travels alone.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Think you of the fact that a deaf person cannot hear. Then, what deafness may we not all possess? What senses do we lack that we cannot see and cannot hear another world all around us?
author: Frank Herbert

quote: America is made of different races and different religions, but we're all co-travelers on the spaceship Earth and must respect and help each other along the way.
author: Stan Lee

quote: Few things can make us feel crazier than expecting something from someone who has nothing to give.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Great minds have purposes; others have wishes.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Well, when I was 13, for my bar mitzvah I received my first typewriter. And that was special.
author: R. L. Stine

quote: A writer is somebody for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: You don't start out writing good stuff. You start out writing crap and thinking it's good stuff, and then gradually you get better at it. That's why I say one of the most valuable traits is persistence.
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Trees bear fruits only to be eaten by others; the fields grown grains, but they are consumed by the world. Cows give milk, but she doesn't drink it herself - that is left to others. Clouds send rain only to quench the parched earth. In such giving, there is little space for selfishness.
author: Munshi Premchand

quote: I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Leaders keep their eyes on the horizon, not just on the bottom line.
author: Warren Bennis

quote: I was in love with the whole world and all that lived in its rainy arms.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: And so we remained till the red of the dawn began to fall through the snow gloom. I was desolate and afraid, and full of woe and terror. But when that beautiful sun began to climb the horizon life was to me again.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: Sometimes a disappearance can be more haunting than an apparition.
author: Mark Fisher

quote: I could do terrible things to people who dump unwanted animals by the roadside.
author: James Herriot

quote: After a lifetime of world travel I've been fascinated that those in the third world don't have the same perception of reality that we do.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: It's a shallow life that doesn't give a person a few scars.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: Romance is tempestuous. Love is calm.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
author: Seneca

quote: Teamwork requires some sacrifice up front; people who work as a team have to put the collective needs of the group ahead of their individual interests.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: I was raised on farms by people who didn't have Wal-Mart. They had to make their own sleds, harnesses, clothing, etc.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: People happy in love have an air of intensity.
author: Stendhal

quote: Jealousy is the tie that binds, and binds, and binds.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: One reason I quit doing interviews after years and years and years was because I was making things up.
author: Bernie Taupin

quote: I can't imagine there has ever been a more gratifying time or place to be alive than America in the 1950s. No country had ever known such prosperity.
author: Bill Bryson

quote: If New York is a wise guy, Paris a coquette, Rome a gigolo and Berlin a wicked uncle, then London is an old lady who mutters and has the second sight. She is slightly deaf, and doesn't suffer fools gladly.
author: A. A. Gill

quote: I don't myself believe in a two-state solution. I believe in a one-state solution.
author: Edward Said

quote: I grew up in a very large family in a very small house. I never slept alone until after I was married.
author: Lewis Grizzard

quote: Accidents, try to change them - it's impossible. The accidental reveals man.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: It is only in solitude that I ever find my own core.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: You never lose by loving. You always lose by holding back.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: I just don't have this magnetic personality that everyone is drawn to. I don't make friends easily... I'm just not one of those people.
author: Nathan Fielder

quote: A committee is an animal with four back legs.
author: John le Carre

quote: Why have we had to invent Eden, to live submerged in the nostalgia of a lost paradise, to make up utopias, propose a future for ourselves?
author: Julio Cortazar

quote: We are living in a computer-programmed reality, and the only clue we have to it is when some variable is changed, and some alteration in reality occurs. We have the overwhelming impression that we were reliving the present - deja vu.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: We should be cautious about embracing data before it is published in the academic press, and must always avoid treating correlation as causation.
author: George Monbiot

quote: The thing that is most beautiful about Antarctica for me is the light. It's like no other light on Earth, because the air is so free of impurities. You get drugged by it, like when you listen to one of your favorite songs. The light there is a mood-enhancing substance.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: Law is made for man and not man for the law. Wherever we can be sure that the most valuable interests of a nation require that we should decide one way, that way we ought to decide.
author: William Godwin

quote: Rock and roll might be summed up as monotony tinged with hysteria.
author: Vance Packard

quote: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: He did not arrive at this conclusion by the decent process of quiet, logical deduction, nor yet by the blinding flash of glorious intuition, but by the shoddy, untidy process halfway between the two by which one usually gets to know things.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: The truth of the matter is, 'uncomfortable' does not equal 'unsafe,' and 'disagreement' does not equal 'danger.'
author: Kat Timpf

quote: For millions of years, this world has been a great gift to nearly everything living on it, a planet whose atmosphere, temperature, air, water, seasons, and weather were precisely calibrated to allow us - the big us, including forests and oceans, species large and small - to flourish.
author: Rebecca Solnit

quote: Thinking is the place where intelligent actions begin. We pause long enough to look more carefully at a situation, to see more of its character, to think about why it's happening, to notice how it's affecting us and others.
author: Margaret J. Wheatley

quote: Morals are private. Decency is public.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: One good anecdote is worth a volume of biography.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Don't fall in love with politicians, they're all a disappointment. They can't help it, they just are.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: There was no difference between the behavior of a god and the operations of pure chance.
author: Thomas Pynchon

quote: When I travel, I feel more like a nomad than a tourist.
author: Mohsin Hamid

quote: Stupidity is an elemental force for which no earthquake is a match.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: To write is a relief from life's problems. It is a way in which you revenge yourself. In art, the writer achieves utopia. But any attempt to achieve social utopia is bound to catastrophe. If you want a society of saints, the result is hell, repression, totalitarianism, and persecution.
author: Mario Vargas Llosa

quote: History is an endless repetition of the wrong way of living.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: Using the device of an imaginary world allows me in some strange way to go to the central issues - it's one of many ways to express feelings about real people, about real human relationships.
author: Lloyd Alexander

quote: I don't have many friends. It's not because I'm a misanthrope. It's because I'm reserved. I'm self-contained. I get all my adventures in my head when I'm writing my books.
author: Ian Rankin

quote: I think when money starts to corrupt journalism, it undermines the journalism, and it undermines the credibility of the product, and you end up not succeeding.
author: Walter Isaacson

quote: What kind of world is this that can send machines to Mars and does nothing to stop the killing of a human being?
author: Jose Saramago

quote: To write well you must be willing to go naked into the world.
author: Daniel Keys Moran

quote: One problem with age is that patience begins to ebb.
author: Carl Hiaasen

quote: I always try to tell a good story, one with a compelling plot that will keep the pages turning. That is my first and primary goal. Sometimes I can tackle an issue-homelessness, tobacco litigation, insurance fraud, the death penalty-and wrap a good story around it.
author: John Grisham

quote: To torture a man you have to know his pleasures.
author: Stanislaw Lem

quote: Federal employees are not rewarded for performance or excellence or results but, rather, for showing up, and often times, they don't even do that.
author: Stephen Moore

quote: It is quite time that our children were taught a little more about their country, for shame's sake.
author: Henry Lawson

quote: Every year Swedish society produces a new generation of threatened women who can testify to the lack of legal rights and the lukewarm interest shown by the police and other authorities.
author: Stieg Larsson

quote: Data and data sets are not objective; they are creations of human design. We give numbers their voice, draw inferences from them, and define their meaning through our interpretations.
author: Kate Crawford

quote: It's rarely talked about, but hunting for sport is just about as vile as we humans get.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Lovers quarrels are the renewal of love.
author: Terence

quote: We may think there is willpower involved, but more likely... change is due to want power. Wanting the new addiction more than the old one. Wanting the new me in preference to the person I am now.
author: George A. Sheehan

quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Behavior is the mirror in which everyone shows their image.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: I see the world being slowly transformed into a wilderness; I hear the approaching thunder that, one day, will destroy us too. I feel the suffering of millions. And yet, when I look up at the sky, I somehow feel that everything will change for the better, that this cruelty too shall end, that peace and tranquility will return once more.
author: Anne Frank

quote: I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: One doesn't recognize the really important moments in one's life until it's too late.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: No one is more arrogant toward women, more aggressive or scornful, than the man who is anxious about his virility.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: You have to dream intentionally. Most people dream a dream when they are asleep. But to be a writer, you have to dream while you are awake, intentionally.
author: Haruki Murakami

quote: The highest reward for a person's toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: I have never kept diaries. I just remember a lot and am more self-centered than most people.
author: Alice Munro

quote: A woman uses her intelligence to find reasons to support her intuition.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Science is constantly proved all the time. If we take something like any fiction, any holy book, and destroyed it, in a thousand years' time, that wouldn't come back just as it was. Whereas if we took every science book and every fact and destroyed them all, in a thousand years they'd all be back because all the same tests would be the same result.
author: Ricky Gervais

quote: A Christian reveals true humility by showing the gentleness of Christ, by being always ready to help others, by speaking kind words and performing unselfish acts, which elevate and ennoble the most sacred message that has come to our world.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: The only thing we have learnt from experience is that we learn nothing from experience.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: The stars shall fade away, the sun himself Grow dim with age, and nature sink in years, But thou shalt flourish in immortal youth, Unhurt amidst the wars of elements, The wrecks of matter, and the crush of worlds.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Turn up the lights. I don't want to go home in the dark.
author: O. Henry
